loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba is a peddler of used clothing. She sells the clothing at a village in Elmana Cape Coast Called Nkontrodo. She is divorced and has two children. 

Araba is responsible for the education, feeding and clothing of her children. Her loan will be used to purchase large amounts of used clothes for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase large amounts of used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 40 years old, divorced and has six children, none of whom are currently in school. Joseph has a small retail shop, which he has run for five years. He also has a second business selling clothes.
To help expand his business, Joseph has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities, such as soap, for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Joseph hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for his family. In the future, he hopes to expand his business further.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities, such as soap, for resale.

loans.name: Demna

texts.en:
Demna is 49 years old and is a married woman with a 14-year-old child. She is a farmer working in the town of Banga, South Cotabato. She grows rice crops to sell. Demna also buys coconuts and makes copra.

Demna has requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. This will help Demna improve her harvest.

In the future, Demna hopes to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Jesse

texts.en:
Jesse has been selling boiled eggs for the last three years. Thanks to Faulu Kenya he has been able to learn how to manage both his business and finances. Jesse is a hard-working, aggressive, and focused 26-year-old. He is married and blessed with one child. In the next five years, he hopes to have a better business premises. 

He needs a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy eggs at wholesale.

loans.use: To buy eggs

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es:
Maria tiene 64 años de edad, ella es viuda y tiene 10 hijos todos ellos son independientes, uno de ellos vive cerca a su casa.  María cuenta con casa propia y está ubicada en una comunidad pequeña en vías de desarrollo en el Caserío Alto Medano del distrito de Mórrope, donde solo cuenta con servicio de energía eléctrica y agua potable.

María se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales desde hace varios años, ella cría ganado vacuno, ovino y algunas aves de corral en la parte posterior de su domicilio, pues para esto tiene sus corrales bien establecidos donde alberga de forma eficiente sus animales y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. 

Ella desea  comprar más ganado para su cría  con su respectivo alimento balanceado y de esta manera ir  incrementando sus ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

María es una  madre bastante entregada a su trabajo y que siempre por alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño
texts.en:
Maria, 64, is widowed and has 10 children all of whom are independent, though one lives close to her home. Maria has her own home located in a small, developing community in the village of Alto Medano in the district of Morrope. The only basic services that they have are electricity and potable water.

For some years now, Maria has raised and sold animals. She raises cows, sheep and chickens in the back of her home. She has well-established corrals where she efficiently houses her animals, and when they are grown enough she sells them to the businessmen that usually visit the area where she lives.

She wants to buy more cattle to raise, along with their respective balanced feed. This way she will keep increasing her income. For this reason she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles.

Maria is mother who is dedicated to her work and is always striving for a better quality of life. People who know her have a lot of respect and affection for her.

loans.use: to buy cattle to raise and balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Thaer

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 23 years old, single and lives with four family members.

Thaer has been an owner of a food market since 2009, selling soft drinks, juices, sweets, cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He decided to apply for a $2,000 loan in order to make a sliding door and to add more foodstuffs to his market. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to make a sliding door and to add more foodstuffs to his market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fresh fish and corn for making banku.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 41-year-old married mother of three children. She runs a retail store and a poultry farm in Mariakani. Her shop business has been in operation for fourteen years.

Jane has been a KADET client and this is her fifth loan borrowed to finance her business. With this loan, she plans to expand her business by purchasing stock of flour, margarine, sugar and rice.

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and pay for her family’s upkeep.  Her dream is to become a successful business lady and to educate her children to university level.

loans.use: purchase flour, margarine, sugar and rice

loans.name: Savlat's Group

texts.en:
Savlat is the leader of this group. She is 56 and married to a builder. In order to earn money for their livelihood, Savlat breeds cattle. She has been in this business since 1990, so she has a lot of experience. By reselling cattle after fattening, she earns about 4000 soms per month. This profit made it possible for her to celebrate her daughter’s wedding and then her son’s. 

Now Savlat wants to start building a house. She needs some additional funds, so she applied for a loan. The purpose of the loan is to purchase cement. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cement.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Rosalinda has a retail shop that sells a variety of fruits such as mangoes and apples. She has run this business for two years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of fruits to sell.
Rosalinda is a new member of Kiva partner, HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 32-years old and she is married with two children. Ruth is a self-employed businesswoman who is sells soft drinks. She has been in this business for about 1 1/2 years and her business hours are from 8 am until 9 pm every day.

Ruth needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, Ruth will hopefully expand her business through purchasing different soft drinks like water, juice, fanta and so on. Ruth will hopefully earn more profits which in turn will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks.

loans.name: Pura Vida Group

texts.es:
El grupo Pura Vida lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas María Margarita quien vende frutas desde hace 10 años. Ella con el préstamo comprara limones y naranjas para su negocio.

Ella está casada su esposo es agricultor y tiene 5 hijos los cuales van a clase.
Las otras integrantes son Francisca de los Ángeles quien elabora tortilla y vende leña desde hace 8 años y Javier Noel quien vende frutas en especial naranjas agrias y melones.
texts.en: The Pura Vida ("Pure Life") communal bank is comprised of three hardworking and enterprising people. One of them is María Margarita, who has been selling fruit for the past 10 years. With the loan she will purchase lemons and oranges for her business. She is married to a farmer and has five children who attend school. The other members are Francisca de los Ángeles, who has been making tortillas and selling firewood for 8 years, and Javier Noel, who sells fruit, mostly sour oranges and melons.

loans.use: to purchase lemon and orange crops.

loans.name: Humberto De Jesus

texts.es:
A sus 47 años de edad, Humberto es un hombre trabajador y luchador que desde hace 5 años decidió iniciar su labor como ventero ambulante de comidas rápidas, actividad que viene de herencia familiar ya que su padre toda la vida se dedico a esta actividad. 

Humberto dice estar muy feliz con su negocio, ya que el puede manejar su tiempo, en semana trabaja de 10am a 6pm, y los fines de semana según el trabajo extiende su jornada laboral hasta las 10pm. Humberto esta requiriendo de un préstamo ya que necesita hacer unas mejoras en su puesto de comidas, porque a causa de las lluvias en Colombia ha tenido que cerrar mas temprano, por eso desea comprar un nuevo carro de comidas rápidas en acero inoxidable equipado con una carpa tapa sol, que le garantice su trabajo al sol y a la lluvia sin problemas, adicional al carro, también necesita comprar una pipeta de gas y comprar materia prima. Estas mejoras le permitirán crecer, aumentar sus ventas, sus ingresos, generar un empleo por el momento, pero con la ilusión de que gracias a su constante crecimiento de su microempresa, en unos años pueda ayudar a muchas personas que estén en situación de vulnerabilidad con empleos que les permitan sacar adelante sus familias.
texts.en:
At the age of 47, Humberto is a hardworking, tenacious man who decided to start working as a street vendor of fast food five years ago, an activity that’s come down as a family inheritance since his father spent his entire life in this line of work.

Humberto says that he’s very happy with his business because he can manage his own time.  He works during the week from 10am until 6pm and on weekends he extends his workday until 10pm depending on work load.

Humberto needs a loan because he needs to make some improvements to his food stand because due to the rain in Colombia he’s had to close earlier.  Because of this he wants to buy a new, stainless steel fast food cart equipped with a tent to guarantee that he can continue working both in the sunshine and in the rain problem free.  Besides the cart, he also needs to buy a gas cylinder and to buy raw materials.

These improvements will make it possible for him to grow, increase sales and income, and generate one job for the moment but with the hope that the continued growth of his micro business will lead in a few years to being able to help many more people who find themselves in a vulnerable position with respect to employment that will allow them to support their families.

loans.use: to buy a stainless steel fast food cart, a tent, a gas cylinder and raw materials.

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar is 36 years old, illiterate, and couldn’t get an education due to the poor financial conditions of her parents. In order to financially support her family, she does sewing work. She receives sewing orders from her community clients and earns income by completing them on time.   

She has given birth to a son and 2 daughters. Two of them study while her youngest daughter is only 3 years old. Kosar knows the importance of education and wants her children to get the best quality education and become successful in life.
  
Her husband sells goats and sheep. He buys them from the animal market at their early age, raises them up and sells to butchers for a profit. Kosar provides full support to her husband by taking care of his animals. 
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy goats and sheep in larger numbers and then sell them for a profit after raising them up.

loans.use: To buy goats and sheep for animal sales business.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida is married and has four children. Vida is a baker in Kokoado in Elmina, which she has done for 11 years. Her husband is a teacher. Vida uses her income to assist her husband in the upkeep of their home. 

Vida will use the loan to purchase flour, sugar and cooking oil. With the new profits from her expanded business, Vida plans to expand her bakery.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mafanikio Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Mafanikio Group in Western Kenya! Nancy is the facilitator of the Mafanikio group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Nancy takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Nancy had an excellent maize yield harvesting eight bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Nancy was only able to harvest 1 1/2 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Nancy and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Nancy will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Mafanikio group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sor

texts.en:
Mrs. Sor is 33 years old and a mother of three children, living in Ornlong Veng district, Siem Reap province of Cambodia. She is a farmer who grows rice and vegetable crops. Most of her income is from selling vegetables, which she harvests from her fields as well as buys from her suppliers. She is able to earn approximately $3.00 per day to solve the financial needs and support her children to school.

Mrs. Sor is requesting this loan from HKL and Kvia to buy a used motorcycle to support her business, and with remaining funds, she will buy a stock of vegetables for consistent sale.
This loan will provide her a good opportunity to sustain her business. In the future, she intends to own store for selling merchandise products as well as vegetables in a local market of the province.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle and a stock of vegetables for consistent sale.

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.ru: Гавхар замужем и любящая мать. У нее двое детей. Муж работает строителем. Сын учится в университете, а дочка еще учится  в школе. Гавхар занимается купле- продажей женских тканей. Является собственником бизнеса. Она старается расширить бизнес, чтобы быть успешным предпринимателем. С наступлением новогодних праздников продажа на рынке возрастает, и она хотела бы получить займ в размере 3000$ США для покупки женских тканей для пополнения оборотного капитала. Она надеется в вашей поддержке и благодарна вам за помощь.
texts.en: Gavhar is married and is a loving mother.  She has two children.  Her husband is a construction worker.  Their son attends a university, and the daughter still goes school.  Gavhar is involved in buying and selling women's fabrics.  She is the owner of this business.  She tries to expand her business in order to be a successful entrepreneur.  Sales at the market increase with the onset of New Year's holidays, and Gavhar wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $3000 for the purchase of women's fabrics to refill her revolving capital.  She hopes to get your support and is grateful to you for the help.

loans.use: to purchase women's fabrics and refill her revolving capital

loans.name: Elena Marizol

texts.es:
La señora Elena Marisol es  casada y se dedica a atender su pulpería, con la que ha desarrollado su familia brindándole las condiciones pertinentes para que se desarrollen. 

Una de las necesidades que atraviesa es la de comprar la mercadería como: pollo, carne, arroz, frijoles y otros productos para vender en la época de Navidad  y fin de año siendo ya que por la fecha, tiene la oportunidad de obtener mejores ingresos en el negocio. 

Por este motivo, ella visitó Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para obtener los productos mencionados anteriormente y así seguir comercializándolos y satisfacer la demanda. 

Es necesario mencionar que esta actividad la ejerce desde hace 3 años y tiene planes de continuar mejorando su pulpería.
texts.en:
Elena Marisol is married and has a grocery shop, which has enabled her to raise family and provide them with adequate living conditions.

She needs to purchase merchandise such as chicken, beef, rice, beans and other products to sell at Christmas and New Year, as she has the opportunity to increase her income during this period.

For this reason, Elena visited CEPRODEL to apply for a loan to invest in the aforementioned products so that she can continue to market them and meet the demand from her customers.

It is worth mentioning that she has had this business for 3 years and plans to continue improving her store.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, beef, rice, beans, toilet paper and other products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam de 44 años es una mujer casada con José. Con él tiene 5 hijos de 22, 17, 13, 10 y 2 años. Pero solo vive con los 4 menores en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa Villa María Alto Yurinaki, provincia de Chanchamayo. Miriam es una madre y esposa ejemplar. Se dedica desde hace mucho tiempo atrás a la agricultura, actividad que aprendió de sus familiares y comuneros de la zona. 
Es así que cuenta con 7 parcelas de terrenos agrícolas. En ellos siembra café, plátanos y yuca, en las mismas cantidades, así asegura sus ingresos por ambas partes. “Sembrar café y plátanos es más rentable en esta zona por su demanda, y nunca hay pierde”, comenta.
Miriam está contenta por la variedad de plátanos que produce: Canelita, Bizcochito y Seda. A eso se debe también la rapidez de sus ventas. El motivo de su esfuerzo son sus hijos, por ellos no duda en coger el machete y dirigirse a los montes donde se ubican sus terrenos para limpiarlos.
Mas adelante le gustaría, aumentar su producción con la adquisición de más terrenos. Éste sería el primer préstamo que Miriam obtendría de MFP. Se siente emocionada por eso. Ahora forma parte del banco comunal “Los Productores Yaneshas”, del que se muestra esperanzada.
Sin dudarlo invertirá el dinero del crédito en la compra de 10 bolsas de abonos orgánicos para sus cultivos de café, ya que tienen que estar listos para los meses de mayo y junio.
texts.en:
Miriam, 44, is married to José.  She has five children with him who are 22, 17, 13, 10 and 2 years old but she only lives with the four youngest ones in her own house in the indigenous community of Villa María Alto Yurinaki, Chanchamayo Province.  Miriam is an exemplary mother and wife.  For a long time she’s been farming, an activity she learned from her family and from local communal land owners.

She has seven parcels of land, then, where she grows coffee, bananas and cassava in equal amounts thus insuring income from each part.  “Planting coffee and bananas is more profitable in this zone because of demand so that’s always a sure thing,“ she comments.

Miriam is happy with the assortment of bananas she produces: Canelita, Bizcochito and Seda.  This too leads to quick sales.  Her children are the motivators of her efforts.  For them, she does not hesitate to pick up a machete and head into the hills where her parcels are located to clear them.

Later on she’d like to increase production by acquiring more land.  This would be Miriam’s first MFP loan and she’s very excited about it.  She is now part of the “Los Productores Yaneshas” (Yanesha Producers) communal bank and she’s very hopeful about it.  

Without a doubt, she will use the money from the loan to buy ten sacks of organic manure for her coffee crops because they have to be ready for the months of May and June.

loans.use: to buy ten sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a 38-year-old married woman with 6 children; 3 of whom attend school while the rest are married. Her husband Mtengo is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Mwanajuma has operated a juice (soft drinks) selling business for the past 3 years; her potential clients are her neighbors and students from the local school. She faces a major challenge of fluctuating prices of sugar. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 15,000, she wants to purchase a freezer for her business. She decided to join Yehu because it has fair terms and conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy jeans, crepe and polo

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 32 years old and married with two children.

Jennifer earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Jennifer is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jennifer has been in pig fattening for five years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Jennifer is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Wilmer  Jeovanny

texts.en:
My name is Wilmer Jeovanny. I work at a tire store where we sell and repair tires. My business has a strategic location at the center of town. I have been doing this for many years which has allowed me to be able to support my family. Currently my clients are requesting a variety of tires for which I need your support to increase my inventory and expand my business.

Loan Use: Buy tires for vehicles 14,15, and 16

Mi Nombre es Wilmer Jeovanny, cuento con una llantera donde vendemos y reparamos la llantas de los vehiculos, ubicado en el centro de mi comunidad, es un lugar estrategico ya que mi comunidad esta ubicada en la calle principal que conduce a varias comunidades, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos para cubrir mis gastos familiares y otros compromisos, actualmente mis clientes me estan solicitando un surtido de llantas por lo que necesito el apoyo de ustedes para poder surtir mi negocio.

loans.use: Compra de llantas para vehiculo No.14, No. 15 y No.16

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en: Evelina S.'s talent is sewing.  This is what she wants to do for most of her life.  She’s happy about her talent because it really helps her contribute to the needs of her family.  She said that she could sew more than twenty-five articles of clothing a day.  She believes having this project is very important to her and her family.    Evelina intends to use her loan to buy equipment to fix her sewing machine and materials to sew for her customers.

loans.use: To purchase tools for maintaining her machine and additional stock of fabrics

loans.name: Armanda

texts.en:
Armanda is married and lives in Zacatecas. She has two daughters, ages 15 and 6. Her husband works as a laborer in a food packing business in the city. She began her beauty services business to help with the family expenses. She began by cutting hair in the living room of her home, but little by little word spread and she began to have more clients, which allowed her to rent a storefront for her business.

Armanda is asking for a $475 loan which she plans to repay in 6 to 12 months. She will use the loan to save money on materials by buying in bulk. She looks forward to your support in helping her business grow.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Armanda, es una mujer casada y vive en Zacatecas, tiene dos hijas, una de 15 años y la otra más pequeña de 6 años. Su esposo trabaja como obrero en una empresa empacadora de alimentos en esa ciudad. Inicio con su negocio de estética para poder ayudar con el gasto familiar, inicialmente empezó cortando el cabello en la sala de su casa y poco a poco se fue dando a conocer y empezó a tener más clientes, lo que la ayudo a poder rentar un local exclusivo para su negocio.

Armanda esta solicitando un crédito por US $475 que ofrece en pagar en un tiempo de 6 a 12 meses, este préstamo lo utilizará para comprar materiales al por mayor y aprovechar un mejor precio de los mismos, espera tu colaboración para continuar creciendo con su negocio.

loans.use: To buy materials in bulk

loans.name: Umrijon

texts.en: Umrijon has been on a pension for a long time, but still works on a Dekhkan farm. Payment for her work is little, but every year during apricot harvest time, she is granted an area with apricot trees. She dries the apricots from the trees with her family (on photo). She also tries to buy more fresh apricots and dry them. She needs money in order to purchase these apricots. Every year she tries to dry more, because her family lives off the sales in the winter. A year ago she got her first loan from Microinvest. This loan helped to earn profit that was spent for her family. This year she plans to take a loan again in order to buy and dry apricots. She asks for $1000 for 12 months.

loans.use: to buy and dry apricot

loans.name: Quan

texts.en: Quan has proven to be a reliable business partner.  She has already repaid 2 loans she received from Mekong Plus, one of which was funded by Kiva.  The loans have helped so much that Quan would like to ask for another one.  Quan sells betels leaves and areca nuts at a nearby market.  The loans have helped Quan's profits increase to 7-10,000 VND per day ($0.44-0.62).  Without the loans from Mekong Plus and Kiva, Quan would have to ask for a loan from another source which charges high interest rates.  Kiva's loan has allowed Quan to keep all of the money from her sales.  Quan has raised 2 grandchildren on her own.  One of them now works in Ho Chi Minh City, but he is only able to earn enough to survive.

loans.use: to buy more betel leaves and areca nuts to sell at the market

loans.name: Antonia Peña

texts.en: Antonia is 43 years old, married, with three children.   Her husband has a small hardware store which he runs in the same township.  Antonia operates her business very differently from other businesswomen.   She sells almost all her clothes upon request.  The first two weeks of the month are dedicated to gathering up the orders of her well-established clientele.   Afterward, she takes the clothes to every customer's house.  She gets the products wholesale from a merchant ship, since Haina has a wharf which is frequently visited by merchant fleets. A bale of clothing costs approximately US $300.   Antonio earns about US $230 from a bale. The entrepreneur is requesting a loan so that she can satisfy her customers' needs for the present month.  Given this loan, she will increase her income.   That way, she'll contribute better to help her husband deal with  family needs.

loans.use: To buy a bale of clothing in order to satisfy her customers' demand

loans.name: Nasimjon

texts.ru:
Nasimjon K. is a barber. He learned from his uncle. After gaining experience, Nasimjon rented a place of business with his friends and later worked at home. He will use this loan to rent a location in the center of the city in order to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Насимджон Козибобоев предлагает свои услуги в качестве парикмахера. Был учеником у своего дяди. Имея опыт , он продолжил свое ремесло в помещении, где арендовал с друзьями. Сейчас получив кредит, планирует арендовать помещение в центре города для продвижения своего бизнеса, на данный момент он парикмахер на дому.

loans.use: услуги парикмахера

loans.name: Isidoro

texts.es:
Señor Isidoro M. is 29-years-old and single. He used to work as a driver for a public transportation company in Ciudad del Este. Because of a traffic accident that he had, he was unable to keep working and had to resign.

He received compensation, which he was able to invest in the puchase of clothing and accessories that he goes out to sell in different neighborhoods and neighboring cities. He travels on a motorcycle that he acquired as well to be able to make his sales.

He will invest the requested credit in the purchase of wholesale merchandise, sinch he receives good discounts this way.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

El Señor Isidoro M. tiene 29 años y es soltero. Se desempeñaba como chofer de transportes varios para una empresa de transportes públicos en Ciudad del Este; a causa de un accidente de transito que tuvo se vio imposibilitado para seguir trabajando y tuvo que renunciar.

Recibió una indemnización con la cual pudo invertir en la compra de ropas y accesorio los cuales sale a vender recorriendo diferentes barrios y ciudades aledañas. El recorrido lo realiza en una moto que adquirió también para salir a realiza sus recorridos.

El crédito solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de mercaderías al por mayor, ya que de este modo le otorgan buenos descuentos.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing like shirts, pants, t-shirts, shorts, belts, etc.

loans.name: Eddy

texts.es:
Eddy Castellon drives a bus in the city of Leon in Nicaragua. From the age of 24, he has worked in this business with his father. However, with his father now getting older, he has given the business to Eddy, who continues offering service along a well known route in Leon.

Today his biggest need is to invest in the repair and maintenance of the bus, which is already in poor condition. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Ceprodel to improve his business and offer a better service to his passengers.

Eddy Castellon es un caballero que se dedica al negocio de servicio de transporte en la ciudad de León en Nicaragua. Desde hace 24 años inició trabajando con su padre en este negocio, sin embargo, al apartarse del negocio (su padre) por la avanzada edad, le hereda el bus a su hijo quien hoy en día lo maneja realizando viajes ya que está afiliado a una ruta del sector transporte en León.

Hoy en día la mayor necesidad que atraviesa el señor Castillo es que desea invertir en la reparación y mantenimiento del bus ya que se encuentra en malas condiciones y desperfectos mecánicos. Por tal motivo, acude a Ceprodel con el fin de que le proporcione crédito para mejorar su unidad de transporte y de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a los pasajeros.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: THE LOAN WILL BE USED FOR REPAIRS AND MAINTENANCE ON  HIS BUS.  THE BUS IS IN POOR CONDITION AND  HE NEEDS TO OFFER A BETTER SERVICE TO HIS PASSENGERS.

loans.name: Haseena's Group

texts.en:
"I am a widow, Haseena B., from Lahore, [the] second largest city in Pakistan. I have five kids and all are married. My husband's death forced us into great economic crises. Fortunately, now our times have changed, [and are] much better. One of my sons embroiders clothes and I am borrowing for his business expansion.

"My loan group members are, Sakina B., [who] runs a grocery store. Nasreen B.’s son is an electrician. Koser B.’s husband runs a shoe factory. Shahnaz B. is borrowing for her husband who manufactures handicrafts.

"All these women are needy and play an important role [in getting] income to their families."

loans.use: Expand the embroidered clothes business and support the other businesses

loans.name: Terane

texts.en: Terane V. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. She is a 44-year-old woman who is married and has two children. She and her husband sell potatoes in the Beylagan city bazaar. (Her husband is pictured). They established their business five years ago. She applied to the Normicro Beylagan Branch for the KIVA loan of $1200. She plans to purchase more potatoes and expand their business.

loans.use: To buy potatoes

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr:
Coumba C. is 45 years old, married with 9 children and 4 other family members in her care, and has been a member of the village bank of Kounkané Viviane Wade in the Kolda region for the past 5 years. To promote her business selling peanut paste and catering, she wants to buy bags of peanuts to make peanut paste and to obtain a supply of rice and condiments for the preparation of ready-to-sell platters. Her income will allow her to contribute to the well-being of her family. The loan requested will be reimbursed at the end of six months in one single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Coumba C. 45 ans, mariée, 09 enfants et 04 autres personnes de sa famille en charge est membre du banc villageois de Kounkané Viviane Wade dans la région de Kolda depuis 5 ans. Pour promouvoir son activité de vente de pâte d’arachide et de restauration, elle veut acheter des sacs d’arachide pour faire de la pâte d’arachide et s’approvisionner en riz et condiments pour la préparation des plats à vendre. Ses revenus lui permettent de contribuer au bien être familial. Le prêt sollicité sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice, peanuts, and condiments

loans.name: Gabina Alicia

texts.es:
Gabina, is a single mother and is 40 years of age. She is a member of Banco Comunal Lirio.

She has a young daughter who is five years of age. Gabina has a store where she sells groceries, articles books, and presents. In the beginning she only sold small quantity of products like groceries, decorative stuff, and presents. Also Gabina sells food Típica on Saturdays & Sundays.

Gabina needs a loan of 1000 soles, which will be invested in buying presents, decorative stuff, rice, sugar, milk, and candy.

Gabina’s dreams are to construct a home of noble material, supply her business more, and for her daughter to have a good future.

This is Gabina's second loan with Kiva. To see her first loan, go to:

http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=27430&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Translated from Spanish by Johnny of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Primer Préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=27430&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Gabina es madre soltera, tiene 40 años y 1 hija pequeña de 5 años, Gabina es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio.

Gabina tiene una tienda donde vende abarrotes, artículos de librería, regalos. Al inicio solo vendía pocos productos como abarrotes, actualmente ha incrementado sus productos vende regalos, adornos. Además Gabina vende comida Típica los días sábados y domingos.

Gabina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de regalos, figuras recortables, arroz, azúcar, leche y golosinas

Los sueños de Gabina son construir su casa de material noble, surtir más su negocio y que su hija tenga un buen futuro.

loans.use: presents, decorative stuff, rice, sugar, milk, and candy

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana, 48 years old, is a divorced woman with two children. She says her divorce was triggered by a minor misunderstanding between herself and her husband ten years ago.

Juliana enjoys selling food, from which she obtains her daily source of livelihood. She is a petty trader who sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, tin tomatoes, spices, skimmed powdered milk, palm oil, and peanuts, among other items. She sells her goods at her table in the community market. Because of her good customer relations, Juliana has many customers who buy from her stand.

Juliana wants to use this loan to buy an increased stock of rice, tin tomatoes, vegetable oil, spices, skimmed powdered milk, and other items to serve her customers. She belongs to the community group called Lydia ‘mma’ Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy increased stock of rice, tin tomatoes, vegetable oil, spices, skimmed powdered milk and other items

loans.name: Magda

texts.es:
Magda is 60 years old. She is a very active woman: she sells snacks in an Education Institute during the school terms. In the vacations she sells groceries from her house. She has continued working in order to held her daughter-in-law with the education of her grandchildren, as due to the death of one of her sons, her daughter-in-law and grandchildren came to live with her. With time, Magda wants to sell wholesale (groceries and candy): for this, she needs a loan which will help her to achieve her aim in a short time.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Magda tiene 60 años, es una mujer muy activa, venD. durante el tiempo escolar golosinas en una Institución Educativa, en vacaciones se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes en su casa, ella sigue trabajando para apoyar a su nuera con la educación D. sus nietos, ya que con la muerte D. uno D. sus hijos, su nuera y sus nietos vinieron a vivir con ella. Con el tiempo, Magda quiere vender al por mayor (abarrotes y golosinas) para esto, requiere D. un capital que la ayuD. a lograr su meta en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
Hector A. J. is in the process of applying to purchase a home through a Mexican government program called Infonavit. Infonavit provides working families with a low cost mortgage to purchase a small starter home. Some families’ incomes land them just short of qualifying for the program, however. This Kiva loan allows them to make up the difference with a small supplementary loan and thus qualify to purchase their first home.

Hector is single and lives with his mother. He wants to pursue a house through Infonavit so he doesn’t pay rent as the rents are very high. He wants to take advantage of this loan as it will be his own. Although the price has been lowered but he still needs money to close the deal with the realtor. He is asking for $875.

Hector works in a factory. His mother, Maria De los Remedios Soriano, helps him with the family expenses. She sells used clothing, which is very sought after in this city.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Héctor es soltero y vive con su mama el quiere sacar una casa de infonavit para no estar pagando renta ya que las tarifas son muy altas. El quiere aprovechar este crédito de esta dependencia para que sea propia, a el se la estarán rebajando de su nomina pero aun así a el le falta dinero para completar la casa que le ofrece una inmobiliaria. El solicita $875 dólares

Héctor trabaja en una maquiladora, su mama la Señora Maria De los Remedios Soriano le ayuda con los gastos familiares. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa usada la cual en esta ciudad es muy solicitada.

loans.use: supplemental loan for home purchase

loans.name: Mrs. Pheon Phan's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. P. P. is the president of the village bank in Anhchanh Village in Kandal Province. This village bank has 22 members who are requesting a loan. Mrs. P. P. is a cow breeder who has four cows and a farmer who cultivates rice on her 1.5-hectares field. Her plantation is not very fertile, so Mrs. P. P. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer for her field in order to make her crop more productive. Mrs. P. P. is a 58-year-old widow with five children, four of whom are employed in a garment factory while the youngest one is attending the local school. 

Two members in this village bank have end-of-term (EoT) loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. The end-of-term loan members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial loans for Cambodia's poor. EoT loans allow people to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09 percent and AMK has a default rate of 0 percent on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Bugolo Zibulatudde Group

texts.en:
Tausi N. is the chairperson of the Bugolo Zibulatudde Group in Kikondo, Lugazi. She is 42 years old and married with six children. She also cares for two children who are not her own. One of the children is an orphan and one is her step-child. They are both in school along with three of her kids.

This is Tausi's second time seeking a loan from Kiva. With the loan, she plans to buy more small fish to sell to her ever increasing customers. She works primarily in the Tororo district.

With the previous loan, she was able to make more profits, which enabled her to pay school fees for her children and buy a piece of land for farming. She would like to buy more land very soon. In her fish selling business, she plans to start selling the same fish to other districts. There is a lot of demand and she believes this will bring in more income. With this loan, she has plans to buy more basins of mukene for sale.

loans.use: Tausi Nabbanja would like to buy more small fish (mukene) for sale to her customers.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Jose B. soy una persona que me dedico al comercio desde hace mucho tiempo, esta actividad me ha permitido crecer economicamente y hemos logrado con mi esposa salir adelante con nuestro hogar y nuestros hijos, tenemos 3 hijos que son lo mas importante en mi vida, gracias a Dios hemos podido darles alimento, educacion y otras necesidades, en estos momentos necesito el credito para surtir mas mi negocio ya que las exigencias de mis clientes son muchas y ya me estan pidiendo producto para navidad, entonces me estoy quedando si producto ya que casi todo lo tengo encargado. tengo muchas ganas de salir adelante y hacer crecer mi negocio.
texts.en:
Hello. My name is Jose B.. I have been a businessman for a long time. My business activities have allowed me to grow financially, and my wife and I have managed to get ahead with our home and our children. We have three children who are the most important thing in my life. Thanks to God, we have been able to feed them, given them an education and provide for other necessities. Currently I need a loan to provide additional stock for my business, seeing my clients' demands are great and they are ordering a lot of products for Christmas. As such, I'm currently out of stock and I have almost everything on order. I really want to get ahead and make my business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing, shoes and backpacks

loans.name: Cica

texts.fr: Originaire de Ouidah, dame D. Cica a été à l'école juqu'en classe de CE1.Après avoir abandonné,elle aida sa maman à vendre de la bouillie faite à base de farine de maïs .Puis à son propre compte,elle s'est  mise à vendre du pain et de la nourriture:mélange de riz et haricot cuit accompagné de friture communément appelé"Atassi".Mais elle a fini par préférer la vente de pain et cessa de vendre du ""atassi".Par ailleurs,elle y a ajouté la vente d'huile végétale pour la cuisson.C'est pour renforcer son activité qu'elle sollicite ce prêt de 120000fcfa.Mariée, elle a 6 enfants dont le dernier  Blanchard Samuel est un nourrisson de 5 mois
texts.en:
Born in Ouidah, Mrs. Cica Dodnon went to school for only two years. After leaving school, she helped her mother sell maize porridge. Then, on her own account, she began to sell bread and cooked food: a mixture of rice and beans accompanied by fries, commonly called "atassi". But she preferred selling bread and so finally stopped selling "atassi". She added the sale of vegetable oil for cooking. She is requesting this loan of 120,000 F CFA to bolster her business. Married, she has 6 children, of whom the youngest, Blanchard Samuel, is only 5 months old.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 7 jerry cans of 25 liters of oil

loans.name: Maman Kartimou

texts.fr: Dame I. MAMAN Kartimou est née en 1969 à BASSILA une ville du nord BENIN dans le département de l'ATACORA. Elle réside au quartier ADOGLETA ; un quartier périphérique de la ville de Cotonou. Elle est mariée à Mr AFFO Séydou et mère de 5 enfants dont 4 filles et un garçon tous scolarisés. Elle mène l’activité de la vente du savon ghanéenne depuis 5 ans. Elle vend aussi de la nourriture devant son domicile. Elle va acheter le savon au GHANA et les autres produits qui rentrent dans la préparation de la nourriture au marché international du BENIN (Tokpa). Elle est à son troisième crédit.
texts.en:
Madam M. K. I. was born in 1969 in BASSILA, a city in northern Benin in the county of ATACORA. She resides in the ADOGLETA district, a suburb of the city of Cotonou. She is married to Mr. Séydou AFFO and is the mother of five children (four girls and a boy, all of whom are in school). She has been selling Ghanaian soap for five years. She also sells food from her house. She is going to buy soap in Ghana and the items needed for making food at the international market of Benin (Tokpa). She is on her third loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soap in Ghana and items that go into making food

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan N. is 53 years old and lives with his wife in Moung Ruessei, Battambang province. He stays at home and has a business of charging batteries. People in their village depend on their batteries to power the lighting, TV and radio. His wife works growing and selling rice to both the market and wholesalers. This couple has three school-aged children. Chan N. is asking for a loan to purchase a big generator, allowing him to recharge more batteries every day.

loans.use: To purchase a big generator.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta C., 45, is a  resident of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City, Southern Philippines. She is striving hard to provide the needs of her family. Julieta is married and blessed with 2 children. She tends a variety store (sari–sari store) and is sometimes engaged in traditional gold panning. Because the income of the family  is not sufficient , Julieta needs to have a financial assistance of PHP 11,000 to expand her variety store.  From the income of her business she hopes to be able to send her children to school.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items for sale in the store

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Vũ Thị Nhàn năm nay 50 tuổi, chồng chị không may mất sớm, hiện nay chị đang sống cùng hai con đã trưởng thành. Năm 2001 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Hiện tại bên cạnh nguồn thu  từ chăn nuôi gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu nhập từ công việc làm mộc của hai con nên cuộc sống khá ổn định với mức thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm 10 con lợn và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Vu Thi N. is 50 years old. Her husband unfortunately died at young age. She lives with two grown-up children. In 2001, she joined TYM Fund and borrowed money to invest in raising pigs. Currently, in addition to income from pig raising, her family also receives income from furniture making business of her children, therefore the living condition is fairly stable with an income of VND4,000,000 per month.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND10,000,000 to buy 10 more pigs and foods for them.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 10 more pigs and foods for them.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly S. (not shown) is 53 years old and has a business selling coffee and grocery items from her home.  Every day, she is able to make $10 in revenue.  Her husband, pictured here, is a cow dealer and makes $5 in revenue per day. This couple has one child.  Ly S. is asking for a loan to purchase a cow for her husband to sell.

loans.use: Purchase a cow to sell.

loans.name: Abdurahmon

texts.ru: Эшонкулов Абдурахмон житель района Гисаар. Женат и имеет четверых детей. Имеет высшее образование . По специальности агроном.Кроме того работает в сфере бизнеса. Торгует сундуками. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы включить их в товарооборот. Таким образом он сможет увеличить товарооборот и улучшить положение своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Abdurahmon E. lives in the Gissar region. He is married and has four children. He has higher education and is an agronomist by profession. He has own business as well, he sells drawer chests. He plans to use the loan to include them into circulation. This way he can increase commodity turnover and improve his business condition.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 49-year-old Hawa A. from Mwanza. She is widowed with three children between the ages of 11 and 22. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependent because it is an orphan. Hawa has been running a brick business since 2009. She sells bricks for house building. She works at the business for 16 hours per day, five days per week and is assisted by two employees. She currently earns about $190 from her business. Hawa is requesting a loan of $400 in order to make more bricks and sell them to customers. In the future, she plans to open another business. Hawa thanks you for your support! ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To make more bricks to sell to customers

loans.name: Aura Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Aura es soltera, de 43 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos, todos casados, habita con una hija, pero quiere construir un cuarto para darle privacidad a su hija.  Trabaja como conserje desde hace 11 años en la escuela de San Patricio, es reconocida por sus compañeras de labores como una persona muy honesta y responsable iniciando por su trabajo, esta solicitando su 5to credito para iniciar con la construccion de un cuarto, ya que necesita una independencia en casa de su hija, esta tiene su compañero quien le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, sus creditos anteriores los cancelo en tiempo y forma sin presentar atrasos.  Su horario de trabajo es de 7:00 am. a 5:00 pm. de lunes a viernes, su entrada es a esa hora porque deja hecho el trabajo desde el dia anterior.

loans.use: Iniciar construccion de un cuarto

loans.name: Nou

texts.en: Mrs. Nou S. is 27 years old and a resident of Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is married to Mr. Mon Sokha (he is shown in the picture), age 30, and they make a living planting crops in the village. This couple has given birth to three children who are of school-age. They also go to work on the farm when they are free from studying. Because the family needs to take a long time to cut their mature crop after they plant, they have no income to support their family’s daily expense. Therefore, Nou S. has decided to seek a loan on Kiva for capital to purchase vegetables from other farmers to sell at the market for a profit. She hopes to use the benefits from the farm to buy zinc to cover the roof of her house that cracks down.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables from other farmers to sell

loans.name: Ivanna

texts.en:
Ivanna is married with two children. She sells small home products at Drogobych city and has been in this business for two years. Various small home products are always in high demand and Ivanna makes about 3,000 UAH per month of net profit. She would like to borrow 8,500 UAH to purchase more inventory.

Ivanna is a hardworking and enthusiastic person. She believes that hard work brings success not only in business but in life, too.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita A. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin. She is married and has three school-aged children. Rosita owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling specialty food products such as viands (tasty dishes), and a variety of snacks and shakes in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over nineteen years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Rosita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and to support the educational expenses of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Saini

texts.en: Saini V. (1054002-02) is a 64-year-old woman living in the town of Saipipi. She is married and has eight adult children. Saini owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 300 WST a month. In 2008, Saini joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Saini is now requesting a new loan of 1,500 WST which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 2nd from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Azamat

texts.en:
A. Azamat is dedicated to the production of onion, potato and carrot. With a lot of effort and sacrifice he carries out this work every day for the purpose of improving the conditions of his family, bringing the daily bread to his table and, at the same time, saving for the improvement of his dwelling, which needs a lot of help because it is in bad state which little by little he has come to improve. Azamat is married with 5 children. His family admires him for the fact that his multiple efforts have permitted him to bring food to his home and that in addition he has managed to keep his children in school. The need that this gentleman faces is that he needs to invest in his business through the purchase of seeds and fertilizer. By this Azamat hopes that Kiva will offer him the loan to do well along with his family. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing the seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Bedith

texts.es: La señora Bedith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Amistad y Paz”, Distrito de Juanjui, Departamento de Mariscal Cáceres. Es Conviviente, tiene 46 años y es madre de 03 hijos, los 03 que aun dependen de ella.Con la seguridad de tener una buena sazón para la preparación de diferentes tipos de comidas, por iniciativa propia con  su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 emprendió su negocio de venta de comida diaria tipo menú, ubicando en su misma casa.En la actualidad, pese al tiempo transcurrido continúa con el mismo negocio, contando con una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acude a su Restaurante, donde ella los atiende con el carisma que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como sacos de arroz, azúcar; aceites en paquetes, pollos en javas y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. Bedith, tiene mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante y asegurarse una  vejez tranquila. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Sra. Bedith is a member of the Communal Bank “Amistad y Paz” (Friendship and Peace), which is located in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is 46 years old, in a common law marriage, and the mother of 3 dependent children.

Utilizing her cooking skills and knowledge of preparing different foods, she took the initiative and used her first loan of 300 soles to start her business selling daily menu lunches from her home. Over time, she remained in business and built up a loyal clientele who come by her restaurant on a daily business. She greets each one of her customers with her friendly personality.

With this loan of 1500 soles, she will supplies for preparing her daily meals such as bags of rice and sugar, packets of oil, cases of chicken, as well as utensils. These items will keep her business running and help her provide better service to her customers.

Bedith has the strength to continue working and hopes to be successful so that she can have a peaceful retirement. She thanks Manuela Ramos for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for preparing meals

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria tiene 41 años, es una mujer muy amable y sencilla, vive en una habitación alquilada y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Su negocio es el lavado de ropa, desde muy joven se vio en la necesidad de trabajar y vio que lavar ropa para otras personas era una actividad que le daba los ingresos que necesitaban y actualmente ella ha mejorado su calidad de vida con esta actividad y ya cuenta con algunas comodidades. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que ella es su propio jefe y puede disponer de su tiempo, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que lavar cuando hace frió, ya que el agua es muy helada y muchas veces le ha causado resfriados muy fuertes. Para el futuro espera tener un negocio más estable, una bodega es lo que más le llama la atención.
Maria se encuentra en su cuarto préstamo con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus primeros créditos y espera serlo ahora también, en su banco comunal es muy responsable con los acuerdos a los que llegan en sus reuniones. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevos lavadores y baldes, ya que los que usaba están muy desgastados.
texts.en:
Maria is 41 years old and lives in a rented home. She is a very kind and modest woman who desires most to improve her quality of life. Maria washes clothes, which is something she has done since she was very young because she needed to work. Washing clothes for other people was an activity in which she could earn money. She has been able to improve her living conditions and buy a few items to make life more comfortable. What she likes most about her work is being her own boss and managing her own time. Maria has been doing this type of work for 10 years and the most difficult part is having to do laundry in cold weather because the water is freezing and she has become ill on several occasions. In the future, she hopes to have a more stable business. Opening a grocery store is at the top of her list.

Maria is taking her fourth loan with MFP. She has been very punctual with her previous loans and hopes to do the same again with this loan. She is very responsible in the discussions that are held at her Communal Bank meetings. With her loan of 1000 soles, Maria will buy new scrubbers and buckets because her existing equipment is well worn.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for washing clothes

loans.name: Chor

texts.en: Mr. Chor V., 29, is married to Chanthoeun, age 27, and they have a young child who is dependent on their income. Chor V. currently owns a car which he uses to provide a taxi service for a daily income and he is typically earning of $6 per day. His wife stays at home to care for the child and do housework, who appears in the picture. Chor V. is applying for a loan to repair his existing house that is cracking down frequently.

loans.use: To repair his existing house that is cracking down frequently

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhoeurn N. is 35 years old, and she lives in Preak Doung village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare field of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. With this plantation, she faces an obstacle because she does not have the money to buy rice seed and fertilizer to support the field and make the crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Peang Poeun, is a construction worker. Mrs. Sokhoeurn N. has four children, one of whom is a construction worker, while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer to support the field and make the crop more productive

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida M. is from the village of Hinaplanon, Iligan City. She is 47 years old. Leonida is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Leonida owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Leonida has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Leonida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Leonida is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest to expand the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Leonida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Souad

texts.en: Souad is a 40-year-old single woman living with her two brothers. She has been working as a home-based tailor since 2004 and has 22 years of experience in this market. She presents a variety of products to her clientele. Souad is asking for a loan of US$ 1,000 to buy an additional sewing machine to develop and enlarge her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional sewing machine

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma S. is from the village of Baybay Panalsalan Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Emma is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Emma owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a "sari-sari" general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling retail products such as shampoo, soap, edible oil, toothpaste etc., Emma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Emma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional produts to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Emma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional produts to sell

loans.name: Abosede

texts.en:
Abosede O. is 41 years old and is married with a child.

She sells hair extensions at retail prices to her customers. This is the high season for her business, and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers.

She hopes for a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more hair extensions to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She loves this business because of the personal interaction that she has with her customers. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Bukasa Development Group, Mukono

texts.en: The leader of this loan group, Teddy N., is 37 years old and a single mother of three children ages 10, 15 and 19. All of her children are in school, and Teddy also cares for her parents. For the last four years, she has made a living running a canteen in Bukasa where she sells fresh greens and other produce, sugar, bread, salt, cooking oil and other items that her customers need. This is the second loan Teddy has applied for from Pearl Microfinance, and she will use it to restock her canteen with more goods.

loans.use: To restock canteen with items such as fresh greens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fresh fish

loans.name: Levene

texts.en:
Levene E. is 48 and married with 4 children (ages 6 - 19).  She owns a business venture, selling bamboo handicrafts to tourists and local community members.  Levene has 2 years of experience in this business.  Levene needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Levene joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Levene's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Levene E. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                         1.4 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:            1.2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:                1.6 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts

loans.name: Nike

texts.en: Selling sachet water and drinks is a business activity that is so dear to the heart of Nike. She has been selling sachet water and drinks for a long time and has lots of customers. She hopes to grow her business. Nike hopes for a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more sachet water and drinks to sell. Nike is a Yoruba woman by tribe and she is married with four children. She is 40 years old and her husband also works to support the home. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sachet water and drinks to sell

loans.name: La Esperanza 1,2,3 Group

texts.en:
Biola is the coordinator of her group La Esperanza (The Hope), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children.

Biola is excited to be taking this loan with Esperanza and she is excited at the opportunity to grow her business and have access to low cost capital. She plans to use this loan to invest in her clothing business by traveling to Santo Domingo to purchase blouses, sweaters, skirts and pants in the main market to sell at a profit in her community. Biola will use the profits to invest in her business and save towards being able to take larger loans and further invest in her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Blouses, sweater, skirts, pants

loans.name: Genesis 4 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group, Genesis, and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients in general. Her group is located in El-Seibo, a rural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children.

Maria is excited to be seeking her seventh loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanded her business in doing so. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. Specifically, she sells both agricultural and beauty products in her small town, including hair straighteners, creams, deodorants, and hair extensions, as well as charcoal and fertilizer. She will use the profits generated as a result of this loan to improve her home and her family's standard of living. For instance, she would like to add a concrete floor to their home and to purchase shoes for her children and a laundry machine to lighten her domestic burden. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional products (e.g., straighteners, creams, deodorants, hair extensions, charcoal, and fertilizer)

loans.name: Rhina Deysi

texts.es: Rhina Deysi M. de 34 años de edad, reside en San Francisco Goteras, ubicado en el departamento de Morazán. Vive en casa propia junto a su madre, la cual trabaja haciendo los quehaceres del hogar. Rhina posee una venta de llaveros, encendedores, perfumes, llaves y otros productos más. El negocio está ubicado sobre la calle principal de San Francisco Goteras, la cual se encuentra frente al parque del mismo municipio. Sus ventas son muy estables, y cuenta con varios clientes los cuales son constantes en sus compras. Rhina solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para surtir su negocio y de esta manera contar con más clientes, ya que este trabajo es la única fuente de ingresos que posee ella para poder salir adelante junto a su madre, es por ello que es de mucho importancia mejorarlo.
texts.en:
Rhina Deysi M., aged 34, lives in San Francisco Goteras, located in the department of Morazán. She lives in her own house with her mother who takes care of the household chores. Rhina owns a store in which she sells key rings, cigarette lighters, perfumes, keys and similar items. Her store is located on the main street of San Francisco Goteras and faces the city park. Her turnover is very stable; she has a diversified clientele with regular purchases. Rhina applies for a loan to have sufficient means to bolster her business and thus get more customers. This activity is indeed her sole source of income. It allows her and her mother to progress, so improving her business is a matter of great importance to her.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy key rings, lighters, perfumes and similar items

location.town: San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is 32 years old and is married with four children. In the last two years, she has been selling secondhand clothes and shoes to earn a living. Since she opened up her business, it has been picking up gradually. She uses her income to educate her three children and support her husband in paying the household expenses.

Roseline has been an active member of a group in Faulu Kenya where she saves her money. Her group members have guaranteed her a loan of Kes 40,000 which she requested from Faulu Kenya. She intends to use this loan to add to her stock of clothes and shoes.

Roseline dreams of expanding her business so that she can be financially stable.

loans.use: To add to her stock of clothes and shoes

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina P. is from the village of Poblacion, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 50 years old, married and has four adult children. To make a living, Monina owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling clothing products like pants, shirts, etc. in the local community. Monina has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Monina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Monina is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the seventh loan she has taken out from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
