Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila E. is single. She prepares tea and serves it with eggs and bread at Takoradi. Her customers are mostly those who want to take their breakfast outside the home. She has been through junior high school. She responsibly takes care of herself.

Sheila’s loan will be used to buy more ingredients to prepare her tea for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to prepare her tea for sale

loans.name: Yaricza Ivania

texts.es:
La señora Yaricza Ivania P. V., tiene 31 años de edad, casada y su esposo labora como chofer apoyándole como la cabeza del hogar en los gastos y decisiones del hogar, son una familia con dos hijos menores de edad que estudian primaria, habitan en un humilde barrio de Buena Vista, son una familia muy humilde, que a futuro espera mejorar sus condiciones de habitad para el bienestar de todos.

Ella trabaja en una zona Franca y solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción  y  realizar una ampliación en su vivienda que le favorezca a las comodidades en las que actualmente viven, esta inversión les brindaría a los padres la tranquilidad necesaria de ofrecerle a sus hijos mejores condiciones de habitad para el buen desarrollo de sus vidas.
texts.en:
Sra. Yaricza Ivania Perez V., 31, is married. Her husband works as driver and, as the head of the house, supports her by sharing household expenses and family decisions. They have two young children still in elementary school and live in a modest neighborhood of Buenos Vista. They are an ordinary family with high hopes of improving their lives. Sra. Yaricza works in a free-trade zone. She is applying for a loan so that she can buy construction materials that she will use to expand her house. The add-on will allow the family to live more comfortably than they do now. Furthermore, the investment will provide these parents with the satisfaction of knowing that they are providing better living conditions for their kids and an environment in which they can develop more fully.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand house.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar T. is from the city of Malibangcao Ozamiz City. She is 66 years old. Pilar is married and has ten adult-aged children. To make a living, Pilar owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products such as "tuba" coconut wine and breads in the local community. Pilar has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Pilar joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Pilar has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Pilar is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Pilar from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Bayardo Enrique

texts.es:
El señor Bayardo  Enrique V. R., tiene la edad de 66 años es casado y su esposa realiza las actividades del hogar, ellos tienen 8 hijos mayores de edad y que laboran en diferentes actividades, y apoyan a sus padres en los gastos que se incurren mensualmente.

Fue gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres que lograron iniciarse en la actividad de agricultura, siendo esta su fuente de ingreso que sustentó todos estos años a toda la familia, es para la finca que ahora solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales agrícolas, que permitan un mejor mantenimiento a las cosechas, y la posibilidad de mejorar sus condiciones económicas y las de su familia.
texts.en:
Bayardo Enrique V. R. is 66 years old and married. His wife does the household chores. They have 8 older children that work in different businesses and support their parents with the expenses that they incur each month.

It was thanks to the effort of his parents that they were able to begin working in agriculture, this being the source of income that supported the family all of these years. He is requesting this loan for the farm to purchase agricultural materials, which will allow for better care for the crops and the possibility to improve his economic conditions and those of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintaining crops

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase tools and equipment for his television-repair business

loans.name: Family (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal Family está formado por 8 socias quienes con el esfuerzo diario de su trabajo han logrado sacar  adelante a sus familias. Nuestras socias viven en diferentes partes de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera ciudad  más importante del Ecuador,  su riqueza arquitectónica y cultural es muy grande, su gastronomía muy variada y su gente muy cálida y amable.

La Señora. Ángela Lucia B. vive por el sector de la universidad Politécnica, este es su segundo ciclo con los créditos de la fundación y ha sido su hermana quien  la invito a formar parte de la  banca comunal. Los créditos la han servido mucho en su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta  de productos Avon, actividad que la desempeña hace un año, no tiene un horario fijo de trabajo, vende sus productos  a sus amigos y familiares, también se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos desde que tenia 15 años, en este trabajo tampoco tiene un horario fijo ya que sus jefes lo único que le piden es que realice su trabajo con responsabilidad.
Doña Ángela tiene 34 años, es  casada y tiene 4 hijos de 18, 16, 13 y 11 años de edad, su primera hija trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, sus tres hijos estudias en un colegio de la ciudad, su esposo es de profesión latonero (arreglo de las latas de los vehículos), no tienen casa propia y vive en casa de su mamá pero  independientemente. Su  nuevo crédito lo va  a invertir en más cosméticos y su sueño es llegar a tener una casa propia.

La Señora María Eugenia M. vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 49 años, está separada de su esposo hace 2 años y tiene una hija de 24 años de edad que esta  estudiado en la universidad la carrera de veterinaria, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
Doña María se dedica al arreglo de casas, actividad que la viene realizando desde muy joven y le ha ayudado a sacar a su familia adelante, también hace 2 años se dedica a la cría de cuyes los que vende en su casa. Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en la banca comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de más cuyes. Su meta es ayudarle a su hija que termine la carrera universitaria y su sueño es  llegar a tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
The Family Communal Bank is made up of 8 members who have managed to get ahead with their families through the daily effort that they put into their work. The members live in different parts of the city of Cuenca. This city is the third most important city in Ecuador, and has great architectural and cultural treasures, a varied cuisine, and very warm and friendly residents. Ángela Lucia B. lives near the polytechnic university. This is her second loan from the foundation; it was her sister who invited her to join the communal bank. The loans are very helpful for her business. Ángela makes a living selling Avon products, and has been involved in this activity for one year. She doesn’t have a fixed work schedule, but sells her products to her friends and family. She also makes a living doing domestic chores, an activity that she has performed for 15 years. This job doesn’t have a fixed schedule either, since all that her employers ask is for her to do her work responsibly. Ángela is 34 years old, married, and has 4 children, ages 18, 16, 13, and 11. Her oldest daughter works and helps her financially, while the three younger children study at a school in the city. Her husband works at a body shop (he repairs the car bodies). The family doesn’t have its own house and lives in the home of Ángela’s mother, though they are not dependent on her. Ángela’s new loan will be invested in more cosmetics. Her dream is to have a house of her own. María Eugenia M. lives in the center of the city of Cuenca. She is 49 years old, and has been separated from her husband for 2 years. She has a 24-year-old daughter who is studying to be a veterinarian at the university. They don’t own their own home, but live in a rented house. María makes a living cleaning houses. She started working in this activity when she was very young and it has helped to get her family ahead. For the past 2 years she has also made a living raising guinea pigs, which she sells at her home. She is on her second loan with the communal bank and will use it to invest in purchasing more guinea pigs. María wants to help her daughter complete her university studies, and her dream is to have her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing Avon cosmetics/ Purchasing guinea pigs.

loans.name: Kpossidé

texts.fr: A. est une jeune femme célibataire et a une personne à sa charge, elle exerce depuis 8 ans déjà le commerce de céréales, elle a associé plus tard à ce commerce la vente d'ignames. elle s'approvisionne quelques fois au grand marché de Lomé mais plus souvent à l'intérieur du pays dans les villes de sokodé et atakpamé. elle veut accroître ces recettes et sollicite par conséquent de WAGES un crédit qui va lui servir à acheter des sacs de céréales et 10 tas d'ignames.
texts.en:
Kpossidé A. is a young unmarried woman who supports one other person. She has been engaged in the business of selling grains for 8 years. She later began a secondary business selling yams. She sometimes stocks up at Lomé's large market, but more often in the interior of the country, in the towns of Sokodé and Atakpamé. She wants to increase her revenue and therefore is requesting a loan from WAGES which will enable her to buy some bags of grains and 10 lots of yams.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grain

loans.name: Paula Marina

texts.es:
Paula tiene 71 años de edad, es viuda y vive junto a unos familiares en el distrito de Pacasmayo, capital de la provincia del mismo nombre, se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de quince años a la venta de carne de aves en un puesto ubicado en el mercadillo de la ciudad de Pacasmayo. Ella ofrece su mercadería diariamente y cuenta con una clientela fija debido al tiempo que lleva trabajando en esta actividad. Este negocio le permite sentirse activa y solventar sus gastos personales, así como colaborar con la economía de su familia.

Paula desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más carne para ofrecerla en venta a sus clientes, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Paula es una mujer bastante dinámica y de buen carácter, las personas que le conocen le quieren y admiran mucho. Anteriormente ya ha tenido créditos con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Paula is 71, widowed, and she lives together with family members in the Pacasmayo district, capital of the province of the same name, located in La Libertad region, two hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

For the past fifteen years she has been selling poultry in a stand located in the market of the city of Pacasmayo.  She sells her poultry daily and  has regular customers because of the years she has been in the business.  This allows her to stay active and cover her personal expenses, and thus she can contribute to the finances of the family.

Paula would like to expand her business by buying more poultry to sell to her customers, and for this reason, she has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1000 sols.

Paula is a dynamic and good woman and people who know her admire and care for her very much.  In the past she has had loan from Edpyme Alternativa and she has exhibited punctuality and responsibility with her payments.

loans.use: To buy poultry to expand her sales in the market

loans.name: Elvita

texts.en:
Elvita M. is from the village of Bungad. She is 43 years old. Elvita is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Elvita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Elvita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP when she sells one of her raised animals.

In 2007, Elvita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Elvita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Elvita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Gloria Monserrate

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

Es en este bello ligar donde conocimos a la señorita Gloria.  Ella vive en La Sequita con sus padres y hermano, es soltera y tiene 19 años. Es socia del Banco Comunal desde hace 4 ciclos y está muy a gusto por la ayuda que ha recibido.
 
Se dedica al comercio vende productos de Avon (productos de belleza, perfumería y accesorios para damas, trabaja todos los días en las noches,  los sábados y domingos todo el día, deja sus productos  a crédito y cobra todas las semanas.  También trabaja en una empresa de pescado llamada Bilbosa, en la que realiza sus ventas a sus compañeras de trabajo.

Este nuevo crédito es para comprar los nuevos pedidos que tiene ya que una parte de su capital tuvo que utilizarlo en medicamentos para su papá que enfermo y ella tuvo que ayudarlo. Sus sueños son poder ayudar a sus padres y algún día tener algo mejor para su futuro.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora communal bank meets in La Sequita parish which is in Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manta, filled with hard working people devoted to and proud of their roots.  La Sequita is a parish whose residents are honest people who only know how to work and be dedicated to their families.

In this beautiful place we got to know Gloria.  She lives in La Sequita with her parents and brother.  She is 19 years old and single.  She’s been a member of the communal bank for four cycles and is very pleased with the help she’s received.

She sells Avon products (beauty products, perfumes and women’s accessories).  She works every day at night and all day on weekends.  She sells on credit and collects weekly.  She also works for a fish processing plant, called Bilbosa, and she sells to her coworkers there.

This new loan is to buy the new orders she has because she had to use part of her capital to buy medicine for her father who got sick and she had to help him out.  Her dreams are to be able to help her parents and some day have something better for her future.

loans.use: To buy Avon brand creams, perfumes, costume jewelry and cosmetics.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda R., 54, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Mario R., a maintenance man. At this time, both of them are working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Erlinda operates a general merchandise store where she mostly sells accessories. Her products range from aesthetic accessories like headbands, clips and such, to hardware like cell phone housing, chargers, screwdrivers, wrenches, etc. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece.  Her store is located by her home.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a Php 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Erlinda dreams of being able to renovate her house soon, with all of her work with the business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy more products to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Normumin

texts.en:
Normumin is 51 years old, married with 9 children. Normumin has worked in agriculture since he was a young. His father taught him how to responsibly work with each crop and now with the help of his wife and adult children, he feels a sense of dignity from his work. As a consequence, he treats each plant with affection and care until they are ready for harvest, at which point he takes them to sell in the market. Normumin would very much like to buy a house in the city to ensure the well-being and tranquility of his children and in this way improve his quality of life. The money that he is soliciting is for the purchase of seeds, chemical fertilizers, fuels and lubricants. Let’s support this hard-working and talented man so that he can obtain his goals!
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds, chemical fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma M. is a 46-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating one business venture: a  fish vending  business. She lives in Brgy. Calumpang, Oslob, Cebu.  She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.  

By working hard in her fish vending  business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000.  Vilma is now borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she can fund her business operations. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon.  Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  

Vilma aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

 About NWTF: 

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: working capital for her business

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en:
As the saying goes, opportunity knocks only once. Basilisa S. knows this truth and grabs every opportunity that comes her way. Basilisa, 53, reached high school. She is married to Maximiliano, 53, a vendor. Together, they live in Pasay City, Philippines.
Basilisa presently runs a buy and sell business. She offers her customers mostly footwear (shoes and sandals), fashion accessories, socks and apparel, among other things. She purchases these items at wholesale prices and sells them with minimum mark-up. Having been in this business for at least 20 years, she knows how to pay her dues on time. She also has an excellent reputation with her fellow community partners in Kiva partner, CCT*, and, most importantly, her customers. She is able to earn an average monthly income of 10,000 PHP.
To help her continue to operate her business, she is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP. She intends to use this money to purchase more products for her store, all the more now that the Christmas season is fast approaching. She also plans to charge up her alkaline water business so that it will also become profitable. Basilisa plans to take this opportunity to drive her businesses toward greater profitability.
Basilisa's life is never without challenges, both in her business and personal life. Nonetheless, she stays focused on the opportunities that lie ahead, and not on the failures of yesterday or the worries of today.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to replenish store inventory

loans.name: La Capilla Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama L. CapilL., por el lugar donD. se reune el grupo que es al lado D. una capilL., ubicada en Atlacomulco Estado D. Mexico. Este grupo está conformado por 9 integrantes. Eulalia O. es integrante D. este grupo.Tiene 47 años, estudió hasta 6to D. primaria. Es viuda pero ha sido muy trabajadora y ha sacado adelante a sus hijos con sus estudios, tiene 3 hijos: 1 hombre y 2 mujeres. ElL. se dedica día a día hacer crecer su negocio D. artículos D. fantasía, tiene 2 años que inició su negocio con 5 años D. experiencia, como el negocio es ambulante con mucha creatividad e inovación ha invertido en él. Solicita el prestamo para incrementar sus productos  y asi satisfacer L. demanda D. los clientes y mejorar su estabilidad económica. También desea en un futuro invertir en maquinaria para producir paletería y nevería ya que es un producto demandante por el mercado. Al momento D. solicitar este prestamo se siente feliz porque tendrá L. oportunidad D. mejorar su negocio y cumplir con sus objetivos en un plazo no muy largo y con esto espera brindarle una estabilidad económica a sus hijos.
texts.en: This group is called, L. CapilL. ("Chapel"), which originates from the fact that this group meets next to a chapel located in Atlacomulco Estado D. Mexico.  This group is composed of 9 members.  Eulalia O. is one member of this group. She is 47 years old.  Her highest level of education is the 6th graD..  She is a widow, but with her hard work has been able to support her children and their studies.  She has 3 children: 1 boy and 2 girls.  She works daily to grow her costume jewelry business.  She began her business 2 years ago with over 5 years of experience.  Since her business is mobile, she has creatively invested in refreshments and sweets, which has helped her support her family.  She is seeking a loan in order to be able to increase her merchandise and as such satisfy her customers' demands and improve her economic stability.  In the future, she hopes to invest in machinery to help produce ice-cream bars and refrigerate them since they are popular items.  At the moment, she feels happy because she has the opportunity to improve her business and fulfill her objectives in the near future.  With this, she hopes to be able to offer her family a stable financial situation.

loans.use: artículos de fantasía.

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is a farmer from Gladkovka. She is married with a young son  – Konstantin. Alla grows early spring radish, tomatoes and cucumbers in greenhouses for sale in the markets of Kherson and the neighboring regions. She has been in this business for 7 years and has already invested about 100,000 Grivnyas in it. Her net profit amounts to 3,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Alla is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to purchase seeds, wood, plastic film and fertilizers for her greenhouses. She is planning to protect her plants with a new layer of polyethylene film, stabilize the temperatures inside the greenhouses with more wood for the heating units, and use good quality fertilizers to ensure timely and ripe harvests.  These investments will bring Alla a stable income.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, plastic film, wood and fertilizers for greenhouses

loans.name: Yao  Efuaboe

texts.fr: Monsieur Yao habite quartier Batomé et est marié.  Il fait la production de sachets  pharmaceutiques.  IL s’approvisionne à Accra au Ghana et compte 2 déjà dans cette activité.  Il a son atelier de fabrication à Djidjolé à côté de la pharmacie et  a employé 2 personnes qui l’aident dans ces activités. Il  sollicite de WAGES un prêt pour acheter  3 rouleaux de film d’emballage  de 100 kg et 2 rouleaux de film d’emballage de 40 kg.
texts.en:
Mr. Yao is a married man who lives in the Batomé district. He manufactures pharmaceutical bags. He gets his supplies in Accra, Ghana, and already has two years of experience in this activity. His workshop is located in Djidjolé, next to the pharmacy, and he has two employees to assist him.

He is seeking a loan from WAGES to purchase three 100 kg rolls of packaging film and two 40 kg rolls of packaging film.

loans.use: Purchase of packaging film

loans.name: Patzolojche Group

texts.es: Doña Francisca C. L., es casada, tiene 51 años de edad, tiene 10 hijos, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, se dedica a la crianza de animales, empezo a hacer este oficio cuando tenia 45 años de edad, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es aserrador, y tiene 5 años de experiencia con este trabajo, organiza un grupo con el fin de solicitar un prestamo para invertirlo como capital de trabajo en este caso la compra de animales pequeños y criarlos para posteriormente venderlos, sueñan con ver un negocio grande para el futuro.
texts.en: Francisca C. L. is married, 51 years old, and she has 10 children. She did not have the opportunity to go to school. She raises livestock. She started this business when she was 45 years old with the support of her husband, a shepherd. She has 5 years' experience in the business. She organized a group with the intent of requesting a loan to invest as working capital, which in this case is the purchase of small livestock to raise and sell. They dream of a large business in the future.

loans.use: To use as working capital

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen N. is 32 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has four children.  Two of her children are currently in school.  Allen has a small retail shop, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Allen has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase sugar and soap for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Allen hopes to generate greater profits, buy food and take care of herself.  In the future, Allen hopes to educate her children up to university.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and soap to sell

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna E. is from the village of New Compostela, Damulog, Bukidnon. She is 39 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Myrna owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising pigs for sale. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Myrna joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her third from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Hugo Mar

texts.es: Hugo tiene 71 años de edad y es soltero. Vive en casa propia con su hermano en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Durante toda su vida, Hugo se ha dedicado a la crianza y venta de ganado mayor y menor como los vacunos, caprinos y ovinos. Esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingresos para su sustento diario. Actualmente, su casa se encuentra en un estado deteriorado. Desea usar su crédito para hacer unos arreglos en su hogar lo que mejorará su condición de vida. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 700 nuevos soles. Con este préstamo, Hugo no tendrá que recurrir a prestamistas informales los cuales le cobrarían tasas altísimas. Edpyme le ofrece su crédito a una tasa de interés más baja que otras entidades bancarias y los prestamistas informales. Eso le permitirá a Hugo trabajar tranquilo sin perjudicar su liquidez diario. Hugo posee muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de su comunidad rural.  Es muy responsable y cumple con sus obligaciones de manera puntual.
texts.en: Hugo is 71 years old and he is single. He lives in his own house with his brother in the Olmos district, a rural area with a good commercial activity located in the Lambayeque province and at more than an hour and a half form the city of Chiclayo. For all of his life, Hugo has engaged in breeding and selling livestock such as cattle, goats and sheep. This activity is his main source of income for his everyday necessities. As his house is currently in a dilapidated state, he wishes to use his credit to make some repairs in his house, thus improving his living conditions. For this reason he has thought it convenient to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 700 PEN. Thanks to this loan, Hugo will not have to turn to informal loan sharks that would ask for very high interest rates. Edpyme grants him his loan at a lower interest rate than other banks and loan sharks. This will enable Hugo to work comfortably without risking his daily liquidity. Hugo has received very good personal and professional references from his rural community. He is very responsible and he promptly complies with his obligations.

loans.use: To make some repairs to his house.

loans.name: Klaudy Yohanna

texts.es:
La señora Klaudy Yohanna F. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene un mercadito ubicado en su casa de habitacion. Klaudy es una mujer servicial con sus clientes.
Klaudy es una joven luchadora y siempre logra lo que se propone.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia al por mayor para surtir de productos su negocio, en estos momentos esta abriendo otro negocio en el centro de la aldea San Antonio de F..
Su mayor anhelo es lograr ser una gran empresaria y que sus hijos tambien puedan seguir su ejemplo y 
que sean comerciantes igual que ella.
texts.en:
Klaudy Yohanna F. works selling popular consumer products and has a small market located in her home. Klaudy is very helpful to her customers.

Klaudy is a hardworking young woman and always achieves her goals. She will use the loan to buy merchandise at wholesale in order to stock her business with products. She is currently opening another business in the center of the village of San Antonio de F..

Her biggest dream is to become a great entrepreneur and for her children to follow in her footsteps and be merchants like her.

loans.use: to buy eggs, shortening, oil, sugar, beans, milk, cheese, butter, rice, margarine, bread, cookies, soft drinks, juice, salt, condiments, churros, flour, soup, pasta, candles, matches, batteries, coffee, toilet paper, sanitary pads, soap, and toothpaste.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace currently sells bread.   She is 35 years old and married, with 5 children, 3 of whom go to school. Grace requested a loan to stock more bread to sell. 

She hopes to buy a piece of land and construct a concrete house in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more bread to sell.

loans.name: Medius

texts.en:
Medius lives in the Mulago neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are in school. Medius has a business of a restaurant. She has been in this business for less than one year, and she works 7 days out of every week. Medius sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.    

Medius has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, rice, sweet potatoes and Irish potatoes. The main business challenge(s) for Medius include defaulters, transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow big so that she owns a fully stocked restaurant. Medius lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more food items like bunches of bananas, cassava, beef and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Keila Jolany

texts.en:
Keila Jolany lives in the Choluteca region of Honduras with her two parents, both of whom she helps support economically. For the past six years, she has operated a photocopying service out of her home. In addition to running her business, Keila Jolany raises chickens and pigs at home.

Keila Jolany is a first-time borrower and she is requesting a loan of 8,000 HNL to buy paper and toner for her photocopying business.

loans.use: to purchase toner and paper for her photocopying business

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is a married man who lives in the town of Banga, South Cotabato with his family. He is a farmer and tills his own land. Edwin grows rice and corn to sell. He works hard to provide for the needs of his family.

Edwin is requesting a loan to purchase two sacks of fertilizer, two sacks of seed, and other farm inputs. He hopes to be successful someday.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seed, and farm inputs

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi comes from village Matani, Kakheti Region. This region is well known with fertile land and well developed agriculture.

Giorgi is 43 years old and lives with his wife Martia and 18-year-old son. Giorgi works as a house painter and works in his and nearby villages. Martia manages the canteen of a local school. Along with the above-mentioned jobs the family is busy with the family farm. In particular, they have two milk cows and sell approximately 55 kg of cheese per month to local dairy products retailers. Also they have four pigs. Piglets are sold in the village. Giorgi and Martia grow maize on family owned 2.5 hectares of land. They use only 30% of the land. Harvested corn is used in the farm, for feeding domestic animals. Total average monthly income of the family amounts to 800 Laris.

Giorgi requested credit for tilling the total plot (2.5 hectare) and sowing maize. He will get three times more harvest, 1/3 of which will still be used in the family farm and the rest will be sold locally. The family will get additional income from sales of maize. Giorgi plans to use the increase in income for purchasing additional milk cows.

loans.use: to purchase fuel for tractor for tilling the land and pay workers.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es:
Violeta  tiene 25 años de edad, es vive con su pareja y sus 02 hijos, ella vive en casa de sus  suegros la cual está ubicada en el caserío Chacupe Bajo, ella cual es una zona pequeña , rural que pertenece al distrito de la Victoria 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.  

Violeta  se dedica a actividades relacionadas con la agricultura y la ganadería, gracias a la confección y venta de sombreros de palma y al engorde y venta de aves de corral, desde hace varios años, ella le ayuda a su esposo económicamente al sostenimiento de su familia, gracias a su experiencia ella cuenta con clientela fija son comerciantes mayoristas de artesanía de Monsefú y turistas

Violeta  esta solicitando una préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1800 nuevos soles para compra de una mototaxi (moto con cabina para transportar personas), la cual será trabajada por su cónyuge, en cuya actividad también tiene experiencia, ya que anteriormente trabajaba en moto alquilada. La compra de este vehículo, le generaría ingresos extras al presupuesto familiar y mejoras en su calidad de vida .Se menciona que en la zona donde vive son escasas las mototaxis, la cual le generaría una buena demanda de pasajeros.

Violeta  es una mujer trabajadora, honesta y muy querida por las personas que la conocen.
texts.en:
Violeta is 25 years old and lives at the home of her in-laws with her partner and their two children. They reside in the village of Chacupe Bajo, a small rural area in the District of La Victoria that is 20 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

Violeta has business activities related to agriculture and livestock breeding. She also makes and sells straw hats and raises poultry. Violeta has managed these businesses for several years. Her husband helps her with supporting their family. Thanks to her experience, Violeta has an established customer base among the wholesale craft merchants in Monsefú and the tourists.

Violeta is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1800 PEN so that she can buy a motorcycle taxi (a motorcycle with an attached cabin for transporting people) that her husband can use for work. He has experience in this type of business, but he previously drove a rented motorcycle. The purchase of this vehicle will generate income for her family and improve their quality of life. She says that there are a shortage of motorcycle taxis in the area where she lives, so there will be high demand from passengers.

Violeta is a hardworking, honest, and well-respected woman according to the people who know her.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle taxi so that her husband can work.

loans.name: Rosiris

texts.es: Rosiris vive en el Barrio Olaya donde se dedica al arte de las confecciones de prendas de vestir femenina, oficio que emprendió como un negocio hace 2 años, inicialmente estaba ubicado en su propia vivienda, pero como fue creciendo,  porque gradualmente aumentó su infraestructura de maquinarias, se vio en la necesidad de arrendar un local para responder a su necesidades locativas y la demanda de sus clientes. Su meta más adelante es continuar perfeccionando su infraestructura, mediante la adquisición de maquinarias que le ayuden a mejorar los tiempos productivos e incrementar sus ventas. Su mayor desafío es el insuficiente capital de trabajo para invertir y aumentar su clientela,  y esto es justamente lo que planea lograr con sus credikiva. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará en mayor volumen, telas, encajes e insumos en general, para cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes y tener un stock, que le permita responder con efectividad. Actualmente Rosiris cuenta  con un  operario fijo y clientela fija,  localizada en los barrios aledaños a los cuales vende ropa terminada, también ofrece el servicio sobre medidas, es decir maneja la estrategia 1 a 1, sus proveedores son almacenes reconocidos en la ciudad de Barranquilla, a los cuales le compra de contado; igualmente brinda asesoría a sus clientes como un servicio complementario orientándolas en su vestir. Financieramente su negocio maneja una buena liquidez para responder a sus gastos y obligaciones a acorto plazo, sus cuentas por cobrar tienen una buena rotación adaptada a las especificaciones de su negocio  y su expectativa y potencial de crecimiento es  muy amplia.
texts.en:
Rosiris lives in the Olaya neighbourhood. She makes women's clothing. She started her business 2 yeas ago. Initially it was based in her own home, but as it grew she acquired new infrastructure such as machines and had to rent out some premises to meet the needs of her business and the demand from her customers. 

Her goal for the future is to continue to improve the infrastructure of her business through the purchase of new machines that will help her better her production times and increase sales. Her main challenge is the lack of working capital to invest and increase her customer base, and this is what she's aiming to achieve with her Kiva loan. She has now applied for her first loan with the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy fabric, lace and other materials wholesale to fulfil orders from her customers and have enough stock to respond effectively to business demand. 

At the moment Rosiris has an employee and a stable client base in the working class neighbourhoods where she sells her finished clothing. She also offers a tailor-made service on a one-to-one basis. Her suppliers are established warehouses in the city of Barranquilla, where she buys in cash. She also provides a consulting service to her customers, advising them on how to dress. 

Her business enjoys a solid financial situation, with good liquidity to meet expenses and short-term debt. Outstanding accounts have a good rotation, adapted to the specific needs of her business, and the growth expectations and potential of her business are excellent.

loans.use: to buy fabric, lace and other materials wholesale.

loans.name: María Del Rosario

texts.es: María del Rosario de cuarenta y ocho años de edad, reside en su casa con  cuatro hijas y dos hijos, cinco de los cuales se encuentran estudiando. María es un ejemplo de mujer y de madre ya que por mucho tiempo ha trabajado duramente para sacar adelante a su querida y numerosa familia. Ella posee un puesto en el Mercado Central de la zona donde habita en el cual vende pan dulce, pan francés y tortillas. María es muy conocida en la zona ya que es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable. Gracias a su carisma ha logrado ganarse a los clientes y cada día la demanda de rico e higiénico pan y tortillas es mayor. Ella sueña con dar a sus  hijos el estudio para que un día puedan valerse por sí mismos y puedan accesar a una mejor calidad de vida. Esta es la razón por la que sigue luchando para que su negocio sea el número uno y pueda seguir dándole los frutos para sacar adelante a su familia. Esto la ha motivado a solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar variedad de pan, maíz, leña, etc. con el fin de tener variedad y cantidad de pan dulce, pan francés y tortillas; para que los clientes siempre encuentren lo que buscan y sigan prefiriéndola. Confía en Dios que los resultados serán positivos y logrará su objetivo.
texts.en: María del Rosario is 48 years old, and lives in her home with four daughters and two sons, five of whom are students.  María is a stand-out woman and mother, and has worked very hard for a long time to help her large family.  She has a stand in the central market in the area where she lives where she sells sweet bread, French bread, and tortillas.  María is well-known in the area as a hard-working and responsible woman.  Thanks to her charisma, she has built up a base of customers and the demand for tasty and hygienic bread and tortillas grows each day.  She dreams of giving her children the education they need so they can one day support themselves and attain a higher quality of life.  This is the reason she keeps fighting so that her business will be number one and she can keep giving her family what they need to get ahead.  This is what motivated her to ask for a loan from Integral to buy an assortment of bread, corn, firewood, etc., in order to have more variety and a greater quantity of sweet bread, French bread, and tortillas so that her customers always find what they are looking for and keep preferring her.  She trusts in God that everything will turn out well and she will meet her goals.

loans.use: to buy a variety of bread, corn, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Sephora Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kibibi, leader du groupe d’affaire « Sephora », est entrepreneur, âgée de 26 ans, mère de 3 jeunes enfants. Elle est  vendeuse de carburant (petite pétrolière). Son mari est aussi petit pétrolier). Elle s’entraide avec son mari dans les affaires. Elle installe ses marchandises au long de la route, à l’entrée du quartier TMK. Il y a 5 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  3  cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  10 bidons de pétroles (d’essences kérosène, Mazout) à marchander. En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et  construire une maison.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Sephora » est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en: The client, Kibibi, is the leader of the Sephora business group. Kibibi is a 26-year old entrepreneur and the mother of 3 young children. She and her husband are both small retailers and work together selling fuel. She sells her merchandise on the roadside by the entrance to the TMK district. Kibibi has been a small retailer for 5 years. She has already successfully completed 3 loan cycles with Hekima. This new loan would allow her to buy 10 cans of fuel (kerosene, fuel oil) for resale. Kibibi would also like to build a comfortable home for her children to grow up in. The Sephora Group is mainly comprised of women, and Kibibi would like to thank Hekima for helping underprivileged women excluded from regular bank lending channels.

loans.use: to buy 10 cans of fuel (kerosene, fuel oil)

loans.name: Becareful Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Be Careful” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Waterloo, a small town in Western Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of 3,700,000 SLL from Kiva lenders in order to further expand their respective businesses.  

The leader of this group is Sulaiman. Sulaiman is 35 years old. He was born in Masinge village in northern Sierra Leone. Currently, he is residing in Waterloo together with his wife and two children. Sulaiman sells oranges, rice, palm oil, potatoes, cassava roots, etc. for the past seven years now. He has requested a loan of 800,000 SLL in order to buy the above-mentioned goods in bulk to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy oranges, rice, palm oil, potatoes, cassava roots, etc. in bulk

loans.name: Kossi Adabadji

texts.fr:
Kossi  un homme âgé 32 ans. Il est est un célibataire sans enfants.  
Kossi travaille comme ferronnier  depuis 2006. Il achète du fer et l’utilise pour fabriquer divers objets pour revendre à ses  clients composés de toutes personnes. Il travaille seul dans son activité. 
Kossia requis son premier cycle de crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du fer à béton.
Dans les prochaines années, Kossi voudrait agrandir son activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit améliorer sa vie pour mieux s'occuper de sa famille.
texts.en: Kossi is a 32 year old single man without children. He has been working as an iron craftsman since 2006, making various objects that appeals to all types of customers. He works alone. Kossi is asking for his first loan from WAGES in order to purchase concrete reinforced iron (sometimes called rebar). In the coming year Kossi would like to increase the activity of his business, and use the profits to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: purchase iron

loans.name: Elsy Edith

texts.es:
Con su anterior credikiva Elsy compro materias prima e insumos para zapatería como cuero, charol y pehants; aen la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo creikiva con el cual comprará nuevamente estos productos pues ha diseñado estilos de moda que lo requieren, preparandose para la temporada de fin de año.
Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: " Es una buena labor ayudar a financiar negocios depersonas para que puedan progresar. Gracias
texts.en:
With her previous loan, Elsy bought raw materials and supplies for making shoes such as leather and patent leather.  She is currently applying for a new Kiva loan with which she will once again buy these products as she has designed fashionable styles that need them.  She will get ready for the end-of-year season.

Elsy's message to Kiva lenders is "It is good that you help finance people's businesses so that they can make progress.  Thank you".

loans.use: to buy basic materials and supplies for shoemaking, such as leather and patent leather

loans.name: Blanca Natalia

texts.es:
Blanca de 25 años, vive en una zona periurbana llamada el “fortín”. Su negocio es una tienda ubicada en un local que está situada en la parte esquinera de su vivienda. Empezó con esta actividad haces 5 años, ya que su sector no había este tipo de negocio, inicio con poco capital. 

Actualmente su tienda está más surtida. Su  trabajo lo realiza sola, desde las 8:00am hasta las 22:00pm.
No tiene dificultad, es soltera. Tienen 2 hijos uno de 6 y el otro de 2 años, el de 6 estudia en escuela pública.

Solicita este préstamo para la compra de mercadería como: leches, bebidas, arroz, azúcar, etc. Su sueño es hacer un segundo piso a su vivienda y que su negocio incremente económicamente.
texts.en:
Blanca is 25 years old. She lives in an urban zone called El Fortin. Her business is a store located in a corner of her house. She opened her store 5 years ago because the neighborhood did not have this type of business. She started with a small amount of capital.

Now her store is better supplied. She works alone from 8:00 AM until 10:00 PM. This is not difficult as she is single. She has 2 children. One is 6 years old and the other 2 years old. Her six year old attends public school.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy supplies such as milk, drinks, rice, sugar and other products. Her dream is to add a second floor to her house, and for her business profits to grow.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as milk, drinks, rice, sugar and other products

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: Andrés, tiene la edad 27 de años, está casado y vive con su esposa actualmente. El con el crédito pretende comprar los fertilizantes para la asistencia de su cultivo. El cuenta con el terreno apto para la explotación de este cultivo y con la plantación en condiciones regulares por lo cual pretende asistirla para así mejorarla en óptimas condiciones. El quiere implementar muevas mejoras en su cafetal para así obtener el máximo de las ganancias en producción de cosecha como la calidad de grano cosechado. El pretende con el crédito o tiene como meta generar las ganancias máximas para salir adelante con el crédito y mejorar su bienestar económico cada dia. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Andrés is 27 years old.  He is married and currently lives with his wife.  With this loan, he plans to purchase fertilizers to help his crop.  Andrés has a plot of land suitable for cultivating his crop.  The field is in adequate condition, but Andrés plans to help it along and bring it up to top-quality condition.  He wants to implement new improvements in his coffee crop in order to obtain maximum profits in his harvest output and in the quality of the harvested bean.  As a goal, he plans to use the loan to generate maximum profits to get himself ahead and to improve his financial well-being each day.  This is Andrés's first loan with FUDECOSUR.  He has never taken out a loan from a state bank before, but FUDECOSUR offered him the loan with better terms and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: with assistance for his coffee crop.

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Afat

texts.ru:
Afat yavlyayetsya IDP personom ona pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Ona zamujem imeyet odnogo rebonka. Afat 21 let.
Ona uje qod kak zanimayetsya pticevodstvom i razvodit kuric. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit kuricci ldya razvitiya svoyego biznessa.
texts.en: Afat is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the city of Fuzuli. She now lives in the Fuzuli region with her family. She is married and has one child. Afat is 21 years old. She has raised chickens for the past year. Now she needs 2,000 AZN to buy chickens to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a widow and has four children. Elizabeth sells clothes and materials at Kokoado in Elmina, which she has done for 10 years. Elizabeth uses her income for her children’s upkeep. Elizabeth will use this loan to purchase more clothes for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Nofo

texts.en:
Nofo is a 40-year-old woman living in the town of Satuiatua.  She is married and has three school-aged children.  To make a living, Nofo owns and operates a business venture in the food sector running a bakery.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from baking and selling a variety of confectionaries such as cookies and cakes in the local community.  Nofo has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 1000 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Nofo joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Nofo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1500 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase baking equipment.  Nofo is now requesting a new loan of 1900 WST which will be used to purchase a new oven, baking powder and sacks of flour.  The loan will be the fourth loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Nofo plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase a new oven, baking powder and sacks of flour.

loans.name: Rowaidah

texts.en:
Rowaidah is a 36-year-old married woman from Madab, Jordan. She is a mother of five children.
Rowaidah makes handmade accessories from her home and she is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to purchase beads. She is looking to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase beads.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en: Arlyn is 36 years old, married and has four children, all of whom are currently in school. She works very hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines. She is applying for a loan for PHP 10,000 NWTF to buy additional goods to sell to her customers. She has been in this line of work for 10 years and sells a variety of items, including soft drinks, eggs, bread, canned goods and spices. Her goal is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales como pollos,cuyes y gallinas y ahora tambien se esta dedicando al negocio de compra y venta de ganado y los hace engordar y luego los vende en las distintas ferias que existe en el distrito de Anta,la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de crianza de animales y negocio de compra y venta de ganado.La socia solicita el credito para comprar pollos,gallinas,cuyes y un ganado.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member is still working breeding animals such as chickens, guinea pigs, hens and now she is also working in the business of buying and selling cattle and fattening them to sell at various market places that exist in the district of Anta. 

The member through this work supports her children. Her dream is to expand the business of breeding animals and the buying and selling of cattle. 

The member is asking for a loan in order to buy chickens, hens, guinea pigs and cattle. The member is happy for the loan and she promises to make her payments as agreed.

loans.use: to buy chickens, hens, guinea pigs and cattle

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es: El señor Yhonny es chofer propietario y esta actividad de transporte de pasajeros es la fuente de  ingresos que tiene para mantener  a su familia.  El crédito lo necesita para la compra de una caja de cambios para su movilidad, pues la actual está comenzando a fallar. Es casado, tiene un hijo y vive en alquiler ubicada en la zona  San Martín de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la cuarta vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la tercera vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Yhonny is a driver, and he has his own car.  This passenger transport business is the source of income that he has to support his family.

He needs the loan to buy a transmission for his vehicle because the one he has is starting to fail.

He has one child, and he rents where he lives in the San Martín zone in the city of La Paz.

This is the fourth time he has worked with IMPRO and the third time with Kiva.

loans.use: to replace the transmission in the vehicle that he uses for passenger transportation.

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Badenya est un groupe de l’association Djantoyerela de N’tentou. Il regroupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans. Mariées et ayant en moyenne six enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments à l’image de MARIAM qui est la deuxième personne arrêtée de la droite vers la gauche de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à N’tentou dans la  préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali).  Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y’a deux ans. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. 
MARIAM, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à N’tentou, excelle dans la vente de d’huile alimentaire et de condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des condiments alimentaires de différentes sortes (poivre, tomate, oignon,  choux, etc.).  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes et vend ses condiments à Ouelessebougou et a domicile, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 85.000 FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.

loans.use: Achat  des  condiments

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Miss Joy O. a LAPO client of distinguished features smiles when it comes to talking about her business. According to her, although I am young (25 years), I hope to expand my business
before I marry. I am in need of the sum of $300 for my business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for my food store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Nancy would like to buy farm fertilizers

loans.name: Seang

texts.en: Seang R. is 49 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  R. is a tailor and can usually make about $3.50 per day. Her husband sells soy bean juice and can make about $8.00 per day. Three of the couple's four children are still students, while the other one works in Thailand. They hope to use this loan to purchase a cart to help R.'s husband sell more soy bean juice. He will use the cart to help carry his soy bean juice around the village. In the future, the couple hopes to have enough money to repair their house and to send their children to university.

loans.use: To purchase a cart to sell soy bean juice

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente has a small stand where he sells traditional Ecuadorian dishes. His best dish is encebollado, a stew made with albacore and yucca. Vicente started off as a waiter at a local restaurant, but soon learned how to cook and started his own business. Vicente is looking to take the next step for his business and set up a restaurant.

Vicente is seeking a second loan with Kiva and Mifex. With his first he invested in utensils and he also bought the necessary ingredients to make his most popular dishes. He is anxious to move into a bigger location, but is proceeding carefully. With this loan he will buy new tables and chairs in hopes to move his business somewhere new soon.

Vicente is 59 years old and has two children. One of his sons is mentally and physically disabled. He has a speech impediment that makes communication very difficult. Vicente has dedicated his life to providing his son with the best care possible. He wants to save up in order to send him to school for people with disabilities.

loans.use: Buy tables and chairs

loans.name: Rohila

texts.ru:
Rohila T., 45 is married mother of 4 children. She has high school education. Rohila T.’s husband also engaged in sales, her oldest daughter is married, and her 3 younger children are in school. Rohila T. has been selling eggs for 5 years. In 2006, when Rohila T. joined MicroInvest lending program, she sold eggs at her place of business. Since becoming a MicroInvest borrower, Rohila T. increased her sales volume and began selling wholesale to confectioners. She now plans to switch completely to wholesale trade.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Тохирова Рохила – 45лет. Замужем, мать четверых детей, образование среднее. Муж занимается торговлей, старшая дочь замужем, трое младших учатся в школе. Вот уже 5 лет занимается она продажей яиц. В 2006 году начала кредитоваться в МЗФ «Микроинвест», тогда она продавала только на месте своей деятельности. После получения кредита она увеличила товарооборот и стала сама предоставлять товар кондитерским цехам. Сейчас её активы возросли в два раза и она планирует перейти и на оптовую продажу.

loans.use: Move into wholesale business

loans.name: Erika Damaris

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Erika. My principal activity is making clothing, and I have a small shop in my home. I have been a seamstress for two years, and this generates income with which I can contribute to my family's household expenses. Thanks to this profession I can generate income and take care of my family. Now I need to be ready with fabric and sewing accessories as the vacation breaks and Christmas are approaching, as there is greater demand for services during this time.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Hola mi nombres es Erika, mi actividad principal es la confección de ropa, cuento con un pequeño taller en mi casa de habitación, tengo 2 añod de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos, con los que puedo contribuir con los gastos de mi familia. Gracias a esta actividad que realizo puedo generar ingresos y cuidar a mi familia. Actualmente necesito preparme con tela y accesorios de costura ya que se aproximan las clausuras y la Navidad, tomando en cuenta que esta epoca hay mayor demanda

loans.use: Purchase fabric, sewing accessories and telephone cards

loans.name: Mavlyuda

texts.en: Mavlyuda M. is married and has 3 children. She has sold shoes since 2002. She buys and transports shoes from the Istaravshan and Isfara districts of her country and sells them in Spitamen. During the last 5 years of her activity, she has attracted many clients with her friendly attitude and high quality service. Her returns on the loans have been fast and now she is seeking extra capital so that she can expand her assortment of shoes in order to satisfy customer demands and improve her income.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Nguyễn Thị Bích, 40 years old, lives in Ý Yên district. She joined TYM fund in 1998. Her first loan was 60 USD which was used to open a restaurant. After a while, her business has picked up and she was getting used at making the weekly payment so she applied for bigger loans. Her restaurant is getting busier and busier and she is qualified for maximum amount of loan. All her children are grown up and they often help her running the restaurant. This time she is requesting a loan of 1025 USD to renovate her restaurant and buy more stock, getting prepared for the Tet Holiday rush

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Bích, 40 tuổi, sống tại huyện Ý Yên, tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 1998. Nguồn vốn vay được chị đầu tư chủ yếu vào cửa hàng ăn. Bắt đầu với mức vốn nhỏ là 60USD, sau một thời gian thấy công việc làm ăn hiệu quả và quen với việc trả tiền tuần chị Bích tăng dần mức vốn vay. Cửa hàng của chị ngày càng đông khách và mức vốn vay cũng thường xuyên ở mức tối đa. Các con chị đều đã trưởng thành và hỗ trợ chị rất nhiều trong công việc bán hàng. Hiện nay chị muốn vay thêm 1025USD để sửa sang và mua hàng kinh doanh trong dịp Tết.

loans.use: Renovate her restaurant, buy stock

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
Since she was very little, one of María Elena’s aunts, with whom she lived for a long time, owned a dressmaking and novelty business. Little by little, María learned the business and would help her aunt. Unfortunately, her aunt passed away sometime after that, leaving María responsible for the business, and that was how she made ends meet for her family with the help of her husband. Currently, her children are all grown up and married, and she has widowed, which caused her severe depression. However, this business is what has kept her desire to continue striving.

For that reason, María Elena does not want her business to fail. María Elena is requesting a loan for $375 that she is willing to pay in a 5-month term. With that money, María Elena will be able to buy clothing and merchandise to offer her clients a wider variety. With your help, María Elena will succeed in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde que era pequeña una tía de María Elena, con la que vivió mucho tiempo tenía un negocio de elaboración de ropa y venta de novedades. Poco a poco María fue aprendiendo este oficio y le ayudaba a su tía. Tiempo después desgraciadamente su tía falleció, quedando María Elena como responsable de este negocio. Y así fue como sacó a su familia adelante con la ayuda de su esposo. Actualmente sus hijos ya están grandes y casados y ella enviudó. Lo cual le trajo una depresión muy grande. Sin embargo este oficio e el que la a mantenido con ganas de seguir luchando por ella.

Es por eso que María Elena no quiere que su negocio se vaya decayendo. María Elena está solicitando un crédito de US $375 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero María Elena podrá comprar ropa y mercancía para poder tener más variedad para venderle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda María Elena podrá sacar adelante su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase fabric and merchandise to offer her clients a wider variety.

loans.name: Refiqe

texts.en: H. Refiqe is 46 years old and has 3 children. She owns a shop next to her house where she resells glass, ceramic and plastic products for home use. The shop is made from metal and it’s cold in winter time. She started renovating it, and has already finished adding plastic siding on the inside, which keeps the shop warmer. Refiqe is close to finishing the renovation. The only important thing that is left is roof. She needs this loan to fix the roof and to add some shelves and inventory on one of the walls that is empty.

loans.use: Shop repair and purchase of new inventory

loans.name: Zulma Yaneth

texts.es:
Zulma sells household linens through catalog. She has carried out this activity for one year to have an additional source of income and help her husband, who is a factory worker, with the household expenses. Currently they have no children, and they would like to have them in the future, but they wish to be capable of offering a higher quality of life when they arrive.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise. She needs US $250, which she will repay in 3 months. With your support, Zulma will be able to continue her development and yield successful sales.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Zulma se dedica a la venta de blancos para el hogar esto a través de catálogos, esta actividad la desarrolla desde hace un año para contar con una fuente de ingresos y así ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, quien trabaja como operador en un fabrica, por el momento ellos no tienen hijos pero desean tenerlos en un futuro, pero desean ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida cuando ellos lleguen a su hogar.

Ahora ella solicita un crédito para comprar mercancía, necesita de US $250 que pagara en 3 meses. Con tu apoyo Zulma podrá seguir desarrollándose y cosechando éxitos en las ventas.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to continue with her linen business.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: Jeanne P. est âgée de 38 ans et mariée. Elle opère en salon de coiffure à Adèta, une ville située à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Elle coiffe, tresse et lave les cheveux de beaucoup de femmes dans la localité. Son salon de coiffure est très populaire dans cette ville. Pour cette raison, elle désire ce crédit pour agrandir son établissement de beauté. Spécialement avec ce premier crédit, elle veut acheter les produits de beauté (mèches, tissages, perruques, savons liquides etc.…) afin de répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle a tenté sa chance pour améliorer sa vie

loans.use: Acheter les produits de beauté

loans.name: Halima

texts.ru:
Halima K. lives in a region called Shakhrinau. She lives with her family. She is married and has 3 children. To support her family, she must work very much. She sells goods in the market in Tursan-zoda. She sells potatoes and other kinds of vegetables. She needs money to increase her sales volume. Therefore, Halima plans to take out a loan for 450 US dollars. She will pay off the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer

Кенджаева Халима жительница района Шахринау. Живет со своей семьей. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Для того , чтобы прокормить семью ей приходится много работать . Она занимается торговлей на рынке города Турсун-заде. Продает картофекль и другие виды овощей. Ей нужны деньги для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Поэтому Халима запланировала получить кредит в размере 450 долларов США. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase sales volume.

loans.name: Claudia Elena

texts.es:
Claudia A. works very hard to continue repairing her home, which is located in the Villanueva minicipality of the city of Chinandega in the beautiful country of Nicaragua.

Today she comes to Ceprodel to request a loan to purchase construction materials to continue doing much needed repairs and improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Claudia A. es una dama que se dedica a trabajar arduamente con el propósito de continuar con el mejoramiento de su vivienda que ha iniciado a reparar en su localidad en el municipio de Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega del bello país de Nicaragua.

Hoy en día ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción y así continuar con el mejoramiento de su vivienda que tanto lo necesita.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Fermin

texts.es:
Fermin P. is from the city of San Estanislao. He is 52 years old and married to Graciela Aguilar, who is 35. They have 2 school age children.

Fermin has a Santana brand car which he uses as a taxi. He has 2 stops, one at the municipal market and the other at the bus terminal. He has worked in the taxi business since 2003, and supports his family with his taxi.

He wants to build a room designed to use for commercial purposes in his home, in order to start a second business his wife can run from home, as way to increase the family's earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Fermin P., es de la ciudad de San Estanislao, tiene 52 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Graciela Aguilar de 35 años de edad, actualmente tienen 2 hijos, y todos en edad escolar.

Tiene un Automóvil de la marca Santana, en el cual trabaja como Taxi de Pasajeros, Tiene 2 paradas, uno en el mercado municipal y otro en la Terminal de Omnibus. Trabaja en esta actividad desde el año 2003, y con este trabajo, està manteniendo a su familia

Quiere construir un salon comercial en su casa, para montar un negocio a su señora y asì optener mejores ingresos.

loans.use: Construction of a commercial space in his home, in which to start a second business

loans.name: Bimkubwa

texts.en:
Bimkubwa is a widow with 4 children aged 17, 16, 14, and 11 years old. She has been a charcoal seller and has owned a small food vendor store since 1998. Every day, she works from 6am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 125 from her sales.

Bimkubwa is now requesting a loan to buy more charcoal and food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and food items for her business

loans.name: Jahangir

texts.en: Jahangir is 56 years old. He lives in Khachmaz town. This man is married and has 2 children. 15 years ago he started this business. Now he needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy foodstuffs for improving his business.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for re-sale

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Ana Julia es casada y tiene 3 hijos: Ángela de 4, Rogelio de 2 y Ana Paola de 1 año. Ella inició el negocio para tener un ingreso más en su hogar y apoyar a su esposo con gastos familiares. Comenzó hace 1 año vendiendo y elaborando tortillas de harina, y poco a poco ha logrado hacerse de clientes.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $550 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar algo de mobiliario que necesita para su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana Julia is married and has 3 children: Ángela, 4, Rogelio, 2, and Ana Paola, 1 year old. She started her business in order to supply one more income to her household and support her husband with the family expenses. She started 1 year ago selling and making flour tortillas and little by little she has succeeded in having clients.

She requests a loan of $550, to be repaid in 6 months, to buy some units she needs for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase units for business.

loans.name: Demetrio Nicolas

texts.es: Demetrio Nicolas C. P. es Originario del departamento de Totonicapan con residencia en la Aldea Nimasac Totonicapan desde varios años aprendio el oficio de ser talabartero, hace diez años decidio hacer su propio taller y hacer su propio negocio.
