Que hasta la fecha todo le va muy bien don Nicolas se visita las oficinas de ASDIR para solicitar un credito para aumenta su capital y su propio negocio en la busca de otros mercados como Mazatenango, Quetzaltengo y con ello se ve la necesidad de surtir su mercaderia con varios productos. calzado para damas y caballeros, Niñas Ñinos.y como la compra de materia prima y maquinaria que le permite competir en el mercado y que le facilite la elaboracion  del calzado.
texts.en:
Demetrio Nicolas C. P. is originally from the department of Totonicapan, residing in the Nimasac Totonicapan village for several years. Over time, he learned the craft of handmade leather goods. Ten years ago, he decided to set up a workshop and start his own business. To this day, all has gone well and he visited the offices of ASDIR to request a loan to increase his working capital. He also wants to increase his business by expanding to other markets such as Mazatenango and Quetzaltengo. To do this, he finds himself having to increase his merchandise supply with various products such as men’s, women’s and children’s shoes. The loan will help him purchase the raw materials and machinery that allow him to compete in the market, and will facilitate his production of footwear.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina tiene 48 años, es soltera y vive de forma independiente. Se dedica a la venta de bebidas gaseosas, cerveza, etc., para solventar sus gastos económicos, ella realiza esta actividad desde hace 35 años, teniendo mucha experiencia en la venta. A Paulina le gusta su trabajo, porque le resulta muy rentable, y ya está pensando en implementar otro tipo de negocio adicional, como un restaurante, pero para esto debe crecer mucho más en su actual negocio, es por eso que Paulina recurre a nuestra ayuda. Este es su 9no préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero que solicita podrá comprar mayor cantidad de bebidas para implementar mucho más su tienda.
texts.en:
Paulina is 48 years old. She is single and she is an independent woman. She sells soda drinks, beer, etc. in order to pay her economic expenses. She has been doing this activity for 35 year; therefore she has a lot of experience in sales. Paulina likes her work, because it quite profitable. She is already thinking of implementing another additional business, such as a restaurant, but first she must make her current business grow more. That's why Paulina is asking for your help. This is her 9th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she has been very punctual with the payments. She will be able to buy a bigger quantity of drinks to have a better stocked shop with the money that she is requesting.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Svay

texts.en:
Svay K. is 58 years old and a resident of Pursat Province where she has owned a plot of land since 1979. She grows rice crops, which she plants twice a year. She is widowed and the mother of five children: three are married and live away from the family home, and two are single and attend school.

Svay K. works hard at her business activities every day and never wastes time. Rice growing is K.'s main source of income to sustain her family and especially make sure both her children receive higher education. To help do the hard physical labor of her farming work, Svay K. is applying for a loan to buy a water buffalo to use for plowing the fields and a cart to transport her rice crop.

loans.use: buy a water buffalo to use for plowing the fields

loans.name: Fatina

texts.en:
Fatina is a 48-year-old divorced woman who lives in Beirut, capitA. of Lebanon. Fatina has owned a beauty salon for twenty-eight years. She sells cosmetics, perfumes, makeup, and beauty products, as well as provides beauty care services. Fatina's business is speciA. because she has good experience, takes good care of her clients, and uses good quality beauty products. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. Fatina started her business after she got divorced because she needed money to support herself.

Fatina has been a microcredit client for seven years and has always repaid her loans on time. Her previous loans helped her improve her business and her family financiA. situation. This time Fatina has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua to purchase beauty products for her salon. In the future, she plans on writing a beauty book and expanding her business by opening a beauty institute.

loans.use: Purchase beauty products for her salon

loans.name: Loela

texts.en: Loela M. is very grateful to HSPFI for granting her PHP5000 loan which she used to put up a sari-sari (variety) store. She is also proud of herself for venturing into retail business as this is a big help in raising her 4 children. She is in need of PHP8000 to purchase additional grocery items for sale in her sari-sari store. She wants to earn more income to support the education of her children and other family needs.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items for sale in her sari-sari (variety) store.

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Parveen Akhtar M. Khalid Group

texts.en:
Parveen akhtar baji is a forty-seven-year-old married lady and has been a citizen of Lahore, in Pakistan, for the last ten years. Parveen baji’s husband, M. K., has been in the scrap business for the past six years. Parveen baji is the mother of four children - three sons and one daughter. Her sons are involved in their father’s scrap business. Her daughter reads in 9th standard and wants to get a higher education after completing her 10th standard. Parveen baji respects her wish, and to help realize that wish she embroiders clothes and makes money selling them in a market. She successfully repaid her first two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy scrap (plastic bottles, waste papers) to sell. 

Parveen baji is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Another Parveen akthar baji wants a loan to buy rice to sell. Mussarat shaheen baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. Munawar baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy scrap for a scrap business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy scrap for scrap business

loans.name: Ismatullo

texts.ru: Бобоев Исматулло житель Варзобского района. Возраст 53 года , женат и имеет шестерых детей. Всю свою семью обеспечивает один . Работает строителем по найму. Кроме того занимается разведением коз. Опыт в данном бизнесе составляет два года. Так как козы , при хорошем уходе могут давать потомство даже два раза в год , то этот бизнес является прибыльным. Поэтому он решил обратиться к нам за кредитом , при помощи которого он сможет закупить несколько голов породистых коз.
texts.en:
Ismatullo B. lives in the Varzob district. He is 53 years old, married and has six children. He is the sole provider for his family. He works as construction worker for hire. Besides this work, he is also involved in breeding goats. Ismatullo has 2 years of experience in this business. When well-taken care of, goats can breed twice per year, making this a profitable business. This is why Ismatullo decided to obtain a loan to help him purchase several purebred goats.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr:
H. Jeanne est née le 27/01/1966 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Jeanne est mariée à HOUNGUEVOU Bernard et est mère de cinq (5) enfants, tous scolarisés. Jeanne vend des céréales et autres produits alimentaires. Pour renforcer son fonds de roulement, Jeanne a eu à solliciter l'appui financier de ALIDé. Jeanne a donc déjà eu cinq crédits de la part de ALIDé. Mais Jeanne veut continuer de développer son activité pour pouvoir élever son revenu. C'est pourquoi Jeanne sollicite un sixième crédit à ALIDé.  

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
H. Jeanne was born on January 27, 1966 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to HOUNGUEVOU Bernard and is the mother of five children, all schooled. She sells grain and other foodstuff. To boost her working capital, Jeanne had requested the financial support of Alidé before. She has thus had five loans from Alidé. But she wants to continue to develop her business in order to increase her revenues. This is why she's requesting a sixth loan from Alidé.

ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grain:  corn, millet, sorghum, and beans

loans.name: Ni Putu

texts.en:
"Ni Putu Y. is a 43-year-old female living in the town of Brawantangi, Melaya, in Indonesia. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. To making a living, Ni Putu Y. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Ni Putu Y. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 300,000 - 400,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2007, Ni Putu Y. joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ni Putu Y. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,500,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to expand the shelter for her livestock. Ni Putu Y. is now requesting a new loan of 2,600,000 IDR, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from DINARI. Ni Putu Y. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About DINARI: The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Gemima

texts.es: Gemima tiene 33 años, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos, quienes cursan estudios primarios. Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de pescado de forma ambulatoria por los distintos lugares de su zona. Trabaja desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 11, y por las tardes vende vasitos con gelatina y chupetes en un parque cercano a su casa. A Gemima le gusta mucho su trabajo porque se mantiene activa, y su esfuerzo se debe al deseo de sacar a delante a sus hijos. Su negocio le es rentable porque cuenta con clientes regulares que constantemente le compran pescado, por otro lado, los postres y chupetes que ofrece, se venden muy rápido debido al clima caluroso de su región. Para más adelante, Gemima quiere mandar a construir un kiosco para vender con mayor tranquilidad sus productos, y dejar de caminar y exponerse al terrible sol. Con MFP, ya tiene 3 préstamos, y está muy contento con su banco comunal porque todos compañeros y compañeras trabajan responsable y solidariamente. Su esposo se dedica a proveer de pescado a los puestos de uno de los mercados de su ciudad, él vende al por mayor; y con el dinero que Gemima viene solicitando, incrementará tanto la mercadería de su esposo, como la cantidad que ella vende personalmente.
texts.en:
33-year old Gemima lives with her husband and their two children who attend primary school. For the last year she has been working as a street vendor selling fish in various places in the area. She does this work from six to eleven in the morning, and in the afternoons she sells jello and lollipops in a park close to her house. Gemima enjoys her work as it keeps her active; she puts in a lot of effort because of her wish to make a better life for her children. Her business is profitable as she has regular customers who buy fish from her, and also the desserts and lollipops sell very quickly because of the region’s hot climate. In the future, Gemima wants to have a stall built so that she can sell her products more peacefully, and not have to walk the streets in the terrible sun. She has already had three loans with Kiva partner, MFP, and is very happy with the community bank because all her fellow members work hard and are reliable. Her husband’s job is to provide the fish for the stalls at one of the markets in the town; he sells the fish at wholesale prices. With the loan Gemima plans to both increase her husband’s products and also the amount that she herself sells.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Каромат

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Каромат Бобонорова работает преподователем в местной школе. Но так как  зароботная плата учителей в нашей стране не вилика, она откармливает домашний скот в домашних условиях.
Стаж работы в сфере животноводства у Каромат 30 лет. Она передает свой огромный опыт в сфере животноводства своей невестке Хуршеде.
Муж и сын Каромат уехали на заработки в Российскую Федерацию, и присылают оттуда деньги.
Кроме животноводства Каромат работает бригадиром в дехканском хозяйстве.
На сегодняшний день у нее дома 3 голов домашнего скота, которых она должна откормить и продать осенью. С этой целью она обратилась в нашу организацию. Хочет получить кредит в размере 1200 сомони.
texts.en:
Karomat Bobonorova works as a teacher at a local school. However, since a teacher’s salary in our country is small, Karomat raises livestock at home. She has been involved in the animal husbandry field for 30 years. She is also passing this extensive knowledge to her daughter-in-law, Hursheda. Karomat’s husband and son left to work in the Russian Federation and send money home. Besides animal husbandry, Karomat works as a foreman at a dekhan farm. Today, Karomat owns 3 heads of livestock that she has to feed and sell in the autumn. She requested a loan in the sum of 1200 somoni from our organization for this purpose.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock feeding

loans.name: Luz Ayde

texts.en:
Luz is a 39-year-old single mother with two children who runs an optometry store in Cusco, Perú.  This will be her second loan with Arariwa.  She used the last loan to purchase frames, contact lenses and other eyewear accessories for her store.  With this loan she hopes to purchase more frames (her most profitable item), as well as renovate the shop with a new storefront window and display.  

Luz is a member of a communal bank called "REAL". She is one of sixteen members who meets monthly with a loan officer for repayments and financial training. She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To rennovate her optometry store

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline is 44 years old, and she is married with a child. She sells garri in the market. She hopes for a loan in the amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more garri to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more garri to sell

loans.name: Braxides Maruja

texts.es:
La señora Maruja pertenece al Banco Comunal “3 De Mayo II”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 37 años de edad, estado civil conviviente, es madre de 07 hijos y tiene estudios de primaria incompleta, (3er grado), vive en el Barrio Chacarilla Alta.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace varios años,  con un préstamo inicial de S/. 200.00 nuevos soles,  para la preparación de salteñas (alimento de la zona. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de pan e insumos para la preparación de salteñas (alimento de la zona). Ella también tiene un puesto de venta de chifles solo los días de ferias.

Su deseo es seguir con su trabajo para darles una educación a sus hijos.

A ella le gusta la cuenta interna (ahorros) y la forma de trabajo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maruja belongs to the May 3 II (“3 de Mayo II”) Community Bank, which is located in the district of Puno, in the province of Puno, in the department of Puno. She is 37 years old, lives with her partner, is the mother of 7 children, and has completed the 3rd year of primary school. She lives in the Chacarilla Alta neighborhood. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for many years. She used an early loan of 200 nuevos soles to make salteñas (a regional food, similar to an empanada). At present, she needs a loan for 500 nuevos soles to buy bread and supplies to make salteñas. She also has a stand, where she sells chifles (fried green plantains) only at fairs. Her dream is to continue her work so that she can provide an education to her children. She likes taking account of her finances (savings), and she enjoys her work.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bread and supplies to make salteñas, a regional food similar to an empanada

loans.name: Wisdom

texts.en: Wisdom sells medicines and has been in the business since 1997. He lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. He is 39 years old and married, with 4 children. He hopes for a loan in the amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more medicines to sell. He thanks all his lenders.

loans.use: To purchase medicines to sell

loans.name: Vera

texts.es: La señora V., pertenece al  Banco Comunal “Señor Cautivo II”, Distrito de Bagua Grande, Provincia Utcubamba, Departamento de Amazonas. Es convivente, tiene 36 años, tiene 02 hijos  que aun dependen de ella y están en estudios secundarios.Es poseedora de un gran fortaleza y un gran espíritu de superación, la necesidad de generar mas ingresos en casa, para tener una mejor calidad de vida y apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios le motivaron a iniciarse en la venta de comida y golosinas, la facilidad que tiene para desenvolverse en el negocio le ha permitido hacer crecer su kiosco que tiene en uno de los colegios de la ciudad. En la actualidad tiene una clientela fija que son los alumnos y profesores por que ven que los productos que ella ofrece son de muy buena calidad y  son atendidos con amabilidad que es lo que a ella le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, comprará golosinas y productos necesarios para vender comida como: chocolates en cajas, gaseosas de diversos sabores, marcas y tamaños, leche tarros grandes y pequeños,  frugos, galletas, papa, arroz, carnes rojas por kilos, platos desechables y  entre otros. V., quiere tener surtido su kiosco, para que sus clientes encuentren lo que necesiten. V., se siente con muchas ganas  de seguir trabajando, y  aportando en su hogar, esta muy contenta y agradecida con la labor y el apoyo que recibe del Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse y de esta manera a apoyar a la realización de sus sueños y metas.

loans.use: Comprará insumos, para preparar sus comidas.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is 45 years old and married with five children between the ages of 14 and 20. Her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. Sylvia resides in a one-room rented house with five other people. There is no electricity and piped water in the home. The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area in the outskirts of Kampala in the Ndeeba Mpomba zone.

Rehema works seven days a week. She buys cassava potatoes and maize where she works so she doesn’t incur extra transportation costs to and from shopping. She doesn’t pay rent on a market stall because she sells from her home. She sells to all categories of people.

Sylvia has been in this business for twenty years and with MCDT for six, now servicing her fifteenth loan and working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more cassava potatoes and maize to sell. Rehema would like to see her business grow so she could start buying products to sell directly from farmers.

loans.use: To buy more cassava potatoes and maize

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca sells provisions and foodstuffs. She is 65 years old and married with 7 children. She has been in business for 4 years. She hopes for the loan amount of N500000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs. She says thanks you to all her kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
“Life is what we make it,” says Liza M. of Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Antonio and they are blessed with three children.  All study in secondary and elementary schools. They have a great dream that all of their children will become successful. 

They strive to earn enough income to support the financial needs of their children. Her husband is a construction worker and Liza is a dress maker. Through her efforts and sacrifices, she earned a net income of PHP 5,000 used for their daily needs.  Sending their children to school is very costly.

Liza is requesting a loan of PHP 16,000 from KIVA lenders to purchase materials she needed to make more dresses. She hopes to improve her business with the help of KIVA lenders.

loans.use: Buy dress making supplies.

loans.name: Len

texts.en: Len D., 26, is single. She resides in Battambong Province, Cambodia with her parents. To make a living, she is engaged in the business of selling various kinds of groceries, earning an income of US $5 per day. This is the  primary source of income for the family and helps cover the family's expenses. D. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living. Therefore, D. is asking for a loan of US $600 to purchase more groceries to stock her store in order to expand her current business. She hopes to be able to invest her future profits in her business, which will then generate a better income and enable her to save more money for the future.

loans.use: To buy more groceries.

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Juana J. de 47 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora que ofreces sus productos ambulantes a empresas, vecinos y da al crédito de la quincena vende ropa, zapatos, prendas de plata, el cual trabaja por catálogos de la Avon. Ocho años lleva en las ventas, cuando inicio lo hico con dinero que su hermana presto con bajos intereses. Luego para vender mas comenzó hacer préstamos en Afodenic  el cual ha invertido más y sus clientes han aumentado. Su casa es sencilla mitad de concreto y mitad de tabla poco a poco ha ido haciendo cambio. Con el préstamo anterior hico un muro en frente para poder estar un poco mas segura de la delincuencia. Tiene tres hijos dos casados y uno que estudia, ha pasado por difíciles situaciones tuvo una perdida de su mercadería por robo y quedo descapitalizada, hasta se atraso con los pago de la institución. Pero gracias a Dios logre superarme y seguido con mis ventas. Con este crédito comprare ropa variada, prendas, perfumenes y poder lograr colocar sus productos en esta temporada y cubrir sus pagos y poder sastifacer sus necesidades personales. Como apoyar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana J., 47 years old, is a hard working woman who offers her products by visiting businesses and neighbors. She gives her customers credit for two-week periods. She sells clothes, shoes, and silver jewelry from Avon catalogs. Juana has been doing this for 8 years. She began with money that her sister loaned her at low interest rates. Later, to increase sales she began to borrow at AFODENIC, increasing her investments and her customer base.

Her house is simple, half concrete and half boards. Little by little, she has been making changes. With the last loan she built a wall in front in order to be a little safer from delinquency.

Juana has 3 children; 2 are married and one is still in school. She has passed through difficult situations, including one loss of merchandise by robbery which left her without capital, and caused her to fall behind in her payments to the village bank. But thanks to God, she was able to recover and continue with her sales.

With this loan, she will buy a variety of clothes, jewelry, and perfume, adjusting her products to the season, as well as cover payments, and satisfy personal needs, such as helping her children.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY A VARIETY OF CLOTHES, COSMETICS, AND PERFUME TO SELL

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence owns an electronic store where she sells electrical goods and parts such as pliers, plugs, sockets, screwdrivers, wires etc. She has been a member of LAPO for three years now. She is 36 years old, married, and has four children. Her husband is an automobile mechanic. He repairs different kinds of vehicles. Her dream is to see her family living comfortably, having all the basic necessities of life and for her children to have a good education. She needs a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more electrical goods as well as electrical parts to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical goods and parts to sell.

loans.name: Yessenia Del Socorro

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Yessenia T. con gran ahínco se dedica a la venta de especies de todo tipo el cual los ofrece a diario en su establecimiento siendo visitada por sus clientes.

Entre las especies que ella vende se encuentran salsas de tomate, mostaza, entre otras. La necesidad que ella tiene en estos momentos es que requiere de un crédito para la compra de las especies para continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the Mercado Mayoreo, in the city of Managua, with great effort, Ms. Yessenia T. sells all types of spices. She offers them daily in her business that her clients come to visit.

With the spices that she sells, one can find tomato sauces, mustard, among other things. The need that she has at this time, is that she needs a loan, in order to buy the spices to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase spices

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua L. A. is fifty-five years old, is married, and has seven children. He and his wife have the dream of giving their children a quality education.

Joshua’s business is located at Serem, a market place in Kakamega where he sells maize. His wife also engages in selling maize. This is a business that he has been doing for the last three years and he has worked very hard, despite too many people in his area of operation doing the same kind of business as his.

At times, the maize market fluctuates depending on the harvest. Joshua is using his loan to buy more maize to expand his maize business. He also sells timber and has a big big dream of being a consultant on matters related to development. He also wants to be a great grain seller within Serem. He is very hardworking and development-conscious.

loans.use: To buy more maize to sell

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella was born in 1983 and is married to Ngeh Edwine. She lives in Ntasen quarters, Bamenda, Cameroon. The couple is blessed with two children. Stella lost her father when she was young, thus retarding her education which forced her to abandoned school. Stella joined GHAPE in 2009. She had her first loan of 40,000 FRS which she repaid promptly. Stella plans to invest this new loan in her farm and her usual farm produce. On her farm she grows cassava, beans, cocoyam (taro, a root crop), yams and vegetables. She is sure she will succeed in her business because she has fertile land. Her activity will help the community by increasing the amount of food to the satisfaction of the community. Stella plans to use the profit to pay fees, and to feed and clothe the family. She will also increase the capital of the business so as to challenge her competitors by buying more foodstuffs when the stock from the farm is getting finished. About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO (non-governmental organization) based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profit and loss, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for labor

loans.name: Musuva

texts.en:
Musuva I. is 28 and single with no children.  She owns a business venture, selling fabric handicrafts to tourists and local community members.  Musuva has 2 years of experience in this business.  Musuva needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Musuva joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Musuva's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.


The following social metrics for Musuva I. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                         1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:            1.8 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:                2.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts

loans.name: Amani

texts.en: Amani B. is currently in the business of selling various items in her shop like bags of salt, boxes of soap, etc., and is requesting a loan to stock rice, sugar, beans, etc., to sell. Amani is 31 years old and is married to a driver. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a taxi for transportation. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock rice, sugar, beans, etc., to sell

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Sabougnouma (4 femmes mariées et 1 veuve) ont en moyenne 44 ans,  3 enfants et  vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Hamdallaye  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur premier  prêt. 
Elles font la vente de condiments alimentaires, de tissus, de pagnes wax real,  des céréales et des tubercules. 
Avec leur prêt, elles comptent acheter, 3 paquets de condiments, 5 rouleaux de tissus, 5 pièces  de pagnes wax  real, 200kg de riz et 7 sacs de 100kg d’ ignames. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants. Elles vendent à domicile, dans les marchés et dans les quartiers de façon ambulante. Elles vendent au comptant souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Sabougnouma group (four married women and a window) average 44 years of age and three children and are living for the most part in polygamous families in Hamdallaye, a district of Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their customers, and this is their first loan. They sell condiments, fabrics, “pagnes” [traditional fabrics for wrap clothing], cereals and tubers. With the loan they plan to purchase 3 packs of condiments, five bolts of fabric, 5 pieces of Real wax “pagnes,” 200 kg (440 lbs) of rice and seven 100-kg (220 lbs) bags of yams. They purchase their stock at the big market of the town of Sikasso and in the nearby villages. They sell out of the house, at the market and door-to-door in town. They sell for cash, and often on credit, to a customer base composed of both women and men The group members each envision making an average monthly profit of 20,000 Central African Francs. Part of the profits will be put into savings and used for family needs. The other part will be invested into the business.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing various articles (for resale)

loans.name: Jacobo

texts.en:
Jacobo is an individual loan client with Esperanza, and his story is representative of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). He is located in El-Seibo where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. He makes his home here in a simple, rented structure with his wife and two children.

Jacobo is excited to be taking his second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loan and grown her business. He plans to use this loan to invest in his business running a "colmado" or small general store by purchasing rice, cooking oil, sugar and flour. He will use the profits to invest in his home by adding a concrete floor. He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Rice, oil, sugar, flour, coffee, among others (arroz, aceite, azúcar, harina, café, entre otros)

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en:
Cheng Y., 42, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She sells hand-made brooms for an income of about USD 2 per day. Her husband is a skillful carpenter, earning an income of USD 3 per day to help cover the family expenses.  

Y. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase wood from an old house for resale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy wood from old house for resale

loans.name: Finesse Group

texts.fr:
Finesse  est un regroupement de femmes de l’association Fotemogoban qui sont toutes mariées, avec une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies  dans la ville de San, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Les membres du groupe Finesse se  sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage,  de  parenté et sont à leur  deuxième collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso. 
Elles font le commerce de condiments, de diverses marchandises et calebasses. Elles s’approvisionnent à San, à Bla et dans les différentes foires  environnantes. 
Nana K., est le membre du groupe qui vend  les calebasses. Elle s’approvisionne à Bla pour revendre à San et  dans les foires.  
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt ci,  24 colis de calebasses.  
Avec une clientèle composée essentiellement de  femmes Nana K. vend en espèce et à crédit et espère réaliser mensuellement  un bénéfice de 13000FCFA et les autres membres du groupe comptent sur un bénéfice de 11500FCFA.
Ces bénéfices seront utilisés pour rembourser le prêt, subvenir aux besoins familiaux et réinvestir dans l’entreprise.
texts.en:
Finesse is a group of women of the association Fotemogoban who are all married.  They average 32 years of age and five children living in large traditional extended families in the city of San, Region of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  The group members know one another through ties of community and kinship, and they are now on their second collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso.  The group members do commerce in condiments, various goods, and calabashes.  They get their supplies in San, in Bla, and at the different fairs in the area.  Nana K. is the member of the group who sells calabashes.  She stocks up in Bla and sells in San and at the fairs.  She intends to use her loan to buy 24 packages of calabashes.  With a customer base composed essentially of women, Nana accepts cash or credit for her sales and hopes to make a monthly profit of 130,000 francs CFA. And the other group members plan on a profit of 115,000 francs.  These profits will be used to repay the loan, to provide for the family, and to reinvest in the enterprise. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying calabashes

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
59 year old Myrna C. is from the town of Banga. She is married and has 5 adult aged children. To make a living, Myrna owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Myrna has been engaged in her business for almost 2 years now.

In November 2009, Myrna joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Myrna from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of herfamily. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: Doña Sabina de 54 años de edad es ama de casa tiene un hijo y es madre soltera siempre lucho poara darle lo mejor a su hijo, ahora su hijo es mayor de edad la ayuda economicamente y se encuentra en el extranjero. Sabina cultiva café, maíz y frijo, también los vende por quintal, al mismo tiempo tiene venta de animales como; patos cisnes, ganzos y tiene una crianza de marranos. Asi es como Sabina obtiene dinero, ahora solicita que se le siga ayudando, y solicta este nuevo crédito para comprar abono organico, quiere abonar sus cafetales y su milpa ya que es tiempo de siembra y al mismo tiempo dese comprar concentrado para sus ganzos y cerdos y un poco de leña. Sueña con abarcar mas lugares vendiendo su café.
texts.en:
Sabina, 54, is a housewife with one child. She is a single mother who is always fighting to be able to give the best to her child. Now her child is older, helps her economically and is out of the country. Sabina grows coffee, corn and beans and sells them by quintal. She also sells animals such as ducks, swans and geese; and she also grows pigs. This is how Sabina makes money, and she is now asking that we keep helping her. She is requesting this loan to buy organic fertilizer. She wants to fertilize her coffee and corn as it is sowing time. She also wants to buy concentrate for her geese and pigs, and some firewood. She dreams of having more places to sell her coffee.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in her business

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el caserío El Porvenir del distrito de Tambogrande un distrito dedicado principalmente al cultivo de frutas, pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a labores asociadas a la crianza y venta de animales, ella cría ovejas en un corral cercano a su domicilio y cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los diversos negociantes que visitan la zona en donde vive para adquirirlas y luego revenderlas en los principales mercados de la zona.

Esta actividad es una fuente de ingresos bastante importante para la economía de su familia, ya que, con las ganancias que percibe, ayuda a su esposo en el sostenimiento de los gastos familiares. Actualmente ella desea mejorar la alimentación de sus animales para hacer que se desarrollen de mejor manera y puedan ser vendidos a un mejor precio. Para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de alimento para su ganado.

Olga es una mujer trabajadora y bastante emprendedora. Su mayor anhelo es otorgarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona donde vive es bastante estimada y repetada por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Olga is a 32-year-old mother who lives with her husband and children in the town of El Porvenir in the district of Tambogrande. This district is dedicated primarily to growing fruit. It belongs to the province of Piura and is found in the region of the same name. It is more than 3 hours from the city of Ciclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. She has spent more than 5 years raising and selling animals. She raises sheep in a corral near her home, and when they have reached a certain level of development, she sells them to various business people who visit the area to acquire them and then resell them in the main markets of the area. This activity is a rather important source of economic income for her family. With the profits that she makes, she helps her husband with their family's expenses. Currently she hopes to improve her animals' nutrition so they will develop better and can be sold at a better price. To accomplish this goal, she has requested a credit of 1000 PEN for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa. She plans to invest it in the purchase of animal feed. Olga is a hard-working woman and is quite enterprising. Her biggest dream is to offer her family a better quality of life. She is quite esteemed and respected by her neighbors in the area where she lives.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grasses to improve the nutrition of the sheep she sells

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim is the mother of seven children; four of them do different kinds of work while the other three are getting an education. 
She is a widow whose husband died a few years ago leaving her alone in this world to fight for her and her children’s survival. 
She never gave up and started sewing clothes for her local clients. 


Now her sons are grown up and they have taken the financial responsibility on their shoulders. 
Shamim has applied for a loan for her son who drives a rickshaw which he rents. Now he wants to buy his own rickshaw to minimize his expenses and increase his income. 


Shamim is a regular client of Asasah and her credit behavior is very good. This is her fifth year with Asasah.

loans.use: to purchase a rickshaw

loans.name: Sary

texts.en:
Mrs. Sary O. is a married woman who was born in 1961 and lives in Roneam Tnaot village in Takeo province. She has two children, one of whom is a driver, while the other is attending the local public school. Her husband is shown with her in the photo.

Mrs. Sary O. is a farmer who owns a half-hectare (1.25-acre) plot of land that she uses to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Net Neang, is a laborer.

Mrs. Sary O.’s problem is that her field is infertile and it is time to plow, but she does not have enough money to support doing so. So, to improve her production of rice, she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer. With the rest of the loan she will rent a plowing machine to plow her field and also pay farm laborers to grow the rice.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rent a plowing machine and pay farm laborers

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van N. is a 44-year-old married woman and local villager living in a medium-sized home with family members in Battambang Province. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. In addition, Van N. owns a rice cultivating machine with which she can provide a plowing service to her neighbors. The couple has three young kids who are no longer in school and currently work at different occupations. Van N. will be using the half of the loan she requested to build a stall next to her house where she raises a few pigs for extra profit. With the rest of the loan, Van N. will fund her efforts in cultivating rice crops.

loans.use: To build a stall and towards cultivating rice crops.

loans.name: Roland

texts.en:
Roland C. is from the village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. He is 26 years old. Roland is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Roland owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motor transport services to local community members. Roland has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Roland joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roland is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Roland from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Yedoukoua

texts.fr: N. est une femme de  47 ans, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits d'alimentation générale, elle a une ancienneté de 10 ans dans ce commerce. elle dresse son étalage de marchandises à la devanture de sa maison. elle s'approvisionne à Lomé, elle sollicite de WAGES un deuxième crédit pour acheter  10 cartons de boîtes de conserve, 6 cartons de pâtes alimentaires et divers autres produits d'alimentation générale. elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier de gblinkomé.
texts.en:
Mrs. N. is a 47 year old woman who runs a revenue-generating business selling general food products. She has ten years of experience in this business. She dresses her window display with her merchandise at the front of her store. She stocks up in Lomé. She is asking WAGES for a second loan to buy 10 boxes of canned goods, 6 boxes of pasta and other diverse food products. She is married and the mother of 2 children. She lives with her family in the neighborhood of Gblinkomé.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy general food products

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy P., 30, is single and lives with her parents, sisters and brothers in a small village along National Road Number Five approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Chanthy has been a garment factory worker for 10 years. Unfortunately, the house where she and her family live was destroyed in a fire and everyone is now living in a shelter. She is applying for a loan, her first, for $800 to build new house for the family to live in.

loans.use: To build a new house for her family

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 22 year old single man from Lebanon. He is a relatively new business owner - he has worked as a sanitary worker repairing toilets, faucets, etc. for the past five years. As per the majority of Lebanese men, he helps his family with the household expenses. All family members need to cooperate together to be able to meet the heavy expenses of daily life. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to improve his work and purchase more needed tools. In the future, he is hoping to open a shop selling janitorial supplies. He feels positive about his business potential for the coming year.

loans.use: To improve his work and purchase more needed tools.

loans.name: Grover Alberto

texts.es: El Sr. Grover es cliente antiguo que  trabaja como  jardinero en un hotel cinco estrellas de la ciudad de la paz, desde hace tiempo y en domicilios particulares donde hace mantenimiento de los jardines, vive en la casa de sus suegros con su esposa Ángela ella es enfermera, no tienen hijos ambos trabajan, el Sr.  Grover hace fumigados  para el mantenimiento de jardinería trabaja independientemente con los fumigados en domicilios particulares el esta vez solicita el crédito para implementar nuevas maquinarias  como ser la razón por la cual  solicita este financiamiento kiva.
texts.en: Grover is a former client who has worked for some time as a gardener in a five-star hotel in the city of La Paz and also at private residences where he maintains people's yards.  He lives in his in-laws' house with his wife Ángela who is a nurse.  They do not have any children and both of them work.  Grover sprays yards to maintain them.  He works independently spraying the private residences.  He is requesting this Kiva loan to set up new machinery.

loans.use: Purchase of a pruning machine and other equipment

loans.name: Shakirah

texts.en:
Shakirah N. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala west region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  Shakirah has a business of selling charcoal, which she has had for two years.  She also sells tap water.  

To help expand her business, Shakirah has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase charcoal.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Shakirah hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Shakirah hopes to become a hairdresser.   Shakirah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to earn money.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal

loans.name: Bakir

texts.ru:
Bakir G.  42 qoda. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey , sin kotoromu 17 let i sin kotoromu 15 let uchastya v shkole i oba zanimayutsya shaxmatami. Bakir jivet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. 

Bakir uje 6 let kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom prodaji pasud aksesuarov dlya doma. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit posudu i aksesuari dla doma, novix raznix form.
texts.en:
Bakir G. is 42 years old.  He is married and has two children.  His two sons, ages fifteen and seventeen, go to school and play chess.  Bakir and his family live in the Absheron region.

Bakir has been selling dishes and housewares for six years.  Now, he needs 2000 AZN to buy new and different dishes and housewares.

loans.use: Buying new goods

loans.name: Erabu

texts.en:
K. Erabu is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are currently in school. Erabu has a bar business, which she has run for less than a year.
To help expand her business, Erabu has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more drinks and also to set up a retail shop. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Erabu hopes to generate greater profits and pay her children's school fees. In the future, Erabu hopes to own a retail shop.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks for her bar and set up a retail shop

loans.name: Alecia

texts.en:
Alecia C. is from the village of Dinas,Sinacaban,Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old. Alecia is married and has 5 adult-age children. To make a living, Alecia owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating tricycle transport services. Alecia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Alecia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to add additional capital to her business. Alecia is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Alecia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Uuganbayar

texts.en: Uuganbayar is 27 years old and lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He operates a clothing retail trading business out of a stall in the largest outdoor market, Narantuul, in the city. He started his business in 2010 with working capital of 900,000 MNT, which has increased to a 1,000,000 MNT within a short period. His business is located in a popular spot of the market where he attracts many customers. He wants to expand his business in the future. He is requesting 800,000 MNT to purchase more varieties of shirts for his clothing sales business.

loans.use: To purchase more shirts

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a married man with eleven children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

For over twelve years, he has operated his snake park business.  His potential customers are local and foreign tourists visiting the area.  Jackson faces a major challenge  in the seasonality of demands in his business. During the holiday seasons he gets a lot of customers visiting the park, while during the months of January to May the number of visitors is lower. He hopes to expand his park to accommodate the number of visitors in the park in the future. 

With the loan for Kshs 40,000, he wants to purchase building materials to finish renovating his snake park. He decided to join Yehu because of its efficient of loan process.

loans.use: To renovate snake park

loans.name: Damiana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LA ÑUSTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Damiana; ella tiene 44 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de frutas, la socia vende diferentes frutas como manzanas, naranjas, uvas, platanos y sandias, la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de frutas. La socia solicita el préstamo para pagar los estudios de sus hijos.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The partner is a member of the "La Ñusta" communal bank ", located in the Calca district in the province of Calca, department of Cusco. 

The partner's name is Damiana. She is 44 years old and single with 3 children. As well as her daily activities she has a fruit selling business. She sells fruits such as apples, oranges, grapes, bananas and watermelons. She works from 7am to 9pm. Thanks to her business she is supporting her children. She would like to expand her fruit selling business. The partner is requesting a loan to pay for her children's education.

She is happy with the loan and is committed to repaying it as agreed.

loans.use: The partner requests a loan to pay for her children's education.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Palabra De Mujer. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora María, tiene 26 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro  hijos de 9, 6, 3 y 2 meses,  los dos mayores  estudian en escuela. El marido es chofer de una volqueta.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta y  también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local. Trabaja de lunes a viernes en las tardes, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada ocho días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Nos cuenta que lleva siete años que se dedica a esta actividad y lo que más vende es ropa de niños.

Este crédito es para comprar  pantalones, camisetas, blusas, ropa de niños, interiores, entre otras prendas.  Lleva cinco ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos sin tantos requisitos. Sus sueños son comprar un carro para llevar sus productos a vender a otros lugares.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the 'Palabra de Mujer' (Woman's Word) community bank meets in the town of Charapoto.  This town is known for its traditional culture and for the fact that it is located just a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here we meet María.  María is 26 years old and lives with her partner with whom she has four children aged 9, 6, 3 and 2 months.  Her two eldest attend elementary school.  Her husband is a dump truck driver.

María's business is selling all kinds of clothes.  She makes her sales door to door and also sells from her home where she has a small premises.  She works every afternoon from Monday to Friday.  She leaves her goods with her customers on credit and returns to collect payment every week.  María buys her merchandise in Guayaquil every two weeks or every month depending on what she needs.  She tells us that she has been in this business for seven years and what she sells most of is children's clothes.

María will use this loan to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses, children's clothes, underwear and other garments.  She has been a member of her community bank for five loan cycles and she likes it because the loans are dispatched quickly and don't have so many requirements.  Her dream is to buy a car so that she can take her products to sell in other places.

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, children's clothes, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo tiene 41 años de edad y tiene dos hijos. Viven en casa propia en Morropon, en el departamento de Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, el capital de la región de Lambayeque. 

Se dedica a la venta de carne y granos. Wilfredo es muy conocido en la región y cuenta con una clientela muy establecida. Desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería de granos de menestras. Con esta inversión, espera aumentar sus ventas y lograr mayores ganancias para seguir cuidando a su familia. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles. Wilfredo posee buenas referencias personales y laborales de su comunidad urbana. Ha tenido otros préstamos y ha cumplido con sus obligaciones en una manera puntual.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is 41 years old and has two children.  They live in their own home in Morropon, in the department of Piura which is more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayaque region. 

He sells meat and seeds.  Wilfredo is well known in the region and has a very well-established clientele.  He wants to increase his business by buying more legume seeds.  With this investment, he hopes to increase his sales and to get a greater profit with which to continue caring for his family.  For this reason, he decided to ask Edpyme Alternatve for a loan of 2000 nuevo soles.  Wilfredo has great personal and professional references from his urban community.  He has had other loans and has met his obligations punctually.

loans.use: to buy more legume seeds

loans.name: Merilyn

texts.en:
Merilyn is 61 years old and married. Merilyn works very hard to provide for her family.

Merilyn buys & sells rice grains in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional rice grains.

Merilyn has been in this business for five years and sells a different variety of rice grains. 

In the future, Merilyn would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional rice grains to sell

loans.name: Najjembe Women's Group A, Lugazi

texts.en:
K. Paul is the leader of Najjembe Women’s Group 1 in Lugazi. He is 38 years old and married with five children of whom three are in school. Paul has had a business selling cold water at Najjembe market to travelers for a period of eight years and he is happy that he makes 160,000/= as weekly profits. He hires four people that do the selling to the various cars that stop over for the refreshment.

 It is after Paul dropped out of school that he joined the business that has expanded over the years. He also sells "matooke" (plantains) some of which he grows himself and this boosts his income. He is very hard-working and reliable and he needs a loan to be able to buy more water for resale as well as buying seeds for planting during this rainy season.

loans.use: To buy more water for resale and seeds for planting during this rainy season.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok S. is a 34-year-old married man who currently resides in the Kompong Tom province. He is a security guard who works in HLK. He started his job more than a year ago. Sok S. is blessed with one young child who is enrolled in school. 

His wife cultivates rice and fattens pigs for extra income. The coming rainfall is good for planting the rice crop. However, Sok S.’s wife doesn’t have capital yet to use on her farm. Sok S. is seeking a loan for his wife to use to purchase fertilizer, insecticide, and seeds for planting. The couple plans to use the rest of the funds to buy piglets to raise.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, insecticide, seeds for planting and to buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 60-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and six school-age children. He has owned a poultry shop since 2009. He sells delicious grilled chicken platters and sandwiches. In parallel, he has worked as a taxi driver since 2000. It’s very common in Lebanon to have multiple jobs to be able to cover the increasing costs of food, housing, and other family expenses. He has taken advantage of two Kiva loans and was a very good client. He reports that the previous loans helped him achieve a remarkable growth and permitted him to hire four full-time employees. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase his shop’s inventory. He is certain that this loan will have positive effects on his business growth.

loans.use: to increase his shop’s inventory

loans.name: Kassofor Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de solidarité est créé le 10 juillet 2002. Il est composé de 06 femmes qui habitent toutes dans le même quartier. Elles sont pour la plus part des vendeuses au marché local.

Madame MARIAMA qui est gauche de la photo levant la main est le responsable. Elle est âgée de 41 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de six enfants. Elle a aussi en charge cinq autres enfants qui lui ont été confié par ses frères.

Elle fait un petit commerce de mangues et d'oranges. Elle a une expérience avérée dans ce domaine pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis plusieurs années.

Les profits générés par son activité lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
The solidarity group was formed July 10, 2002. They all live in the same neighborhood. Most of them sell at the local market.

Mrs. Mariama to the left of the photo raising her hand is the group leader. She is 41 years old. She is married and a mother of six. She is also responsible for five other children of whom her brothers left her in charge.

She buys and sells mangos and oranges. She has proven experience in this business, since she's been doing it for several years.

The profits from this business will allow her to support her husband in improving her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy oranges and mangoes

loans.name: Ama Enyonam

texts.fr: Agée de 38ans, Ama vend des verres des tasses au marché de Hédzranawoé  depuis 2007.  Elle est mère d’un enfant et est mariée à un médecin.  Ce premier prêt lui servira à acheter des objets de cuisine au Port Autonome de Lomé afin de répondre à la demande sans cesse croissante.
texts.en:
Ama is 38 years old. She is married to a doctor and has one child. She has been selling drinking cups and glasses at the Hédzranawoé market since 2007. 

She will use this first loan to buy kitchen items at Port Autonome in Lomé. This will help her to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy glasses for resale

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past seven years, she has operated a retail shop, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. Her greatest challenge is dealing with price fluctuations in the market. An increase in the price of goods makes buying and selling products challenging. She dreams of establishing a cereals shop in the future. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, rice and sugar for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, rice, and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Benadetti

texts.en:
Benedetti is 34 years old and married to Joseph. They are blessed with four children aged twelve, ten, seven and four years.

Benedetti has been a dairy farmer for the past three years. She earns a monthly income of 11,000 KES which she uses to support her family members.

Benedetti is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced to KADET by a staff member. She will use the loan to buy a dairy cow. With the anticipated profits she will venture into greenhouse farming.

Benedetti’s hopes and dreams are concentrated on greenhouse farming, the profits from which will educate her children and insure their wellbeing, so improving her family’s living standard.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan tiene 38 años, natural de la comunidad de Cañapiriato caserío de la ciudad de San Miguel, convive con Julissa de 33 años y fruto de esa relación concibieron 03 hijos y juntos  habitan en su propio lecho construido a base de material rustico como madera y techo de calamina. Los campos de cultivo que con tanto esfuerzo ha conseguido Juan, son el principal sustento que tiene toda su familia, sus productos son muy solicitados en la ciudad de San Francisco, ya que su notoriedad de cosechar cacao, café y frutos de maní son de muy buena calidad y por lo cual sus productos son vendidos a buenos precios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de la plaga que pueden aquejarlos, ya que esto puede afectar sus ingresos, lleva 18 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar los pesados sacos de sus productos desde la chacra hasta los tendales. Juan necesita el crédito para comprar sacos de abono y así mejorar sus tierras y posteriormente cosechar frutos de buena calidad y en abundancia. Juan posteriormente comprará más espacios de terreno pues planea sembrar más plantas de maní. Este es su segundo crédito, por la cual se siente muy contento de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de comprar lo solicitado y esta dispuesto a devolver puntualmente los pagos programados. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles comprará sacos de abono orgánico para fertilizar sus tierras.
texts.en:
Juan is 38 years old and a native of the community of Cañapiriato, a neighborhood within the city of San Miguel. He lives with Julissa, age 33, and they have three children. They reside in their own home, which is made of basic materials such as wood and a tin roof. Juan invests a great of effort into maintaining his farmland because it is the main source of sustenance for his entire family. His products are the most requested in the city of San Francisco. The cacao, coffee, and peanuts grown by Juan have earned him notoriety because of their high quality. As a result, he is able to sell these products at good prices. What he enjoys most about his work is protecting his crops from harmful pests that could negatively impact his income. Juan has been farming for 18 years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting the heavy sacks of product from the fields to the drying stations.

He needs a loan in order to buy sacks of compost so that he can improve his land and have an abundant harvest of high quality product. Later on, Juan plans to buy more land so that he can plant more peanuts. This is his second loan. Juan is very pleased to know that he will receive financial support. Now that he has been assured of his loan request, Juan promises to submit his payments on time and according to schedule. This loan of 1000 PEN will be used to buy sacks of organic compost so that he can fertilize his land.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of organic compost.

loans.name: Douglas Felipe

texts.en: Douglas lives in Choluteca, Honduras where he earns a living making and repairing shoes. Douglas has run this business for the past 25 years and has a reliable customer base. He is requesting a loan of 11,000 HNL to purchase materials for making and repairing shoes.

loans.use: to purchase leather, glue, nails, soles, insoles, laces, and heels.

loans.name: Harison

texts.en:
Harison is 43 years old, married and a father of four. For ten years, he has been tailoring to earn a living. He has employed three people to assist him in the business. Previously, he was employed. He also does farming for more income generation.  

Harison has witnessed a lot of growth in his business, through the financial support from Faulu Kenya. Now, he hopes to expand his business further. He needs 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy fabric.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla (pictured here) is 36 years old and her husband, San, is 50 years old. They live about 10 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have one son and three daughters. One is a cashier, two are in school and another one is still young.  

Phalla has full-time employment, while her husband is a motor taxi driver. He hopes to change his business from motor taxi to Tuk Tuk, because it can carry more goods and people than a motor taxi. 

Hence, Phalla decided to ask for a loan of $1,000 to buy a Tuk Tuk for her husband.

loans.use: To buy a Tuk Tuk for her husband.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 36 years old and married with three children. He runs a retail shop so as to earn a living for his family. He has been in the business for three years and has employed one person.  Besides (this business), he is employed as a driver. Previously, he used to sell second-hand clothes.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has managed to grow his business. He has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy fruits and cereals to sell.

loans.use: To buy fruits and cereals to sell

loans.name: Chhlak

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhlak, 49 years old, is a local rice cultivator who lives in the Pouk District of Seim Reap Province. She has no life partner as she has been divorced from her husband for several years. Currently, she lives with her son who works as a domestic casual worker and always shares the small income which he gets from his job with Mrs. Chhlak.

Besides the farming business, she also raises some piglets in a cage behind her house. She is able to earn an average income of around 1.50 USD each day. With her requested loan, Chhlak will be purchasing more piglets for continuing her pig-raising business, mending her old cage and will also use it to buy some farming materials for planting a rice crop with the rainy season coming now.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets, to mend her old cage and to also buy some farming materials for planting a rice crop

loans.name: Musemwa C Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Western Kenya, and the farmers of Musemwa group!  Jenifer is the facilitator of the Musemwa C group. Jenifer and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jenifer and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Jenifer takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Jenifer had an excellent maize yield harvesting 9 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Jenifer was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Jenifer will educate her children and put aside savings for future use.

In 2012, the members of Musemwa group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize

In the photograph, Jenifer is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es: La Sra. Nora  es casada tiene cuatro  hijos que son dependientes D.  la familia  la Sra. vive en la zona Villa Nueva Potosí  en  casa D. sus papás y su  actividad principal  es  artesana en joyas hace mas D. 20 años cuenta con una tienda por la zona central donD. venD. sus joyas, como ser: aretes , cadenas, ramilletes y prendedores  para Señoras D. pollera,  su esposo al igual que ella es artesano en joyas, tienen buena clientela por que realizan una joyas hermosas, la  Sra. también pertenece al banco comunal FORTUNA TEJAR, la Sra. Nora  necesita el crédito para  la compra oro y plata por mayor ya que le están haciendo una buena oferta y ella desea proveerse del material ya que estas fechas D. fin D. año tendrá mucha venta, es una persona con ganas D. superación agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mrs. Nora is married and has four independent children. She lives in the Villa Nueva Potosí area in her parent's home and has been a jewelry maker for 20 years.
