She has a store in the central area where she sells jewelry such as earrings, chains, corsages and brooches for women who wear skirts. Her husband is also a jewelry maker and they both have many customers because they make beautiful pieces of jewelry. She is also a member of the communal bank Fortuna Tejar. She needs the loan to buy wholesale gold and silver since she is being offered good prices and she wishes to have more materials since she will have more sales during the end of year holidays. She is a woman with a drive to succeed and is thankful for the help being offered by the institution.

loans.use: buy wholesale gold and silver.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael lives in Mombasa, a coastal town in Kenya. He is married and has one child aged 2 yrs. 8 months, and has been operating a clothes shop since 1999. He was introduced to Milango last year by his friend and has continued to access credit through his group. 

A loan of Ksh 70,000 will help Michael restock his shop with new clothes. He believes that with the Christmas festivities around the corner, he will make good sales over December and make savings for the education of his child next year.

loans.use: to buy a stock of new clothes.

loans.name: Adama Dite Yaye

texts.fr: Mme Adama dite yaye  est une vendeuse de poisson séché called "guedj". C'est elle même qui prépare le "kong fumé" produit chez elle pour le mettre en vente au marché de la localité ou elle habite. elle a une expérience de plus de 10 ans dans son activité.Elle a une activité un peu diversifiée car elle vend aussi des poulets de chair.Elle est membre du guichet de l'U-IMCEC de la localité ou elle habite et elle sollicite un crédit de 500000fr prévu pour l'achat de poissons a sécher ceci en vue d'augmenter la quantité de produits qu'elle propose a sa clientèle.Son vœu est d'accroitre ses gains pour améliorer d'une part les conditions de vie de sa famille et d'autre part réinvestir l'autre partie des bénéfices afin de développer d'avantage son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
Ms. Adama, "Yaye," is a seller of dried fish called "guedj". She prepares "smoked kong" (similar to catfish) at home and afterwards resells it at the market. She has been active for more than 10 years in this field. Her business is diversified because she also sells broiler chickens. 

She has been a member of UIMCEC and is asking for a loan of 500,000 Francs in order to buy fish to dry in order to augment the quantity of products she can offer her clients. Her wish is to grow her revenues in order to improve her family's living conditions and to reinvest in her business in order to further its development.

loans.use: achat de poissons a traiter pour la revente

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame is married and has 4 children. She has a middle-school education. She sells rubber bowls at Eguafo, which she has done for 5 years. Her husband is a farmer, and she uses her income to assist him in caring for their children.

Maame will use the loan to purchase rubber bowls. With the new profits, she plans to expand her busines.

loans.use: purchase rubber bowls

loans.name: Munyofwe Women Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is the facilitator of the Munyofwe Women group. Elizabeth and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Elizabeth and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Elizabeth takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to send her children to school and secure enough food for her children. In the recent 2011 season, Elizabeth had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 9 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Elizabeth was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Elizabeth will educate her children and save for future use in business and livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Munyofwe Women group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photo above Elizabeth is pictured with her group members and the field officer is standing on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Vong

texts.en: Miss Vong is a 31-year-old single woman who has been living with her husband in Ornlong Veng district, Siem Reap province. Presently she is in the business of selling some types of fruits like mangoes, grapefruits, pineapples and other fruits by walking from place to place. She typically earns an average of $3.00 per day through her business and tries very hard to gain her income. She wishes to make changes her business in order to generate a good income and to make her life more comfortable. She wants to borrow some funds from Kiva to buy a used motorcycle, and then connect it with a trailer at the side, from which she can sells her fried meatballs, bread filled with meat and pickle, pounded papaya (Khmer fast food) and some drinks. She hopes that all lenders will approve her loan and support her in this business.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Mukhbira

texts.ru: Мухбира незамужняя девушка. Она активная и трудолюбивая, старается заработать много денег, чтобы помогать родителям. Более 3 лет она занимается купле- продажей конфет и кондитерских изделий. У неё широкий ассортимент сладостей. Иногда ей помогает мать. Мухбира хочет закупить новый ассортимент сладостей, перед наступлением Нового Года, так как для изготовления подарков на рынке возрастает спрос на конфеты и другие сладости. С этой целью она запрашивает займ в размере 12000 Сомони. Она надеется в одобрении займа, так как все знают, что изготовление подарков приносит радость детям.
texts.en: Mukhbira is a single young woman.  She is active and hardworking and tries to earn a lot of money in order to help her parents.  She has been involved in buying and selling candy and confectionery goods for over three years.  Mukhbira has a wide assortment of sweets.  Sometimes her mother helps her.  Mukhbira wants to purchase a new selection of sweets prior to the New Year's holiday because the demand for candy and other sweets for making gifts is increasing.  She is requesting a loan in the sum of 12000 Somoni to achieve this goal.  Mukhbira hopes to have this loan approved because everyone knows that making presents brings happiness to children.

loans.use: to purchase sweets

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
La señora Eva es  soltera y se dedica a la actividad de pulpería y también a la venta de ropa variada en dicha pulpería, habiendo adquirido amplia experiencia en el negocio y velando por este para que se desarrolle.

Una de las necesidades que atraviesa es la de comprar la mercadería de ropa variada tales como sabanas, colchas, blusas, ropa interior y productos varios como comestibles para su pulpería.

Por este motivo, visitó Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para seguir comercializando sus productos y así satisfacer la demanda y obtener los ingresos para el bienestar de su familia, ya que esta actividad la ejerce desde hace 30 años, teniendo buenos resultados en sus ventas.
texts.en:
Señora Eva is single and runs a small grocery store for a living. She also sells various kinds of clothing in her store.  She has extensive experience in this business, ensuring its development.



She needs to purchase various clothing merchandise such as sheets, bedspreads, undergarments and also food products for her grocery store. For this reason she visited Ceprodel seeking a loan so she can continue selling her products, satisfy the demand, and bring in an income for her family's well-being as this is what she has been doing for 30 years.  She has been successful with her sales.

loans.use: purchase sheets, bedspreads, shirts, undergarments and products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
Fredy de 20 años, un joven muy trabajador con las ganas de sobresalir adelante; vive solo en su propia casa. El lugar más conocido para comprar ropa es en la ciudad de Kimbiri, es aquí donde Fredy  tiene su puesto de venta. En este lugar atiende a todos sus clientes con mucha amabilidad y cortesía, quienes visitan continuamente su puesto, debido a los novedosos modelos de ropa que trae personalmente de la ciudad de Lima para poder vender a la gente que recurre a su puesto de Fredy. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientas sobre las prendas que mejor les quedan, ya que de esta manera se distrae un poco. lleva 02 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta, ya que desde muy temprano abre las puertas de su negocio  para poder trabajar tranquilamente ya que hay demasiada competencia. Con el tiempo, desea incrementar más ropa en la cual pueda brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, se siente muy contento por la colaboración de préstamo que se le dio ya que así puede seguir trabajando con sus planes de trabajo. En su banco comunal agradece por darles la oportunidad de trabajar con ellos.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, podrá comprar más ropa para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Twenty-year-old Fredy is a hard-working young man with the desire to get ahead in life. He lives in his own home. The most well-known place for buying clothes is the city of Kimbiri, where Fredy runs his clothing stand. This is where he serves all his customers with kindness and courtesy. They visit his stand because of the latest fashions that he personally brings from the city of Lima in order to be able to sell his merchandise to his customers. What he likes most about his job is being able to advise his customers on what outfits they look best in since this is a way for him to amuse himself. He has been in business for 2 years, and he considers the hardest part of his job to be having to stay in his stand all day long, as he opens very early in order to work calmly despite all the competition. In time, he hopes to increase his inventory so that he can provide better service to his customers. This will be his first loan with MFP, and he feels very happy about it because he can continue to pursue his work plans. He is very grateful to have the opportunity to work with his microfinance group.

With the 1,000.00 PEN, he will be able to purchase more apparel to restock his shop.

loans.use: to purchase more apparel.

loans.name: Chozvo Group 10

texts.en:
Chozvo 10 are a proud group of 24 farmers who cultivate maize in Catandica, Mozambique. All group members were born and live in the Chozvo area. The group sells its crop at a fair price to Empresa de Comercialização Agricola Lda (ECA), a local agribusiness which both acts as a buyer and provides the farmers with quality farming inputs and technical advice. An investment by AgDevCo has allowed ECA to purchase a state-of-the-art maize mill, designed for use in rural areas, so it can process the farmers’ crop before selling it on. The group in total farms 19 hectares of land. All farming is done manually. The farmers require finance to purchase vital farming inputs - all of them purchase seed and some choose to also purchase fertilizer. 

Access to a group loan of 31,540 Meticais (938 USD) equates to an average of 1,314 Meticais (39 USD) per participant- enough for the farmers to purchase from ECA the inputs they need. Farming conditions in the area are extremely tough with only intermittent rainfall. However, since becoming participants on the Chozvo scheme all the farmers report life becoming easier. They can afford good quality fertilizer, which is purchased from ECA. The farmers’ crops are also bought by ECA every week - they come to their farms so the participants do not need to walk long distances to find a market for their crops. Since ECA’s arrival into their community, and with access to funds to purchase the necessary inputs, the farmers have seen their yields and incomes increasing threefold. This is allowing them to invest in their farms, buy motorbikes and send their children to school.

loans.use: To pay for farming inputs to increase maize crops yields

loans.name: Gloria Catalina

texts.en:
My food is very good and I sell under the name El Buen Sabor( the good taste. I have had my business for 5 years, and I sell sweets which are liked by people who visit my business. I give special treatment to my clients becuase I need them to continue to buy sweets from me in order to make profits to support my family.

Loan Use: Purchase potatoes, butter, yucas, plantains, flour tortillas, gas and other items.

Mi comida va muy bien con el nombre El Buen Sabor, ya que tengo cinco años de dedicarme a vender golosinas que son degustadas por personas que visitan mi negocio. A mis clientes les doy un trato super especial ya que necesito que me continuen comprando golosinas para poder tener ganancias y ayudar a mi familia.

loans.use: Compra de papas, manteca, yuca, platanos, tortillas de harina, gas y otros

loans.name: Ngat

texts.en:
Ngat is a lady of 47. She is single and supports her elderly mother (80). Her brother Thuong, 47, became blind 13 years ago and thus lives also in the same house with his child whom his wife abandoned when she was only 3 months old. The latter is 13 now and is the pride of the family who support her education: she is now in grade 5.

They do not have any land, so they live from making and selling baskets on the neighboring markets. Ngát's brother is also trying his best by working as a laborer a few days a month.

They have borrowed 60$ already twice and need a third loan of 50$. This is to buy bamboo in larger quantities and pay cash, which improves their small business. Their income has increased from less than 8$ per person per month, to over 10$ already. The loan is repaid monthly by 10$ installments.

loans.use: Buy bamboo for making baskets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Charity would like to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Alma

texts.es:
Alma O. D. M. was born August 4, 1967 in the town of Tejar Chimaltenango. She is 40 years old and married to Señor Ismael M., and they have three children. When she was 7 years old, she was orphaned by her mother and father. She had to live with an aunt, who she helped so that she could earn a few cents. Since then she has worked hard to take care of her self. Now she is dedicating her self to selling products by Oriflame, so that she can help her husband and so her children can have a good education. She needs to increase her capital because she has very few products and sometimes she receives a lot of orders. With the capital she has now, she cannot meet her clients' requests. For this reason, she needs a loan of 5,000 quetzals to succeed and help her family. Her greatest desire is to someday have a medicine shop in her town and be able to help her community.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Alma O. D. M.. Nació el 4 D. agosto D. 1,967 en el municipio del Tejar Chimaltenango, tiene cuarenta años D. edad, es una mujer casada con el señor Ismael M. en la cual procrearon tres hijos, ella a los siete años ha quedado huérfana D. madre y padre, y ha tenido que vivir con una tía en la que tenia que ayudarle para poder ganarse unos centavos y desD. entonces ha trabajado duro para mantenerse, pero actualmente se esta dedicando a vender productos D. Oriflame para poder ayudar a su esposo y a sus hijos para que ellos puedan tener una buena educación, pero ella necesita aumentar su capital en vista D. lo que tiene D. producto es muy poco y a veces tiene muchos pedidos y con el capital que tiene no cubre todo lo que necesitan sus clientes, por esa razón necesita un préstamo D. Q. 5,000.00 para poder superarse y ayudar su familia, su mayor deseo es tener algún día una tienda D. medicinas en su colonia y poder ayudar a su comunidad.

loans.use: Purchase general cosmetics to meet clients' orders

loans.name: No

texts.en:
No has been selling groceries at the marketplace for 4 years. She sells various food and household items, including dried noodles, candy, soap, and sweet cakes. She has received a loan from Mekong Plus and Kiva before, and she repaid the loan on time.

She wishes to receive another loan to increase her capital so that she can sell more items. Without the loan from Mekong Plus and Kiva, No has to borrow from a lender that charges high interest rates. She used to be worried about having enough money to replenish her stock, but she no longer needs to worry since she partnered with Mekong Plus and Kiva. She has been able to increase her earnings to 15-20,000 VND per day ($0.94-1.25).

loans.use: to buy more products for grocery stand

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 30 years old, married, and has five children. She also cares for five dependent children. She has a produce stand on the main path of her village which she has owned for the past 5 years. Today, she is selling: dried fish, tomatoes, onions, g-nuts, passion fruit, ginger, bananas, avocados, and peppers.

Sarah is very hard working, and will use her loan to buy more produce for her stand. The more items she offers her customers, the more income she earns. She dreams of buy a plot of land and building a house.

loans.use: To purchase more avocados, bananas, tomatoes, dried fish for her stand.

loans.name: Mukkaram

texts.en: Mukkaram runs a small business that specializes in the sale of onions, a popular item in her town, Spitamen. She sells them from a stall in the central market, and makes a substantial contribution to her family's income. Her husband works, but his income is not regular. She has applied for a loan to purchase new supplies of onions to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To acquire new supplies to sell to her customers

loans.name: María Del Socorro

texts.es:
When her son was three months old, Maria del Socorro began to realize that what her husband was earning each week was not enough to cover the costs of having a child. So she began to do raffles between her friends and neighbors. She met a woman who offered her the opportunity to sell products via catalog, and she began slowly by selling to the people who had been buying the raffle tickets. Today she has many more clients, including many mothers of her son's friends.

Even though she has many requests pending for products, Maria does not have enough capital to buy everything her customers are asking for. She is requesting a loan, to be repaid in 6 months, in order to buy more products, better meet her customer's demands and improve her family's quality of life. With your help Maria will be able to achieve her dream of economic stability.

Cuando su hijo tenía tres meses María del Socorro comenzó a ver que con lo que ganaba su esposo a la semana no le alcanzaba para poder pagar los gastos del niño. Y fue por eso que comenzó a hacer rifas de despensa a sus vecinos y amistades. Poco después conoció a una señora que le ofreció la venta de productos por catálogo y fue así como comenzó poco a poco a venderle a esas personas que le compraban los boletos para la rifa. Y actualmente tiene más clientela puesto que le vende a las mamás de los compañeritos de su hijo.

Sin embargo actualmente tiene varios pedidos pendientes puesto que no cuenta con el capital suficiente para poder comprar todo lo que le están solicitando. Puesto que María revende los productos en plazos pequeños. María está solicitando un crédito de US $700 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero María podrá comprar los productos que le pidieron y así logrará sacar adelante a su familia. Con tu ayuda María podrá lograr que su sueño de estabilidad económica se haga realidad.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE PRODUCTS TO SELL, BETTER MEET THE REQUESTS OF HER CUSTOMERS, AND CONTINUE TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR HER FAMILY

loans.name: Um

texts.en: Mrs. Um K., age 46, is the mother of two children and works selling vegetables at a busy market, making typically about $2 each day. Her husband is employed by a hospital making around $3 per day. Her children are enrolled in school. She would like to request this loan of $800 in oder to expand her inventory by adding more vegetables to meet her growing customer demand.

loans.use: Um would like to expand her inventory of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Khailda's Group

texts.en:
"I am Khalida P. from Lahore, [the] second largest city in Pakistan. I am married with four kids: two boys and two girls. One of my daughters is married and both [of] my sons together run a small shoe factory. They create intricate and beautiful lady's shoes. They need a loan to buy a stock of the necessary raw materials for their business as the wedding season has just started. They hope to earn higher profits by manufacturing a large number of shoes.

"I would like to borrow in a group of [a] few other women: Fozia B. will start a public call office with her share of [the] loan. Noor Jehan B. is borrowing for her husband’s tire repair centre. Lastly, Zahida P. needs this loan for her husband’s furniture business. These women are very responsible and will repay your loan in time."

loans.use: Expand shoe manufacturing business and support the other businesses

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Maria de los Angeles sells food for a living. Her business started 3 years ago by selling outside of her house, given that her husband's salary wasn't enough. Additionally, the need in that moment was too large. Due to her dedication and effort, she has progressed considerably. She now supplies orders for school banquets and special events and has a location for her business.

She needs a credit of $575, which she will repay in 6 months, to purchase a table and to expand part of her business so it will be more optimal for her clients. With your help, Angeles will continue with the success of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Maria de los Ángeles se dedica a la venta de comidas, su negocio empezó hace 3 años vendiendo afuera de su casa, dado que con el sueldo de su marido no era suficiente, además la necesidad en ese momento era demasiado grande, debido a su dedicación y esfuerzo ha progresado considerablemente, ahora surte pedidos de banquetes para escuelas y eventos especiales y cuenta con un local para su negocio.

Ella solicita un crédito por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar una mesa y ampliar parte del negocio para que sea mas optimo para sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Ángeles continuara con el éxito de su negocio.

loans.use: To remodel her business

loans.name: Felipa Leonarda

texts.es:
Mrs. Felipa is 54 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband is a teacher and she belongs to Grupo Mientras Tanto Señor de los Milagros de Yungay. She sells items of clothing in the Central Market, Yungay District and Province, Ancash State. They work to pay for their children’s education.

With this loan, repayable over four months, she plans to buy 2 dozen school sweaters.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Felipa pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Señor de los Milagros de Yungay, se dedica a la venta de ropa, en el mercado central del distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará 2 docenas de chompas de colegio. Ella tiene 54 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos, su esposo es profesor ambos trabajan para educar a sus hijos.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for sale

loans.name: Prum

texts.en:
Mrs. Prum S., 56, is a widow and works as a vegetable vendor at the Phsar Sang Ke market, which is about 6 kilometers away from the centre of Phnom Penh. With this business, she can typically earn around US$10 per day. Her married daughter (pictured in the photo) works as a cook and rents out a part of her house to people from other families. Sometimes, her daugher also assists in selling vegetables at the market, only 40% of which she then keeps to herself. 
Mrs. Prum S. currently needs a loan of US$1,000 to repair a part of her daughter's rental house to attract more tenants.

loans.use: Repair of a house for business purposes

loans.name: Fouad

texts.en: Fouad S. is 40 years old, married and lives with his wife and three children in the town of Al Houch in south Lebanon. Fouad is a car mechanic who specializes in repairing tail pipes. Lately, this business has suffered from high costs and low profits, so Fouad is looking for a new source of income to expand his business and guarantee a better life for his family. That is why he has applied for a loan of $1,200 to buy, repair and resell used cars. Fouad has been a client with Al Majmoua for the past eight years, and has always proved to be a trustworthy and reliable customer.

loans.use: To buy, repair and resell used cars

loans.name: Chhorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhorn C., 29, is a farmer who lives in Thnallok Village, Siem Reap Province. She has been farming since 1990 and earns around $3 per day. Her husband, Mr. C. Lam, 30, is also a farmer and a fisherman, who earns around $3 per day. Chhron works hard every day because she takes care of their two children and the family’s expenses. The children are young and in school. Chhorn has a large farm that was contributed by her parents and is her family's main source of income. She is requesting a loan of $1,100 to purchase a plow. This purchase will help Chhorn reduce the cost of plowing for her farmland and enable her to expand her farming business.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase a plow for her farming business

loans.name: Gazanfar

texts.en: Gazanfar was born in 1965. He lives in Khachmaz town. This man is married and has 2 children. He has been in this business for 4 years. Now he needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy foodstuffs for improving his business.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for re-sale

loans.name: Jamila's Group

texts.en:
Jamila baji is the wife of M. A. and lives in a city named Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi food. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the past 30 years. She is the mother of two sons.

Jamila baji's husband has a lathe workshop with an experience of 20 years. Her sons help their father in his business. Jamila baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy another lathe for her husband.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Kaleema baji wants a loan to buy iron to make chains which are used to tie up cattle. Naseem baji wants a loan to buy clothes to re-sell. Rani baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruit. Zahida baji wants a loan to repair her family's auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another lathe

loans.name: Gloria Maruja

texts.es:
Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal Alborada. Gloria es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 3 hijos, Gloria vende ropa en un puesto propio ubicado en el mercado 12 de abril, actividad que aprendió de sus padres desde muy pequeña, también viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región y a las fiestas de los distritos en donde hay mayor demanda, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima a donde viaja cada 15 días.

Gloria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de polos, chompas, casacas, medias. Los sueños de Gloria son sacar adelante a sus hijos con una buena educación, tener una tienda estable, arreglar su casa e implementar otro negocio.
texts.en:
Gloria is a partner in the Alborada Communal Bank. She is 32 years old, and loves with her 3 children and their father. Gloria sells clothing at a stand located in the 12 de abril market. She has worked selling clothing in the market since she helped her parents as a child. She also travels to different regional fairs, and to parties in various neighborhoods where there is greater demand. She purchases her products in the city of Lima, where she travels every two weeks.

Gloria is requesting a loan of 1000 soles which she will invest in the purchase of shirts, sweaters, jackets, and stockings. Gloria hopes to help her children progress by getting them a good education, to have a stable business, and to fix her house and open another business.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Gloria is requesting a loan of 1000 soles which she will invest in the purchase of shirts, sweaters, jackets, and stockings

loans.name: Nancy Helida

texts.en: Nancy is a member of the Violeta Village Bank. Nancy is married and has two children. With a little help from her children, Nancy runs a multi-service shop. In her shop, customers can make photocopies, use the public telephone and purchase groceries. With her loan, she will invest in her business by purchasing groceries, printer paper and toner for the copy machines.  Nancy is currently saving to ensure her children remain in the school and continue studying. She also hopes she can continue the growth of her business.

loans.use: Buy grocieries, printer paper and toner

loans.name: Pura Vida Uno Group

texts.es: EL Banco Comunal Pura Vida Uno es un grupo que con dificultades pudo concluir su anterior ciclo por socios que no cumplieron con el plan de pagos a pesar de eso el grupo siempre estuvo pendiente por la recuperación y el cumplimiento de los pagos, de esta manera es que decidieron retirar a esas personas incumplidas e integrar otras socias con el fin de poder trabajar mejor este ciclo bajo la presidencia de la señora Delfina Suleide. La mayoría de los socios (as) trabajan con mercadería de cosméticos, comida con la que generalmente ambulan por el mercado de la ciudad de Montero. De los quince integrantes 10 son mujeres emprendedoras y 5 varones responsables con ganas de trabajar y salir adelante con el apoyo y las facilidades que le otorga la institución al otorgarles un nuevo crédito. Todos los Socios (as) del grupos están agradecidos porque podrán invertir en sus pequeños puestos de venta y poder mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Existen parentescos familiare pero ellos tienen independencia económica.
texts.en:
The community bank Pura Vida Uno is a group that was able to complete its previous cycle with difficulties due to members that did not complete the plan of payments. Despite that the group always had outstanding payments because of the payment plans that they had to recover, they were able to complete the cycle. This is why they decided to retire these unpaid members and incorporate new members with the goal of being able to work better this cycle under the presidency of Señora Delfina Suleide. The majority of the members work in cosmetic merchandise or food sold in a traveling manner at the markets in the city of Montero. Of the fifteen members, ten are enterprising women and five are responsible men with the desire to work and improve with the support and facilities offered to them by the institution through a new credit. All the members of the groups are thankful because they will be able to invest in their small sales jobs and be able to improve the quality of the lives of their families. Familiar relationships exist between the members but they all have economic independence.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital for operations

loans.name: Ayyub

texts.en:
Ayyub (his wife is pictured) is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town. He is settled in the Fuzuli region of Bala Bahmanli village. He is married and has 3 children. 
Ayyub was born in 1954. This family has been in the dairy business for 10 years. Now they need a loan of 950 AZN to buy 2 cows.

loans.use: to buy 2 cows

loans.name: Nuriniso

texts.en:
Nuriniso comes from a humble family who worked very hard to get her ahead in life. She is 51 years old, a widow and has three children. For 8 years Nuriniso has dedicated herself to raising and selling cattle, a job that brings economic stability to her family. It is for her family that she works and struggles day in and day out. Her son helps her with the business.

She’s asking for a loan of $1000 USD to invest in her business and buy more cattle. A successful business will allow her to save enough money so she can arrange the marriage of her younger son. Nuriniso is committed to responsibly repaying the loan within 12 months. With your help, Nuriniso can accomplish her dream very soon.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history. Its history includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and many famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets like Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, Western culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Rezyl

texts.en:
Rezyl C. is a rice farmer. She owns a small farm, which she and her husband till to support their family. She is 23 years old and has 3 children. Her children are still young and thus aren't yet attending school. Aside from farming, Rezyl raises pigs in their backyard. She loves pigs and she thinks that having a piggery is a very profitable business. Rezyl wants to save money for her children's education. She wants them to be able to graduate college, something she and her husband were unable to do.

She is asking a CEVI loan of Php 10,000. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers to increase her harvest. Farming is their main source of living. Her family consumes most of the harvest; what remains is sold to rice traders for additional income. 

CEVI is helping Rezyl increase her yield. They give all their clients credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Клиентка Турсунова Махбуба,возратом 50  лет замужем, имеет  троих детей  проживает в районе Руми.Образования среднее.Муж клиентки занимается услугой такси.Сама клиентка занимается торговлей материалов, на местном рынке этим видом деятельности занимается уже более 10 лет.На полученные деньги, клиентка увеличит свой товар это поможет ей увеличить своих клиентов.
texts.en:
Mahbuba T. is 50 years old, married, has three children, and lives in the Rumi district. She has a high school education. The client's husband provides taxi services. She herself sells fabric at the local market, a business she has been in for over 10 years. With the loan, Mahbuba will increase her inventory, helping her to expand her customer base.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is engaged in the furniture-making business. She is 42 years old and married to Charlie, who helps her in managing their small business. They were blessed with two children: Allan - 23 years old, still a high school student and Karen - 16 years old, also a high school student. They live simply in Allinguigan 3rd, Ilagan, Isabela.

Terisita and her husband started their business 15 years ago and they are now generating a monthly income of PHP 2,000. She can say that her success in this kind of business is through patience and her positive attitude. To further improve her business, she would like to request the loan amount of PHP 7,000 that she will use to buy wood and other materials they needed in making furniture. Said amount will be of great help in pursuing her business and generating more income. She is hoping that someday her children will finish their studies thanks to their small enterprise.

Teresita is happy that her family has a harmonious relationship. In this way, she is always inspired to work hard.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia I. is 55 years old and married with 4 children. She sells bags of garri. She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more bags of garri to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of garri to sell

loans.name: Tubadilike Group

texts.en:
Miza has owned a small charcoal store and has been a juice seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for one year. She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $25. Daily she works at her business for 8 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal and juice to add her current stock, to expand her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Miza is 45 years old, married, and has two children ages 28 and 9. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Munira and Chiku. Each woman also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and juice for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita B. is from the village of Dampalan, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Carmelita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling daily home products. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Carmelita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for the business

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Con una gran sonrisa para todos sus clientes, en el Mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Martha D. se dedica a su negocio de venta de alimentos preparados por ella misma y ofrecidos todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana.

Actualmente, ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para ocuparlo para la compra de la materia prima para elaborar los alimentos. Es por esta razón que espera ser beneficiada con un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de la materia prima para elaborar los alimentos y así ofrecerlos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
With a big smile for all her customers, in the central market of the city of Chinandega, Martha D. sells food that she prepares and offers every day, starting very early in the morning. Presently, she has come to Ceprodel to ask for a loan to buy raw materials to make the food. It’s for this reason that she hopes to be given a loan from Ceprodel to buy the raw materials to make food and offer it to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Food sales

loans.name: Bouy

texts.en:
Bouy S. is 40 years old and lives in Seim Reap Province. S. and her husband are working hard to ensure a comfortable life for their five school-aged children. She has been involved in a business of cleaning houses of the people in her town with a typical income of US $2 per day to cover her family expenses. Her husband is a construction worker who always has to work hard every day in the town, earning US $3 per day.

To overcome the hardship of their current living situation and support their 5 children, S. and her husband have spent their time tirelessly at work and other businesses that are able to generate a fair income. Due to the situation of her old house, she wants to take a loan of US $600 to buy wood to repair it. She thinks that her expected new house will be able to provide safety for her children who stay at home, and she will not worry so much about them when she is far away with her business.

loans.use: buying to wood to repair their house

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mrs. Chea S. lives in Shi Sla village in Takeo province. She is 57 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are workers in the province while the other is a cow breeder. She is a grocer.

Mrs. Chea S.’s husband, Mr. Un Mean, is shown on the left of the photo. He is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which he cultivates rice. In this plantation, he faces some problems because his field is infertile and he does not have enough money to hire laborers to work on the field. In order to deal these problems, Mrs. Chea S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and to hire laborers to work on the rice field.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire laborers to work on her husband's rice field

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Charlotte is twenty six years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters who are currently in pre-school and primary school respectively. Charlotte trades in cosmetics. She sells cosmetics such as powder, cream, perfume, etc, on a table top at the lorry station. She buys her stock at the city's central market. She has been in business for some years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. Charlotte aspires to expand her business and provide quality education for her children.

loans.use: To buy stock in bulk

loans.name: Maris Stella

texts.en: Maris Stella A. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 23 years old, is married, and has two infant children. Maris Stella owns and operates a sari-sari or general store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Maris Stella joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Maris Stella is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Kisan Kumari

texts.en:
Kisan Kumari R. is the resident of Tikhidewol. Tikhidewol is located in Lalitpur and most of the people in this region are engaged in small business. Mrs. Kisan Kumari R. lives in single family with her husband and one son. Her son is studying in pre-primary school.
Both Mrs. and Mr. R. are engaged in tailoring work. Tailoring is their traditional work. They learn tailoring work from their forefathers. They make different types of clothes for both ladies and dresses. Especially they make pants and shirts for gents and Kurta Sulwar, Blouse, Makhshi, for ladies.
Now Mrs. R. is requesting for Rs 10000.00 loan to buy raw materials for tailoring work.

loans.use: to buys raw materials for her work

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Soeurn S., a 46-year-old widow with two children, runs a small grocery store in her house. Aside from this business, she owns a piece of land to cultivate rice and she is a duck breeder. Since her poultry business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more ducklings and duck feed.

Mrs. Soeurn S. lives in An Doung Samreth village in Takeo province. One of her children is attending the local school and the other one helps with his mother’s business.

loans.use: To purchase more ducklings and duck feed

loans.name: Rakhib

texts.en:
Rakhib lives in the Fuzuli region and has been in the dairy business for two years.  He is single and was born in 1988.

This young man enjoys his business. He does not buy milk from the market. Instead, with his small dairy business, he supports his family with milk, cheese, yoghurt, butter. He thinks that these products are very useful for health and is thankful for his dairy business. 

Rakhib also sells the milk, cheese, yoghurt, and butter to other families. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy two cows for increasing his dairy business. If he buys two additional cows, he estimates that he will have more products for sale and materially increase his client base and provide income for his immediate and extended family.

loans.use: Buy two cows.

loans.name: Ludah

texts.en:
Ludah S. is from the village of Mahinog, Camiguin. She is 34 years old. Ludah is separated from her spouse and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Ludah owns & operates a specialized retail store selling personal use products such as cosmetics and body spray in the local community. Ludah has been engaged in her business for over  years and earns approximately 3930 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ludah joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ludah is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Ludah from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Carlos Manuel

texts.es:
En el departamento de Chinandega, el señor Carlos C. se ha dedicado desde hace varios años a su actividad de sastrería donde elabora todo tipo de piezas de vestir y es muy visitado por los clientes que solicitan diferentes hechuras de vestir.

El señor Carlos C. es la persona que lleva el sustento a su hogar por lo que requiere mejorar las condiciones de su actividad para continuar llevando el sustento. 
Actualmente su máquina de trabajo está dañada por lo que requiere la compra de los repuestos para proceder a su reparación. Es por esta razón que el crédito lo solicitó para la compra de los repuestos con el fin de iniciar a lo inmediato la reparación de la máquina y así continuar en su actividad de sastrería.
texts.en:
Carlos C. has been a tailor for many years; he lives in Chinandega department. He creates all kinds of garments and is very popular with customers who come to request various clothing items. Carlos is the sole provider for his family and he would like to improve his business to continue to do so. His sewing machine is broken and he needs to buy replacement parts to fix it. This is the reason behind the request for financing; so that he can buy the parts and immediately begin to repair the machine in order to continue his tailoring.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy replacement parts for his sewing machine.

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
"T. Nguyễn Thị (10107050007) is a 25-year-old female living in the town of Đông Anh - Hà nội.  T. is the group leader of a four-member group L. offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual L., they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Văn Thượng (5).

T. is married and has two infant children.  To make a living, T. operates a service-based business.  The main source of income for the business comes from providing repair services to local community members.  T. has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately $153 a month from this activity.

In 2007, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  T. has successfully repaid a previous L. of 4.452.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous L. was used to purchase materials needed to provide service.  She is now requesting a new L. of 5.450.000 VND which will again be used to purchase needed materials.  The will be her 4th L. from SEDA.  T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Đào Thị T. (10107050011) is a 54-year-old female who is requesting a 4.142.000 VND L. to support her business in the food sector operating a butcher shop.

2.  Lê Thị L. (10107050009) is a 32-year-old female who is requesting a 5.014.000 VND L. to support her service-based business.

3.  Nguyễn Thị T. P. (10107050008) is a 29-year-old female who is requesting a 5.014.000 VND L. to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro-finance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this L. was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


T. Nguyễn Thị (10107050007) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông Anh - Hà nội.  T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Văn Thượng (5).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các P. thức tạo nên T. nhập, mà nguồn T. nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ sửa chữa cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa P..  T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 2.800.000 VND.  Vào 2007, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.452.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua vật tư cần thiết để cung cấp dịch vụ.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.450.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  Đào Thị T. (10107050011) là 54 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.142.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng T.t.

2.  Lê Thị L. (10107050009) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.014.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.

3.  Nguyễn Thị T. P. (10107050008) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.014.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có T. nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase needed materials

loans.name: Maria Otilia

texts.es: Maria tiene 47 años, no pudo obtener la oportunidad de terminar sus estudios, pero sabe leer y escribir. Ella tiene 5 hijos a su cargo y con mucho esfuerzo han salido adelante. El negocio al que ella se dedica es una pulpería. Inicio hace más de 8 años, por lo que el salario que ella ganaba no era lo suficiente para cubrir los gastos diarios en su hogar por lo que tenía  el deber de sacar adelante a sus hijos y fue así que ella lucho por salir adelante con esta actividad. El sueño de ella es lograr ampliar su negocio cada día hasta convertirse en una mini distribuidora. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo e invertirlo en golosinas, pan, refrescos naturales, gaseosas, café, azúcar entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Maria, 47, did not have the opportunity to finish school, but she knows how to read and write. She has five children in her care and has worked very hard to get ahead. Maria’s business is a grocery store. She started the business eight years ago, as the salary she was making did not cover her household expenses. Because she needed to raise her children, she fought to get ahead by starting this business. Her dream is to expand her business little by little until it is a mini-distributorship. This loan will be used to invest in merchandise such as candies, bread, juices, soft drinks, coffee and sugar, among other products.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise for store

loans.name: Aida

texts.es: La señora Aida es una mujer muy trabajadora, y esforzada, tiene 55 años de edad, procreo cuatro hijos  los cuales trabajan, ella es maestra y lleva muchos años laborando en la educación a muchos jóvenes para que aprendan a forjar un mejor futuro. Ahora también vende productos de cosméticos como: shampoo, cremas, vanidades, perfúmense, tonificador, talcos y body. Vende por encargo a sus clientes, por que trabaja con catálogos, pero mantiene también productos para ofertar y vender siempre ya que son otros ingresos que vienen a mejorar la manera de vivir. Ya que su salario es mínimo y tiene que cubrir muchos gastos. Con este préstamo invertirá en la compra de cosmético como: crema, perfumenes, body, vanidades, pinturas y ropa interior para dama y caballero para mejorar las ventas. Contenta por el financiamiento ya que es una fuente para incrementar el negocio y poder mantener sus ventas.
texts.en:
Aida is a very hard working and diligent woman. She is 55 years old and has four kids who all work. She is a teacher and she has been working with young people in the field of education for many years so that they can learn to create a better future. She also now sells cosmetic products such as shampoos, cremes, beauty products, perfumes, toners, talcs and body lotions. She sells depending on her clients' demands as she works from catalogues, but she always has some products to offer and sell as this means more income which will improve her quality of life. She needs this as her salary is low and she has to cover many costs. With this loan she will invest in buying cosmetics such as cremes, perfumes, body lotions, beauty products, nail varnishes and women's and men's underwear to improve sales. She is very happy with this financing as it is a way for her to expand her business and maintain sales.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics such as cremes, body lotions, beauty products, nail varnishes and underwear/Comprar cosmeticos como: crema, body, vanidades pintura y ropa interior

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La señora Andrea P. Calderón, tiene una propiedad de 6 manzanas de extensión con diferentes tipos de aéreas para explotación, tiene 2 manzanas que las utiliza para cultivar granos básicos(frijol y maíz), 1 manzanas que utiliza para cultivar hortaliza específicamente cultivo de tomate con sistema de riego, la razón para la cual utilizara este financiamiento. Es para comprar insumos agrícolas tales como, 4 quintales de urea y  7 quintales de abono, Y pago de  mano de obra para la siembra de este cultivo. Esta clienta comenzó cultivando granos básicos  únicamente en épocas de invierno, el trabajo lo hacía con ayuda de su familia, ella  es casada tiene su esposo y 2 hijos, estos son menores   de edad y no pueden ayudarles en las  actividades de trabajo pero por ejemplo en un día normal de trabajo su esposo se levanta temprano a las 4 y media de la mañana a encender el fuego o fogón  con madera seca que recolecta en el campo, ya que no tienen otro recurso para preparar sus alimentos, luego su esposa prepara el café y los alimentos, que ella y el llevaran a su trabajo en el campo y también el alimento de sus hijos quienes quedan en casa al cuido de una sobrina de ella,  porque sus hijos son menores de edad.  Esta cliente todo el tiempo se ha dedicado a esta actividad de trabajo y actualmente continua haciéndolo, y ahora ella además de cultivar granos básicos también siembra hortaliza, con esto ella espera seguir mejorando e incrementar su actividad de trabajo y poder llegar a producir más y mejor en sus áreas de cultivos, esto le ayudara a mejorar sus ingresos, permitiéndole mejorar su nivel de vida y en el futuro ella dedicarle más tiempo a sus hijos y cuidarlo ella misma. Porque como actualmente ella con su marido tienen que trabajar juntos para poder lograr cosechar y de esta forma poder tener sus ingresos ya que ellos dependen únicamente de esta actividad de trabajo de campo de la agricultura.
Doña Andrea, ha tenido 3 créditos  y lleva 3 años de trabajar con Ceprodel.
El impacto y beneficios que ha tenido con los financiamientos  es bastante importante ya que le permiten  mejorar sus actividades de trabajo lo que le han dado como resultado tener e ir mejorando su nivel de vida teniendo mejores ingresos para ella y sus familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Andrea P. Calderón has a property that measures 6 blocks long with different types of areas to develop. She has 2 blocks that she uses to raise basic grains (beans and corn), 1 block which she uses to grow vegetables. She has a tomato crop with an irrigation system, for which she will use the loan. It is to buy agricultural supplies such as: 400 kilograms of urea fertilizer, 700 kilograms of fertilizer, and to pay the farm workers' wages for this crop. This client began by farming basic grains and only did so in the winter season. She worked with the help of her family.

She is married and has a husband and 2 young children who cannot help them with the farm work. On a typical work day, her husband gets up early at 4:30 in the morning to light the fire with the dry wood that he collects in the fields, as they have no other alternative in order to prepare their food. Later she prepares coffee and food that they take with them to the fields, as well as food that is for her children who stay home and are looked after by her niece, because they are young.

She has dedicated her whole life to this type of work and is still doing it. Now, in addition to growing basic grains, she also grows vegetables, which she hopes will allow her to continue improving and expanding her labors to be able to produce more foods and better foods on her lands. This would help improve her income, allowing her to improve her quality of life. In the future, she hopes to be able to dedicate more time to her children and take care of them herself. Right now she and her husband have to work together in order to complete the harvest and in this way generate their income, as they depend solely upon their work in the fields.

Mrs. Andrea has had 3 loans with Ceprodel and has been working with them for 3 years. The loans have been beneficial and their impact is very strong, since they allow her to improve her work and, as a result, to improve her quality of life by having higher earnings for herself and for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay wages

loans.name: Faaifo

texts.en:
Faaifo U. is 32 and married with 4 children.  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale.  Faaifo has 2 years of experience in this business.  Faaifo needs a loan of WST $2250 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

Faaifo joined SPBD.  This is her 4th loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Faaifo's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Faaifo U. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                         1.7 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:            1.5 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:                2.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Aida's Group

texts.ru:
Как бы ни была сера жизнь, в ней очень много примеров невидного героизма простых людей, подвигов совершаемых каждый день, во благо детей, и семейного счастья. Базарбаева Аида – лидер этой группы. Она родом из г. Балыкчи. В свои двадцать девять лет, она уже многое претерпела: замужество, жестокая действительность повсеместной безработицы и простейшая необходимость выживать, чтобы вырастить двоих детей, которые остались у неё после брака. Аида не стала просить помощи у родных и не стала ждать посторонней, чьей – либо помощи и стала кропотливо собирать средства, чтобы начать своё дело. Четыре года назад она сумела собрать кое – какие средства и начала торговать детскими вещами на рынке. Не всё получалось сразу. Было очень много препятствий. Отсутствие собственного места для торговли само собой было самым большим препятствием. Однако, стремление изменить жизненный уровень, и обеспечить детей хорошим питанием, тёплой одеждой и уютом в доме, придавало Аиде дополнительное упорство и стремление добиться успеха. И наконец, ей всё удалось. Если раньше её товарооборот составлял всего пять с половиной тысяч сомов ($125), и при том у неё не было своего места, то теперь у неё есть своё место, а товарооборот вырос до двадцати пяти тысяч сомов($550). Её ежемесячный доход составляет двенадцать тысяч сомов. А пока, дети растут и ходят в садик и у Аиды куча планов на будущее. Целью этого кредита является вложить средства в увеличение весеннего ассортимента детских вещей. В будущем Аида хотела бы открыть свой павильон. 

У Аиды три партнёра по группе:

Сарпековой Жамал двадцать девять. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Муж Жамал работает на заводе по производству спирта и получает неплохую среднюю зарплату, а сама является домохозяйкой. Жамал обратилась за кредитом в с потребительских целях.

Дуванаевой Замире пятьдесят лет. Мужу Замиры пришлось уехать в Москву на заработки. У Замиры одна дочь, которая в данный момент учится в университете. Замира шьёт национальные изделия: подстилки, подушки, и продаёт. Замира обратилась за кредитом, чтобы вложить средства в закупку материала. 

Асанакуновой Айше сорок семь лет. У Айши один четырнадцатилетний сын, и муж. Муж работает машинистом в городском водоканале, а сама Айша помогает мужу заниматься параллельно закупкой скота. Закупкой занимается муж, а Айша ухаживает за скотом. Они решили обратиться за кредитом, чтобы купить корову.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MolBulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
However gray life may be, it has many examples of invisible heroism among simple people, brave deeds done every day for the benefit of children and family happiness. Aida B. is the leader of this group. She is from the town of Balykchi. At the age of 29, she has already lived through a lot: marriage, a harsh reality of wide-spread unemployment and a simplest need to survive in order to raise two children, who she has after her marriage. Aida decided not to ask for help from her relatives and did not wait for anyone else’s help. Instead, she started diligently saving money in order to start her own business. She was able to have some savings four years ago and started selling children’s clothing at the market. But not everything happened smoothly. She encountered many obstacles. Not having her own retail outlet was the biggest obstacle. However, the desire to change her quality of life and provide the children with good nutrition, warm clothing and comfort at home, gave Aida additional tenacity and drive to achieve success. And finally, it all happened. Whereas her previous turnover was only five and a half thousand som ($125) while not owning a retail stand, now, with having the retail stand, her turnover increased to twenty-five thousand som ($550). Her monthly income is twelve thousand som. And while the children are growing up and going to kindergarten, Aida has lots of plans for the future. The goal of this loan is putting money toward increasing the spring variety of children’s clothing. Aida wants to open her own store in the future. Aida has three partners in this group: Jamal S. is twenty-nine years old. She is married and has three children. Her husband works at a spirit manufacturing plant and gets a good, average salary. Jamal is a homemaker. She requested this loan for consumer needs. Zamira D. is fifty years old. Her husband had to leave and go to Moscow for work. Zamira has one daughter, who is currently attending a university. Zamira sews traditional goods: blankets, pillows, and sells them. She requested this loan in order to purchase sewing materials. Aysha A. is forty-seven years old. She has one fourteen-year-old son and a husband. Her husband works as a machinist at the city water station. Aysha helps her husband with livestock purchases. The husband purchases the livestock, and Aysha takes care of it. They decided to request a loan to purchase a cow.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase spring variety of children’s clothing

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La Señora Francisca tiene 48 años D. edad ella vive con su esposo y sus 5 hijos los cuales son todos pequeños con edades D. 15, 10, 8, 5, y 2 años. Ellos viven en inmediaciones D. Viloma GranD. en una zona agrícola D. la Zona D. Sipe-Sipe D. la provincia D. Quillacollo.

La Señora Francisca es una señora que con su familia que se dedica a la agricultura,  y a la producción D. leche cruda, la señora y su familia recién pudieron adquirir su pequeña propiedad  con mucho esfuerzo, su esposo no pueD. conseguir un trabajo que le genera más ingreso pues sufrió un accidente y tiene problemas en las articulaciones y no pueD. realizar muchas actividades, razón por la cual solo se dedica a cultivar en su terreno, ahí mismo es donD. tienen dos ambientes  pequeños, en este ambiente tienen sus dormitorios, la familia cocina en fogón usando leña, y ollas D. barro. La señora Francisca es una señora que busca dar siempre una mejor vida a sus hijos, una mejor educación, salud y alimentación, pues nunca recibió ella nada, pues sus padres la abandonaron desD. los 12 años y empezó trabajando en el barrio ayudado a las vecinas en la limpieza y actividades agrícolas, D. ese modo aprendió del oficio y ahora, pueD. ganar su propio dinero.
  
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. una cabeza D. ganado lechero y así poder aumentar la producción D. leche, y un poco D. semilla D. ese modo incrementar más sus ingresos y poder ofrecer a su familia un mejor nivel D. vida.
texts.en:
Francisca is 48 years old and lives with her husband and her 5 children, who are all still young, aged 15, 10, 8, 5 and 2. They live near Viloma GranD., in an agricultural area of Sipe-Sipe, in Quillacollo province. Francisca works in agriculture together with her family, and they also produce raw milk. With great effort, she and her family were recently able to acquire a small property. Her husband has been unable to obtain work that would generate more income, because he has suffered an accident and has problems with his joints, so he is limited in his activities. For this reason, he only works cultivating his land. The family has two small buildings on the land, which incluD. their bedrooms. They cook on an open fire using wood and clay pots. Francisca is a woman who is always seeking to proviD. a better life for her children, including better food, health and education. However, she herself has never received anything, since her parents abandoned her when she was 12, and she began working in the neighborhood, helping her neighbors with the cleaning and farm work. Through this she learned the traD. of farming, and now she can earn her own money. She is requesting this loan to buy a milk cow to increase her milk production, as well as some seeds, so that she can increase her income and proviD. her family with a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a milk cow

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married with two children and both children go to school. She owns a three-room house where she stays with four people. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Rose takes care of additional family members. The family gets three meals a day. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family. Rose sells second hand clothing in Bwaise market and works six days a week. She rents the shop where she operates.

Rose receives at least 10 customers a day and her customers are mainly women and children but on retail. Rose has been in this business for six years and her monthly challenges include thieves and seasonality. Rose has been with MCDT for a long time, servicing her forteenth loan.  She wants to use this loan to buy more second hand clothes. She hopes to see her business grow bigger and to start importing clothes

loans.use: To buy more second hand clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy basic ingredients for food business

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, 56, is married and has two children. He is a hardworking and determined man who does dairy farming for a living. Together with his wife, he has been farming for ten years. He also operates a retail shop to earn more income for supporting his family.

Peter is a member of “Lenres Group” in Faulu Kenya whose members guarantee each other’s loans. Since he joined the group, he has been able to save his money on a weekly basis and this has helped him invest in his business.

Peter has requested a loan of Kes 80,000 to buy a dairy cow and a calf. He hopes to be a large-scale farmer in the future. He dreams of owning a milk processing plant in ten years time.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and a calf

loans.name: Luz Marie

texts.en: Luz Marie B. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 38 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Luz Marie owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling bananas in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Luz Marie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Luz Marie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Kadiatou

texts.fr: Kadiatou B. est une femme de 29 ans, elle est célibataire et mère d'un enfant. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois  Sinthiang Houlata depuis le 12 septembre 2006 et a 7 fois bénéficié de crédit et a toujours remboursé sans difficulté. Elle a construit à domicile un petit poulailler où elle élève des poulets de chaire et son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'augmenter sa production en achetant plus de poussins afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices et pouvoir mieux prendre en charge son enfant et faire face à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Kadiatou B. is a 29 year old woman. She is single and the mother of one child. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois Sinthiang Houlata since September 12, 2006 and has been granted loans 7 times that she has always repaid without difficulty. She has built a small poultry house at home in which she raises table poultry. Her new loan will allow her to increase her production by purchasing more hatchlings in order to make more profits, enabling her to take better care of her child and meet her personal needs.

Translated from French by Marie-Elodie Bazy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her production capacity of poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: He is going to use it to improve his house. He is going to put in a new floor in his house and has to buy flooring and cement.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
