Mary Jean B. is from the village of Central Poblacion, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 30 years old. Mary Jean is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Mary Jean owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Mary Jean has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Mary Jean joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jean is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mary Jean from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Eladia

texts.en:
Eladia L. is from the village of Angga-an in the municipality of Damulog in Bukidnon Province. She is 59 years old. Eladia is married and has one grown child. To make a living, Eladia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Eladia has been engaged in her business for over two years, and she earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Eladia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eladia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. Eladia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to rent a parcel of agricultural land in order to raise additional crops. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Eladia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To rent a parcel of agricultural land in order to raise additional crops

loans.name: Susah

texts.en:
Susah D. is currently in the business of selling dried fish at the market and is requesting a loan to stock onions, tomatoes and cooking oil to sell.

Susah is 51 years old and is widowed. She has seven children and four of her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To stock onions, tomatoes and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Doris Normita

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Bellavista de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Bellavista.

Conversamos con la señora Doris, ella es casada hace 21 años  tiene 3 hijos dos mayores, y una linda bebe que es su adoración. Viven en la casa de los suegros, ya que ellos están ancianos y no hay quien cuide de ellos, además por que su esposo hace muchos años sufrió un accidente muy serio  en el carro donde él trabajaba  razón por lo cual no podía conseguir trabajo.

Nos cuenta la señora que la situación era muy difícil no tenían dinero, es así como una amiga la convenció que se dedicara  a la venta de productos de Yanbal (una revista de productos de belleza, perfumes y otros accesorios) ya lleva varios años y dice que le va muy bien.

Ella sale a vender sus productos puerta a puerta por las noches y también por pedidos que le hacen sus clientes, dice que en muchas ocasiones  compra productos cuando hay ofertas, que salen  a mitad de precio y luego los vende a precio normal lo que le deja mejores ganancias.

Este nuevo crédito lo va a emplear en comprar más productos que estén de promoción.Es socia fundadora del Banco y está muy agradecida con la fundación Espoir por que le ha ayudado mucho  sobre todo en los momentos más difíciles.

Sus metas son tener su casa propia y darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The members of the Bellevista Communal Bank meet in the community of Bellevista in Portoviejo, which has been known for many years as the city of “Los Reales Tamarindos” (a stadium where many soccer matches are held).

Upon speaking with Sra. Doris, she says she has been married for 21 years. She has three children, two of whom are adults and the other is a beautiful baby who she adores. Doris and her family live at the home of her in-laws because they are elderly and not able to care for themselves. Several years ago, her husband was in a serious car accident and is not able to work.

Doris says her situation was very difficult because she did not have any money. A friend convinced her to start selling products manufactured by Yanbal (a company that offers beauty products, perfumes, and other accessories through catalogs). She has done this for several years and says that she has done very well.

Doris sells her products door to door in the evenings and also through orders from her customers. She says that she often buys products when they are on sale. Doris purchases them at half price and then sells them at regular price to generate more income.

This new loan will be used to buy more products that are on sale. Doris is a founding member of her Communal Bank and is grateful to Fundación ESPOIR for the support it has provided during all of her difficult moments.

Her goal is to have a house of her own and provide her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase crèmes, perfumes, costume jewelry, and Yanbal cosmetics

loans.name: David Elias

texts.es: El Señor David vive en alquiler tiene dos hijitos que están estudiando en el colegio su esposa trabaja en una empresa y vende ropa. Ella le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. El señor esta trabajando en una línea   que va por Temporal hasta Pucara, cuando tiene días libres trabaja como taxista para tener mas ingresos, el crédito que le dimos utilizara para comprar llantas e incrementar para la compra de  un vehículo y este lo hará trabajar con chofer así tendrá mas ingresos y les dará mejores condiciones  de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
David rents where he lives, and he has two children who go to school. His wife works for a company, and she sells clothes. She helps him with the household expenses. This man is working on a line that goes from Temporal to Pucara. On his days off he works as a taxi driver to get more income. He will use the loan to buy tires and to increase what he has in order to buy a vehicle. Then he will have a driver work with the vehicle, and he will get more income. This will give his family better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tires and increase what he has in order to buy a vehicle

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El señor es separado, tiene dos hijas una de 16 años y la otra de 19 años, vive en el barrio San Antonio  de esta ciudad , posee una  despensa donde comercializa producto de primera necesidad y otros artículos, tiene casa propia y en el mismo lugar tiene su negocio donde también vive sus padres que ayudan también en el negocio.
 Son una familia muy trabajadora y con ganas de superarse cada día y con miras en ampliar cada ves mas su actividad actual, agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por los buenos servicios que le ha brindado como así también el queda comprometido en cumplir en tiempo y forma el compromiso adquirido con la empresa para así en un determinado tiempo poder contar nuevamente con el apoyo de la Institución para cualquier emprendimiento dentro de su negocio.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías para su negocio  como yerba mate, harina, azucar, fideos, y otros.
texts.en:
Juan is separated and has two daughters who are 16 and 19 years old.  He lives in the neighborhood of San Antonio in the city of Pilar.  He owns a store where he sells staple products and other items.  He owns his own home, and his business is in the same neighborhood.  His parents also live there, and they help with the business.

They are a very hard-working family with hopes of improving themselves every day and increasing their business.  He is thankful to the Paraguaya Foundation for the good services they have provided, and he remains committed to paying back the loan on time so that he can continue counting on the support of the Foundation for other improvements to his business.

Juan is asking for this loan to purchase merchandise for his store, including yerba mate [type of tea], flour, sugar, pasta, and other items.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for his store

loans.name: Chem

texts.en:
Chem S., 34, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean Temples. S. is employed at the factory, earning an income of USD 3.50 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of about USD 4.00 per day. The family has to spend USD 30.00 on food, USD 15.00 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 10.00 on other necessary expenses every month.

S. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike to attach to a compartment. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S. appears in the photograph with her husband.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to attach to a compartment.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Communal Bank "The Pink Women", located in the district of Ilave, province of El Collao, department of Puno. She is 72 years old and married with five children. She studied until the first year of primary school. 

Juana has worked with Manuela Ramos for four years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, and she used the money to increase the capital for her business fattening small animals such as sheep, pigs, and chickens. 

She is now asking for a loan for 1,500 PEN, money that will be used to continue operating her business. Her dream is that her children can rely on a profitable and large business 

Her favorite thing about the Communal Bank meetings is the education sessions.

loans.use: Increase her business fattening small animals

loans.name: Sombang Lestari Group

texts.en:
Ni Kadek P. is a 32-year-old female living in the town of Melaya - Bali.  Ni Kadek is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by MUK.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Sombang Lestari (PK-10364).


Ni Kadek is married and has an infant-aged child.  To make a living, Ni Kadek owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale.  Ni Kadek has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 250,000 IDR a month from these activities.


In 2010, Ni Kadek joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ni Kadek has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000,000 IDR from MUK.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  She is now requesting a new loan of 1,000,000 IDR, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  The loan will be the first loan taken out by the borrower from MUK.  Ni Kadek plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

She is very grateful for this loan, because with this loan she can get additional revenue to use to support the needs of her family and a little for savings.


About MUK:

The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans, thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.





Ni Kadek P. (0) merupakan 32 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali.  Ni Kadek adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 10 anggota.  Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar.  Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Sombang Lestari (PK-10364).


Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Ni Kadek sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 10 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Kadek menghasilkan sekitar 0,250 IDR.  Dalam 2010, Ni Kadek bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Kadek telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya sebesar 1.000.000 IDR dari MUK.  Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang.  Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1.000.000 IDR.


Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.


Tentang MUK:

Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.


  "

loans.use: To purchase baby pigs to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Dufatanye Bakozi Group

texts.fr: Jean de Dieu H. est une mécanique, et il est un membre du groupe Dufatanyebakozi.  Il a 28 ans, et il a 3 enfants entre 3 ans et 7 ans.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 pignons, 10 pneus, 10 chaines, 5 paquets de rayons, et 30 cabres d’accélérateurs pour son affaire.   Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de payer ce crédit à temps et sollicite un autre crédit avec beaucoup d’argent, alors il peut augmenter son affaire.  Il voudrait s’autofinancer lui-même, et il voudrait développer sa famille et payer les frais d’études pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jean de Dieu H. is a mechanic, and he is a member of the Dufatanyebakozi group. He is 28 years old and has three children between three and seven years old.

He will use his loan to buy 10 pinions, 10 tires, 10 chains, 5 packets of spokes, and 30 accelerator cables for his business. His strategy for increasing business is to pay this loan on time and seek another loan with a lot of money, so that he can expand his business. He would like to be self-financing, and he would like to enlarge his family and pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: Purchase of pinions, tires, chains, spokes and accelerator cables

loans.name: Safarbek

texts.en:
Safarbek is married, has four children and makes a living as a businessman in Kurgantyube, Tajikistan, selling auto accessories and spare parts in a local car market. His business, which is eight years old, is flourishing as more and more Tajiks buy vehicles, and the items he sells are always in high demand. To take advantage of this demand, he is applying for a loan for $3,000 to buy more items to sell to his customers. His goals are to maintain his leading position in the market and continue to expand his business. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients have viable business propositions. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy spare parts for cars to sell to his customers

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa A. K. sells cooked rice in Abura. She has attained a senior high level of education.  She is married and lives with her husband and two children. She assists her husband in feeding and clothing her family. Her loan will be used to buy bags of rice and others ingredients to cook for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice and other ingredients

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion P. is from the village of Dalig Viejo. She is 61 years old. Visitacion is married and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, Visitacion owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising pigs. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Visitacion has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Visitacion joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Visitacion has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Visitacion is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 12th loan taken out by Visitacion from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 36-year-old married man living in Tripoli with his wife and two kids. Ahmad works as a hairdresser. He owns a beauty salon where most of the ladies visit. Ahmad has an accepted quality of work and this is what helps him keep his clients and progress. Most of his clients are faithful and he knows how to please them. He's requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the second time in order to buy new tools in addition to furniture for his house. His previous loan helped improve his social situation as he stated. Ahmad hopes to expand his business by adding new beauty services.

loans.use: To buy new tools and to buy furniture for his house

loans.name: Avelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LA ÑUSTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Avelina; ella tiene 39 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de papa, ella vende en el mercado del distrito de Calca, ella trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar papa al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Avelina belongs to the Communal Bank “La Ñusta”, which is located in the District and Province of Calca, Department of Cusco.

She is 39 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children. Avelina divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling potatoes at the market in the District of Calca. She works from 6am to 5pm. Through this business, Avelina is able to help her children get ahead. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy potatoes in bulk.

Avelina is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: Purchase potatoes in bulk

loans.name: Aura Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Palabra De Mujer. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar encontramos a al señora Aura, tiene 26 años de edad y en la actualidad está separada pero de esa relación tiene dos hijos de 9 y 3 años de edad, el mayor esta en escuela. Ella vive con sus hijos en casa de sus padres.

Ella en sociedad con su padre tiene un taller de mecánica automotriz, mientras ella se encarga de lo que es trabajo de administración y venta de lubricantes, aceites y repuestos su papa se encarga del arreglos que  los carros de sus  clientes, trabajan todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00, nos cuenta que su papa lleva con su taller cerca de 15 años pero que ella lleva con la sociedad  tres años.

Este crédito es para comprar unas herramientas que se requieren para brindar un mejor servicio y también aceites y repuestos para la venta. Este es el segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que brindan para tener sus propios  negocios. Sus sueños son seguir sus estudios y así poder darles algo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Palabra de Mujer Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the city of Charapoto, which is known for its traditional culture and for being a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province – San Jacinto and San Clemente.

This is where we find Aura, who is 26 years old and is currently separated. She has two children from a previous relationship who are 9 and 3 years old. The oldest is in school. She lives with her children at her parents’ house.

She has an auto repair shop in cooperation with her father. While she is responsible for administration and selling the lubricants, oils, and spare parts, her father takes care of the customer care repairs. They work every day from 8am to 6pm. She tells us that her father has had his auto repair shop for almost 15 years, but she has been with it for three years.

This loan is to purchase tools that they need to provide better service, as well as for oils and spare parts to sell. This is her second loan cycle with the communal bank and she likes it because of the help that they provide so that the members can have their own businesses. Her dreams are to continue with her studies and this way, be able to provide her children with a better life.

loans.use: To buy tools, oils and spare auto parts

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La  señora Maria es comerciante, ella vende ropa; el crédito lo requiere para comprar ropa de niños como ser deportivos, ya que le hace falta este tipo de prendas de vestir en su stock de mercadería. Es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para cubrir los gastos de su familia. La señora es separada y tiene dos hijos  vive en casa propia la cual queda ubicada en la zona de Alto Pampahasi de la ciudad de La Paz, es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en nuestra institución.
texts.en: Maria sells clothing for a living, and will use this loan to buy children's clothing. For example, she has no athletic clothing and would like to add that type of clothing to her stock. She uses the income from her business to cover her family's expenses. She is separated from her husband and has two children. She lives in her own home in the Alto Pampahasi neighborhood of La Paz. This is the first time she's applied for a loan from our institution.

loans.use: to buy children's track suits, which are in great demand among her customers.

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane T. is from the village of San Antonio, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 55 years old. Jane is the group leader of an 11-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Jane is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Jane owns & operates a tailoring business providing specialty tailoring services to local community members. Jane has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Jane joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Jane is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional cloth and sewing materials to provide better service. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Jane from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional cloth and sewing materials

loans.name: Ramza

texts.en:
Ramza is 35 years old. She is married and the mother of two children. She lives with her precious family in Chtoura. Ramza used to work as a hairdresser, but she did not like her work very much. Since childhood, she has had a dream of working with wedding dresses and therefore she changed her business. Since 2007, Ramza has run a business renting wedding and special occasion dresses from her house. She is very good at her business because it is what she loves.

Ramza has relied on her husband’s support to begin and maintain her business. He helped her financially in the beginning and after that Ramza had the moral courage and hard work to invest in expanding her business. Her business depends on good public relations, since it requires her to present herself to society.  Ramza has a strong personality and has been able to overcome all of her difficulties. She is proud to help her husband raise secure, healthy and educated children and she hopes to provide them with good society until they are on their own. 

Ramza has been an Al Majmoua borrower for the past five years. She believes that it is her lucky charm. She has used her previous loans to help start and expand her business through adding new collections. She is requesting a new loan to expand her dress collection and provide heating for her house. Ramza’s future dream is to open a big shop and reach a wider number of customers.

loans.use: to buy a new wedding and engagement dress collection

loans.name: Zoljargal

texts.en:
Zoljargal is 26 years old and lives with her husband and daughter, aged three, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Together they live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in the outer ger housing districts of the city. In 2007, Zoljargal graduated from the Mongolian State University of Education with a concentration in teaching Japanese. 

Zoljargal supports her family by operating the grocery store behind her family's yard with regular help from her husband. 

They began her business in 2006, and today they have 1,500,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) in working capital. With this loan of 1,200,000 MNT, Zoljargal's family wants to expand their food store to sell a constant variety of foods. 

In the future, Zoljargal wants to expand the store's size. Also, she wants to build a small house for her family in their current yard.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of food products to sell in the grocery store

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph B. is 28 years old and lives in the town of Kisasi in the Kampala central region of Uganda. He is married and has one child, who is not currently in school. Joseph has a hardware business, which he has run for two years.
To help expand his business, Joseph has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more hardware items for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Joseph hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more hardware items for resale.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
José es soltero de 24 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres, la cual  es propia y cuenta con los servicio agua y luz ubicado en el distrito de Olmos, a una hora del departamento de Lamabayeque.  Los pobladores de éste distrito se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y tiene festividades religiosas que forma parte de las costumbres de los pobladores.

José  labora como chofer de su mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas) desde hace 1 años aproximadamente, está actividad lo realiza en su mismo distrito y a caseríos aledaños, apesar de la competencia, el trata en lo posible de ganarse su propia clientela con mucho esfuerzo, para así tener mayor cantidad de ingresos para solventar sus gastos y necesidades persdonales.

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 1800 nuevos soles y su destino será para el mantenimiento y cambio de algunos repuestos que necesita su mototaxi para poder seguir trabajando y brindando un buen servicio con seguridad para sus pasajeros, pero también con las ganacias  que obtiene podrá ayudar a sus padres a tener una mejor calidad de vida para lo suyos.  José es una persona de confianza y trabajadora  que lo único que quiere es poder adquirir otra mototaxi para alquilarla y tener más ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
José, 24, is single living in his parents’ house which they own and that has water and electricity; it’s located in Olmos district an hour from Lambayeque Department.  Residents of this district are in farming, cattle raising and have religious festivals that form part of their customs.

José has worked as a mototaxi driver (mode of transportation used for short distances with a maximum capacity of 3 passengers) for about a year.  He carries out this activity in his own district and adjacent hamlets.  Despite competition, he tries his best to win over customers with much effort in order to have M. income to meet his expenses and personal needs.

The loan he’s asking Edpyme Alternativa is for 1800 new soles that will be used to service the mototaxi and to buy some replacement parts for it in order to continue working and providing good, safe customer service.  In addition, he will be able to use profits he earns to help his parents have a better quality of life for their loved ones.  

José is a trustworthy, hard working person.  His only wish is to acquire another mototaxi to lease it out and have M. income.

loans.use: to service his mototaxi and buy some spare parts for it.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Maria Teresa le esta haciendo  los acabados del interior y exterior de su casa. 
       Solicita un préstamo para comprar el material que es cemento y pintura, ya que su esposo el señor Joel se encargara de realizar la mejora en horario adicional a su trabajo ya que se dedica a la construcción. 
La señora Maria Teresa se encargara de pagar el crédito con el ingreso que tiene de su trabajo como asistente administrativo de una escuela. 
Desea mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos ya que tiene tres que actual mente están estudiando.
texts.en:
María Teresa’s house is lacking both interior and exterior finishing touches.  She is asking for a loan to buy materials like cement and paint since her husband, Joel, who works in construction, will do the work during his time off.

María Teresa will repay the loan with income she earns working as an Administrative Assistant at a school.  

She wants to improve her children’s quality of life since she has three children currently in school.

loans.use: to do interior and exterior finishing touches on her house.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en: Jenalyn is 33 years old, married and has two young children. She makes a living as a farmer in the town of Banga, South Cotabato. She and her husband grow rice and work hard to keep their land as productive as possible. She is applying for a loan for 10,000 PHP from Kiva partner CEVI to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. In the future, Jenalyn hopes to help her children complete college and succeed. She also hopes to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Madaleine

texts.en:
Madaleine is 62 years old and has 7 children who are ages 17 to 39 years old. Some of them have finished school already. Her husband is a farmer. 

Madaleine sells milk and some food stuffs. She has been selling food stuffs for the past 14 years old. This business enabled her to meet the needs of her family and to feed her family. Madeline needs a loan to buy more food stuffs in order to make more profits. With the profits she plans to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase milk and food stuffs that she will sell

loans.name: Odilia

texts.es: Odilia de 48, años es natural de la comunidad de Pampahuasi anexo del distrito de San Miguel,  vive en su propia casa al lado de su pareja Mauro de 50 años y sus 03 queridos hijos a quienes desea brindarles una educación justa. Odilia es una mujer  trabajadora y se esmera a diario por prosperar, ella se dedica al trabajo del agro donde labra sus tierras con cultivos de cacao, café y árboles maderables. Viene realizando esta actividad hace 23 años con mucho esmero y laboriosidad,  por que gracias a los frutos que le brinda sus plantas ella adquirió más espacios de terreno para cultivar y también compró su propio lote de terreno donde actualmente se cobijan los miembros de su familia. Pero en tiempos de cosecha y deshierbo de maleza necesariamente contrata jornaleros para poder avanzar con mayor celeridad en cuanto a su faena programada. Odilia cuenta con 01 hectárea de terreno sin cultivar,  lo cual necesariamente necesita el apoyo de la entidad financiera para llevar acabo sus actividades programadas tiene pensado repoblar sus fincas con más plantas de cacao y café, es por ello que acude a los prestamos que la institución MFP facilita a las personas de bajos recursos con miras a progresar. Para el bien de su trabajo, espera contar con la misma fuerza e ímpetu que la caracteriza para sacar adelante  a sus hijos. Este será su crédito número 02, es por ello espera de su colaboración para poder concretar sus planes y se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cronogramas de pago ya que desea acceder a otros prestamos posteriormente. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles comprará, más semillas de cacao y café.
texts.en:
Odilia is 48 years old and a native of Pampahuasi in the San Miguel district.  She lives in a house of her own along with her husband, 50 year old Mauro, and her three lovely children for whom she wants to provide a good education.  Odilia is a hard working person and puts forth a daily effort to prosper.

She is a farmer who raises cacao, coffee, and timber trees.  She’s been doing this with great enthusiasm and dedication since she was 23 years old.  Thanks to the fruits of her labor, she was able to acquire more farmland.  She also bought a lot where her family currently lives.

During harvest time and weeding time she needs to hire field hands to be able to stay on schedule.  She has one hectare of land for which she needs financial support to complete her planned activities.  She wants to replant with more cacao and coffee, and this is why she appreciates MFP, because they help people of modest means to progress.  For the good of her work she hopes to have the same spirit and fortitude that she has used to get her children ahead.

This will be her second loan by which she hopes to solidify her plans and she is committed to repaying on schedule because she hopes to be able to get other loans in the future.  She will use the 3,000 PEN to buy cacao and coffee seed.

loans.use: to buy cacao and coffee seed

loans.name: Diarío Javier

texts.es:
Darío, un hombre de 33 años nacido en Pedernales en la provincia de Esmeraldas tiene una hija de 8 años. Desde hace 2 años vende fruta en el cantón Santo Domingo de la provincia Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas. Vive con su madre Silvia quien es comerciante. Desde muy joven se dedicaba a ayudar a sus padres en la actividad que hoy es su sustento.

Nos cuenta que uno de los obstáculos que ha tenido en su vida es haber dejado los estudios ya que debía trabajar y ayudar a su madre. El sueña con algún día vender fruta que él mismo produzca, es decir tener sus propias plantaciones.

Solicitó a Fundación Alternativa un crédito el cual le permita invertir en fruta ofrecida por proveedores mayoristas que le dan un precio menor que los actuales y así poder ser más competitivo y que su margen de ganancia sea mayor. A darío le gusta mucho compartir con su hija y su madre, el espera que mejorando su situación económica pueda darles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Darío is 33 years old.  He was born in Pedernales in the Esmeraldas province.  He has an eight year old daughter.

He has been selling fruit in the Santo Domingo canton in the Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas province for two years.  He lives with his mother, Silvia, a merchant.  Since he was very young he has helped his parents in the business activity that is now his support.

He tells us that one of the obstacles that he has had in his life is having left school because he needed to work and help his mother. 

His dream is to one day sell fruit that he himself produces.  In other words, he wants to have his own fields.

He requested a loan from the Fundación Alternativa.  It will allow him to buy fruit from wholesale providers.  They give him a cheaper price than what he now pays.  That way he will be able to be more competitive, and his margin of earnings will be bigger.

Darío really likes spending time with his daughter and his mother.  He hopes to improve his financial situation to be able to give them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice lives in Uganda.  She is single and has three children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her in-laws).  Eunice  has a business selling used shoes. She has been in this business for eight years and she works seven days out of every week. Eunice sells her products at the market at retail. Eunice has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of used shoes. The main business challenge(s) for Eunice include thieves and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing shoes from Dubai and to buy her own plot in order to build her own house. Eunice lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used shoes

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Miguela has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, detergents & snacks.

Miguela is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Miguela hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, detergents & snacks

loans.name: Schola

texts.en: Schola is a hardworking businesswoman who is aged 48 and married. For the last 20 years, she has been practicing dairy farming to earn a living. In the next five years, she wants to increase the number of cows on her farm. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy animal feed. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has become financially stable.

loans.use: To buy animal feed for her cows

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan, age 24, always seems to succeed in every move he makes in his business. He runs his business inside the local school in his village, vending snack foods, juices, soft drinks, and school supplies. Juan has been in this business for two years and earns approximately PHP 5,000 a month.

Juan's loving wife is his partner in managing their school canteen business. They strive to improve their business and gain a higher income. They have one small child.

Juan dreams of finishing the building of the house in which the family lives. This is his primary goal for working hard and managing the business well, since he is determined to finish their house through the profits he and his wife earn. 

Juan also wants to expand his business by offering a greater selection of school supplies. He is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy school supplies like paper, notebook, ballpoint pens, and pencils to offer for sale.

loans.use: o buy school supplies like paper, notebook, ballpoint pens, and pencils to offer for sale at the local school in his village

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is taking another Kiva loan of 40,000 KES to add on his stock at his retail shop.  He'll purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and rice.  He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of maize flour, rice and wheat flour for resale.

loans.name: Maria Lucia

texts.es:
La señora María es socia del banco comunal Las Triunfadoras del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 48 años de edad, es madre soltera de cinco hijos,tiene a su cargo a dos de ellos.
Son 3 años que viene trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, se dedica a la venta de comidas, desayunos y almuerzos todos los días se levanta muy temprano para salir a trabajar, y no de sus hijos le ayuda en la atención al cliente.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles comprará: ½ saco de arroz, ½ saco de azúcar, 1 galones de aceite, 1 paquete de fideos, condimentos, 1 racimo de plátano.
Su trabajo se encuentra lejos de su casa, pero tiene que irse a trabajar para mantener a sus hijos que todavía están en casa, ha sido padre y madre para ellos.
Solo quiere que Dios le de la salud necesaria para poder ver a sus hijos realizados y no tengan que pasar necesidades, agradece a Manuela Ramos por las cosas que hasta ahora ha logrado.
texts.en:
Señora María is a member of the communal bank Las Triunfadoras del Distrito Calleria, in the district of Calleria, in the department of Ucayali. She is 48 years old and a single mother of 5 children. She is responsible for 2 of them. 

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos loans for 3 years. She sells food: breakfast and lunch every day. She gets up very early to go to work and none of her children help her attend to her customers.

With the new loan of S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles (PEN) she will buy ½ sack of rice, ½ sack of sugar, 1 gallon of oil, 1 package of noodles, seasonings, 1 bunch of bananas.

Her place of work is far from where she lives but she has to go to work to take care of the children who still live at home. She has been both mother and father to them.

She just wants God to give her the health needed to see her children settled and without having to want for the basics in life. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for what she has been able to achieve so far.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia, de 52 años de edad, es una mujer muy amable, cariñosa y emprendedora, es casada, vive en compañía de su esposo, sus dos hijos, además de su nuera y sus tres nietos. Se siente contenta de poder estar cerca de sus nietos a quienes quiere mucho y engríe. La actividad que realiza Antonia es la venta de abarrotes de primera necesidad, para  esto abrió una bodega que esta ubicada en un terreno de su propiedad en un caserío llamado Puerto Liberal, que se encuentra surcando el río Ucayali. Se dedica a esta actividad desde hace cinco años, tiempo en el cual le ha valido para hacerse conocida en la zona, contando con la ayuda de su esposo quien atiende en esta bodega cuando ella esta realizando las compras en la ciudad. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo, es que le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual pueda solventar los gastos de su familia, así como el poder realizar viajes cortos conociendo más lugares, estando con contacto con la naturaleza, además añade que las personas son muy buenas y amables. Por ahora su plan es seguir creciendo y ampliar su negocio, y comprar variedad de productos en mayor volumen. Este sería el crédito número once con la institución MFP, se siente muy contenta con el apoyo que viene recibiendo por parte de ustedes, por tanto se compromete en ser puntual con sus pagos. Con el crédito solicitado, comprará más productos para abastecer su negocio y así tener mejores márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
Antonia, 52, is a kind, affectionate and enterprising woman.  She’s married and lives with her husband and two children and also with her daughter-in-law and her three grandchildren.  She feels happy to be able to be near her grandchildren who she loves very much and encourages.  

Antonia’s business is grocery sales.  She opened a store located on a piece of property she owns in a hamlet called Puerto Liberal which is found on the banks of the Ucayali River.  She’s been in this line of work for five years which has been time enough for her to become very well known in the area.  Her husband helps her take care of the store when she’s off shopping in the city.  

What she enjoys about her work is having a source of income to cover family expenses as well as taking short trips to get to know other places being in touch with nature; she also adds that the people are very good and kind.  For now, her plan is to continue growing and expanding the business and to buy a large variety of products in larger amounts.

This would be loan #11 with MFP.  She feels very happy with the support she’s been getting from you so commits to be very punctual with her payments.  She will use the requested loan to buy more products to stock her store and thus have a better profit margin.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Nely

texts.es: La Sra. Nely vive en la zona del plan 3000 junto a su  esposo y su hijo de 3 años, vive  en la casa de su madre, ella tiene una rocola en la av. Principal de su barrio, también junto con su madre tienen una amplificación la cual también le generan ingresos ya que alquilan para fiestas matrimonios y bautizos. Su esposo es electricista y trabaja en una clínica de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, la Sra. Nely anteriormente era socia en el banco de emprendimiento Sol en el cual era responsable con el pago de cuotas. El crédito que esta solicitando es para compra de equipo de sonido  para su local. La Sra. Nelly es una persona activa, trabajadora y con ganas de salir adelante al lado de su esposo.
texts.en:
Nely lives in the Plan 3000 zone with her husband and 3-year-old son in her mother’s house.  She has a jukebox on her neighborhood’s main avenue and with her mother owns a sound amplification system that generates income when they lease it out for parties, weddings and baptisms.  Her husband is an electrician and works for a clinic in the city of Santa Cruz.  

Nely used to be a member of the “Sol” communal bank where she was very responsible with her installment payments.  The loan she’s asking for is to buy sound equipment for her locale.   Nely is an active, hardworking person who wants to get ahead alongside her husband.

loans.use: to buy sound equipment.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Ablavi est une femme  de 31ans. Elle est mariée å un revendeur de friperie. Elle a 02 enfants.
Ablavi travaille comme couturière depuis 03ans. Elle fait la couture, les plinthes et les merceries à toute personne désireuse dans sa boutique. Elle achète les produits à Lomé.
Ablavi a requis son deuxième cycle de prêt  à WAGES afin d’acheter une machine à plinthe, 01carton de fermeture, 10 douzaine de fil à plinthe, 06 rouleaux de popelines, 02cartons de boutons puis de divers matériels de couture. Elle veut réinvestir les profits supplémentaires dans son activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Ablavi voudrait pérenniser son activité.
texts.en:
Ablavi is a 31-year-old woman. She is married to a retailer of second-hand clothing. She has two children.
Ablave has worked as a dressmaker for three years. She makes clothing, skirting, and haberdashery articles for anyone who wants them at her store. She buys her products in Lomé.
Ablavi has requested her second loan from WAGES in order to buy a "plinthe" sewing machine, one box of closures, ten dozen sets of plinthe thread, six rolls of poplin, two boxes of buttons, and various other sewing materials. She wants to reinvest her supplementary profits in her business.
In the coming years, Ablavi would like to perpetuate her business.

loans.use: To buy equipment, a seam closing machine, and poplin.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 32-year-old, young man who is married with one daughter. He is a taxi driver with a low income. Ahmad wants to repair his taxi by changing its doors but he does not have enough money.Therefore he needs a loan from FATEN. When Ahmad gets the loan, he will replace the taxi doors and this will improve the condition of his taxi. Ahmad will work extra hours to increase his income and provide his family with better living conditions. Ahmad is photographed next to his taxi.

About this loan product:
 FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To replace the doors on his taxi.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Ninfa requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Ninfa has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Ninfa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: That

texts.en:
Mrs. That operates a retail business located in her own house. She sells different types of merchandise, such as snacks, sweet things, eggs, cigarettes, and household products, to satisfy her customers in the community. She typically earns approximately $2.00 per day through her business. She is now 52 years old and has five children, three of whom are her dependents. 

Mrs. That is requesting a loan from HKL, a longstanding Kiva partner, to purchase retail stock to sustain her business. In the future, she hopes to enlarge her store and sell more products.

loans.use: to purchase retail stock.

loans.name: Reseda Group

texts.es:
El grupo Reseda lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras la coordinadora es María Isabel de 42 años quien realiza bordados y elabora bolsos típicos. Ella tiene tres hijos de 19, 18 y 7 años los dos menores estudian. 
Ella invertirá el crédito en cuerina y tela, accesorios…etc. para su negocio.
Las otras integrantes son María Dolores quien realiza artesanías desde hace 10 años y Julia de 33 años quien trabaja en bordados desde hace 1 año.
texts.en:
The Reseda Group is made up of three hard-working and enterprising women, coordinated by 42 year old María Isabel who does needlework and embroiders traditional bags. She has three children aged 19, 18 and 7, of whom the youngest two are in education.


She will invest the loan in fabric, threads and accessories etc for her business.

The other members are María Dolores who has been making handicrafts for 10 years and 33 year old Julia who has been working in needlework for 1 year.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads, etc.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Marta de 44 años, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos. Juntos viven en el centro poblado de Canayre del distrito de Llochegua. Martha es la mujer que se dedica a muchos oficios por ganarse la vida, pues posee una tienda de abarrotes, cultiva cacao café, pero el negocio que más ganancias le genera es la venta de combustibles. Ella cuenta que ya son mas de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio y hasta el momento le va muy bien. Generalmente trabaja con el apoyo de su querida hija, quien esta al pendiente al momento de atender a los clientes, quienes en su gran mayoría son transportistas. En un futuro marta desea mejorar en la venta de combustibles como la de comprar sus propios surtidores ya que en la actualidad realiza manualmente el trabajo. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Ella está feliz con su banco comunal por que vienen trabajando de manera concertada. Con los 1500 nuevos soles invertirá en la compra de más combustibles.
texts.en:
Marta is 44 years old, a single mother, and has 4 children. They live together in the central village of Canayre in the Llochegua district. Marta is a woman who does many types of work to support herself. She has a grocery store and grows cacao café, but the business that brings in the most income is the sale of fuel. She’s already been in this business for more than 10 years, and so far it’s going very well. Usually she works with the help of her beloved daughter who right now keeps track of the clients who are mostly truckers. 

In the future Marta wants to improve fuel sales, for instance by purchasing her own gas pumps since she has does this work by manually. This will be her second loan with MFP, and she promises to make her payments in a timely fashion. She is happy with her communal bank because they are working together. With the 1500 nuevos soles, she will invest in the purchase of more fuel.

loans.use: to buy more fuel.

loans.name: Sin's Group

texts.en:
Twenty-five-year-old Sin lives in a rural area of the Thmor Koul district of Cambodia. She is a married mother of only son who is too young to attend school. Rice farming has been her main source of income to make a living for more than three years. Sometimes, she and her husband work for others for pay to earn more income. 

Sin’s group consists of two members and has been with VisionFund for two years. Since 2009, the loan has helped her make a living better. She currently earns more than US $5 per day and is able to save around US $2 each day. She is leading her group to apply for another loan with VisionFund of KHR 1,200,000 each to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yield so as to improve her lifestyle and send her son to school regularly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Paola Julissa

texts.es: Paola, tiene 24 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene 3 hijos, reside en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Hace un año ella decidió tener su propio negocio para generar ingresos. Su actividad es Cría, destazo y venta de cerdos. Actualmente solicita un préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar puertas para poder terminar su casa, ya que donde vive alquila y quiere tener su propia casa y poder vivir mejor. Sus planes son crecer con el negocio de cría de cerdos y darles educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Paola, age 24, lives with her common-law husband and their three children.  They live in the Choloma municipality in Cortes.  A year ago she decided to have her own business in order to generate income.  She raises, butchers, and sells pigs.

She is currently requesting a loan for 10,000 lempiras to buy doors in order to finish her house.  She rents where she lives, and she wants to have her own house and be able to live better.  Her plans are to grow her business of raising pigs and to give her children an education.

loans.use: to buy doors in order to finish her house.

loans.name: Monica Alexandra

texts.es:
Monica tiene 19 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, vive con sus padres en la comunidad Camaron perteneciente al Cantón Echeandia Provincia de Bolívar. 

Ella se dedica a la venta de viveres y cerveza . Solicita el crédito para  capital de trabajo para incrementar el negocio. La compra lo realiza en Echeandia semanalmente. Su meta es mejorar las condiciones de vida y agrandar el negocio. Su desafío es las enfermedades. En su tiempo libre le gusta ver la televisión y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Monica is 19 years old and single. She lives with her parents in the Camaron community, which is part of the Echeandia Canton, in the Bolívar Province.

She makes a living selling food supplies and beer. She is requesting a loan for working capital to grow the business. She makes the purchases in Echeandia every week. 

Her goal is to improve her living conditions and grow her business. Her challenge is fighting disease. In her free time, she likes to watch television and do sports.

loans.use: to obtain working capital.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 62 years old. She is a widow taking care of her three grandchildren of  12, 11 and 7 years respectively.

She sells maize cereals, a business she has done for the last six years, earning a monthly income of KES 6,500.

Agnes has requested for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 7,500, which she will use to buy stock of  dried maize cereals for resale.

With the anticipated profits, Agnes will be able to repay her loan as well as add more stock. She would do this in order to get school fees and food for her grandchildren.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to become a wholesale supplier of maize.

loans.use: to purchase stock of maize for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase on capital

loans.name: Belinda Yamilen

texts.en:
My name is Belinda and I am a merchant and owner of a small restaurant in the center of town, called "Comedor Belinda." I have several years experience in this field. My restaurant creates income enough to contribute to the payment of family expenses and to be able to offer my children a better standard of living, through which they will be able to have better opportunities in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Mi nombre el Belinda, soy comerciante cuento con un comedor en el centro de mi ciudad, llamado comerdor Belinda, tengo varios años de experiencia en este tipo de negocio, el que me genera ingreso para contribuir con los gastos familiares y de esa forma ofrecer a mi hijos un mejor nivel de vida, quienes en el futuro puedan tener mejores oportunidades.

loans.use: To purchase beans, refreshments, eggs, butter, rice, sugar, coffee, flour and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Joyce would like to buy a pig

loans.name: Sergio David

texts.es:
Sergio is an only child and to support his parents at an early age, he worked as an assistant at a tortilla making shop. Thanks to his good work, effort, and savings he now owns two tortilla making shops. The businesses had enable him to obtain the necessary resources to support his parents and cover their medical expenses. His parents are old and need lots of care. Fortunately, Sergio's business has successfully developed, increasing the demand for his products.

To be able to cover his client's demands, Sergio asks for a $475 dollars loan that he will use in buying supplies. It will help him in increasing the production and continue to grow. He commits himself to return the amount in 6 months. You can play an important part on Sergio's and his family life. Contribute to the growth of this business. They will sincerely thank you.

Sergio es hijo único y para apoyar a sus padres desde muy pequeño trabajaba de ayudante en una tortillería. Gracias a su buen trabajo, esfuerzo y sus ahorros, ahora tiene dos tortillerías que le han permitido obtener los recursos necesarios para el sostén de sus padres y cubrir sus gastos médicos. Ellos ya son personas mayores que necesitan de muchos cuidados. Afortunadamente el negocio de Sergio se ha desarrollado exitosamente, incrementando la demanda por sus productos.

Para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, Sergio solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos, esto le permitirá incrementar su producción y continuar creciendo, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante en la vida de Sergio y su familia, contribuye al crecimiento de su negocio, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Buying supplies for his tortilla making shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her used clothes business.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Mrs. Juliana U. is 35 years old, married to Mr. U. and has 7 children.  She lives in Benin City with her family. She is requesting a loan of US $400 to enable her to buy drinks, provision and bread for re- sale.  She has been in this business for 4 years.

loans.use: To buy more drinks, provision, & bread for re-sale

loans.name: Suraiyo

texts.en: Suraiyo is a teacher by profession and has taught in school. She is 39 years old and married, although her husband is away working in Russia. Because teacher salaries are low in Tajikistan, she decided to go into business for herself. When she taught, Suraiyo sold a small number of food products to the people at her school. She went into business selling these products full-time in the central market of Spitamen, and has used several loans from Microinvest to increase the assortment of goods she sells. Business is good, and she has applied for a new loan of $500 to further expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: José Héctor

texts.es:
José Héctor started his business 6 years ago. After his wife unfortunately passed away, José was left with the responsibility of raising and caring for their 8 kids. He hopes to always give them the best so they don't suffer from the absence of their mother. José started selling vegetables, tortillas, milk, and soft drinks, among other things. Little by little, he added more products, up until what he has now.

Nevertheless, José is thinking about expanding his grocery store to have a larger variety so his clients have something from which to choose. José is requesting a credit of $650, which he is willing to repay in 6 months. With this money, he will be able to buy more merchandise and to expand his business so his clients feel at ease in his store and come more often. With your help, José will be able to take good care of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Hace 6 años que José Héctor comenzó su negocio de Abarrotes, después de que desgraciadamente su esposa falleció y se quedó José con la responsabilidad de criar y cuidar a 8 hijos a quienes desea darles siempre lo mejor para que no sufran por la ausencia de su madre. José Comenzó con verduras, tortillas, leche, cocas, entre otras cosas. Poco a poco se fue haciendo de más productos hasta lo que hoy tiene.

Sin embargo José está pensando en ampliar su tienda de abarrotes para poder tener mayor surtido y así que sus clientes puedan tener algo de dónde escoger. José está solicitando un crédito de US $650 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero José podrá comprar más mercancía y ampliar su negocio para que sus clientes se sientan a gusto en el lugar y vayan con mayor frecuencia. Con tu ayuda José podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: To expand his store

loans.name: Kabojja A1(C) Group

texts.en:
Florence is 45 years old and married with three children. Her husband is a farmer. Florence has a livestock business where she rears cows, goats, pigs and sheep. She wants to use the extra business profits to invest in the pig business. Solome, Norah, and Harriet are all poultry farmers and want to use the loan to purchase more poultry feed and also buy more chicks. Sarah sells charcoal and intends to increase stock with the loan.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a calf and pig feeed

loans.name: Butebe A(Iv) Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Oliver N.. She has a beauty salon and is requesting a loan to purchase more salon equipment. Oliver is 38 years old and is single. She has 2 children, ages 3 and 6, who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, Oliver hopes to be able to re-invest in business.

Oliver is joined in her small group by Kevin A., Florence N., Sarah N., and Hanifa N.. Kevin A. sells charcoal and wants to purchase more sacks of charcoal. Florence N. operates a bar and wants a loan to purchase more crates of beer. Sarah N. operates a craft business and wants to expand her business. Hanifa N. is a hairdresser and is requesting a loan to purchase a hair dryer.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for her beauty salon

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Mrs. Kim S., age 55, has four children and sells groceries at her house. She earns about $20 per day. Her husband raises goats and sells them to the restaurants when they grow up, and earns about $33 a day. Three of the children are married and live separately and the other one helps her selling groceries.

Mrs. S. is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase groceries in bulk to save money.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk to save money

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Ramatu B. sells wheat flour to bakers and other retailers. With previous loans from SMT, she increased her stock by 10 bags of wheat flour and her income also increased. Ramatu now has more customers, but cannot meet their demand on time. Due to lack of capital, she has to sell all of the stock she has before travelling to buy more.

She is requesting a loan of Le.3,500,000 to increase her stock. Ramatu wants to buy a larger quantity of flour in bulk so that she can meet her customers demands without running out of supplies. Ramatu is 40 years old and is married with 6 children.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of flour to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Increase stock to make more food to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa has sold candy and orange juice for five years. She began making breakfasts, which she has stopped selling for the moment, for health reasons.

Nevertheless, every day Rosa goes out and sells from five in the morning until 1 in the afternoon on the main street near her home. The loans that Rosa has requested are for the purpose of building rooms in her home so that she can rent them out. Her husband is a bricklayer and he has been put in charge of the construction. She would like to have a soda fountain in the market where she could offer all types of juices.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa vende golosinas y jugo de naranja desde hace 5 años. Empezó haciendo desayunos, los cuáles ha dejado de vender por el momento, por motivo de salud. Sin embargo, Rosa todos los días sale a vender, desde las 5 de la mañana hasta la 1 de la tarde, en una avenida principal cerca de su casa. Los préstamos que Rosa ha solicitado le han servido para construir cuartos dentro de su casa y poder alquilarlos. Su esposo es albañil y él se ha encargado de la construcción. A ella le gustaría poder tener una fuente de soda en el mercado donde ofrecer todo tipo de jugos.

loans.use: Build rooms in her home so that she may rent them out.

loans.name: Joyce's Ailanga Group

texts.en:
Joyce, a 26-year-old married woman with one child aged two, became a clothing seller in 2005. She works daily from 7 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

Joyce now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses selling clothes, bananas, tomatoes, and charcoal.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El señor Miguel tiene 36 años, casado, tiene dos hijos menores. Vive en casa propia desde hace muchos años. En la ciudad de Encarnación se encuentra la Represa de agua Yacyretá, que es una binacional entre Paraguay y Argentina. Miguel era uno de los tantos afectados por el desembalse del lago, por lo que la Empresa Yacyretá lo reubico en otra zona otorgándole una casa propia, al igual que las demás familias.

Miguel posee una pequeña pero bien surtida despensa en su casa. El negocio es atendido por su cónyuge, mientras el señor Miguel realiza compra y venta de mercaderías varias de la ciudad de Posadas que es una ciudad del país vecino, Argentina. Esta ciudad limita en la frontera con Encarnación y se llega mediante un puente internacional.

Miguel es un hombre luchador que todos los días sale a trabajar duro para poder obtener los recursos necesarios para mantener a su familia, especialmente otorgar buena educación a sus hijos. El crédito que desea lo destinará en la compra de varias mercaderías para la venta en su despensa al igual que de forma ambulante como él lo realiza.
texts.en:
Miguel is 36 years old, married, and has two young children. He has lived in his own home for many years. Ten years ago, Miguel was one of many people affected by the creation of a lake after the Yacyretá Dam was built in the city of Encarnación, on the border between Paraguay and Argentina. So the Yacyretá organization relocated him to another area and offered Miguel and the other affected families each a new house of their own.

Miguel has a small but well-supplied neighborhood store that he runs out of his home. The business is attended by his partner, while Señor Miguel buys and sells various items in the city of Posadas, which is located across the border in Argentina. This city borders Encarnación and one enters it by way of an international bridge.

Miguel is a fighter that works hard each day so that he can obtain the necessary resources to support his family, especially to provide his children with a good education. The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase a variety of merchandise to sell in his store and as an ambulatory vendor.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise to sell (sugar, rice, carbonated beverages, delicacies, canned goods, fruits, and dairy products)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more shoes and slippers to add to her stock

loans.name: Fusana

texts.en:
Fusana Y. is married and has 4 children. She has received a junior high education. Her husband is a fisherman.

Fusana buys fish from the fishermen, brings them home for processing and preservation, and then sends them to be sold at the market at Elmina. She has been in this business since 2000. Fusana uses her income to help her husband pay the children's school fees and the utility bills.

Fusana will use this loan to increase her capital to buy more fish to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Fusana plans to save for a piece of land she wants to buy with her husband.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Grimaldina Neri

texts.es:
La señora Grimaldina tiene 50 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Fuente de Vida y vive en la calle Chan Chan 237, El Cortijo, distrito y provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió hasta el tercero de secundaria, pero no continuó estudiando debido a que se casó y tuvo un hijo, tiempo después enviudó y actualmente tiene un segundo compromiso con el cual tiene una hija que es estudiante y depende de ella.
Anteriormente Grimaldina vendía pan, pero empezó a tener mucha competencia, entonces se cambió de actividad, la venta de menú, pero en otro sector de la ciudad, en la calle Bernardo Alcedo 140 – 1 San Fernando I etapa. 
Con su primer crédito de S/. 300 cancelados en 4 cuotas, invirtió en insumos para la venta de pan.
Con este crédito de S/. 600, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en insumos para la venta de menú.
Grimaldina sueña con tener una tienda bien surtida.
texts.en:
Mrs Grimaldina is 50 years old. She belongs to the Communal Bank 'Fuente de Vida' and lives on the street Chan Chan 237, El Cortijo, district and province of Trujillo, region of La Libertad, Perú. She studied up until 9th grade, but did not continue studying because she had a child. Some time afterwards, she became a widow and currently is engaged. With her current partner, she has a daughter who is a student and depends on her. Before, Grimaldina sold bread, but she started to have so much competition that she switched her livelihood to sell prepared foods in a different area of the city: Bernardo Alcedo street 140-1 San Fernando I etapa. With her first loan of 300 Soles which was paid in 4 installments, she bought ingredients to sell bread. With this loan of 600 Soles, which will be paid in 4 installments, she will buy ingredients to sell full menus. Grimaldina dreams of having a well stocked store.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Will purchase ingredients to sell full menu foods.

loans.name: Judyth

texts.es: Judyth tiene 35 años, es casada, vive con su esposo y su hijo. Se dedica a conducir un motocarro hace 2 años, siendo mujer tiene la fuerza para realizar trabajos muy pesados, ejemplo que a muchas mujeres les gustaría seguir. Además, para las personas que la conoces, Judith es una mujer muy esmerada en su actividad, sumado a ello tenemos resaltar, lo bien que se siente en ayudar a su pareja en  los gastos del hogar. Dedicarse al motocarro es una actividad rentable, ya que en su zona las personas están muy  acostumbradas a movilizarse en este tipo de vehículos, aunque lo difícil es cubrir el precio de los repuestos y mantenimientos que necesita. Este es su primer crédito con MFP. Con en el dinero solicitado invertirá en el mantenimiento de este su motocarro.
texts.en:
Judyth is 35 years old, married, and lives with her husband and child. She has driven a motocar for the past 2 years. She is a woman with the strength to accomplish heavy work, an example which many women would like to emulate. As well, Judith is known as a very diligent woman, to which we also must add how good she feels helping her partner with household expenses. Motocar driving is profitable, even though it is difficult to cover the cost of spare parts and maintenance. This is her first loan with MFP. She will use the loan in maintaining her motocar.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of her motocar

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan S. sells charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Juan is 28 years old and is married. Her husband is a teacher. They have two children, both of whom are in school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development; health; education; and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Maria Josefa

texts.es:
Maria Josefa tiene un negocio de venta de productos de consumo diario en su casa, también vende tortillas y se dedica a la crianza de pollos.  Tiene cuatro hijos, todos estudian y su esposo le ayuda en sus negocios.

El préstamo lo necesita porque quiere ampliar su negocio de crianza de pollos, aprovechando que cuenta con un terreno más grande, ya que es su casa no tiene mas espacio.  

Su sueño es tener mucho éxito en sus negocios para bienestar de sus hijos y familia.
texts.en:
Maria Josefa has a business selling everyday products from her home. She also sells tortillas and raises chickens. She has four children, who are students, and her husband helps her with the business.
