She needs this loan to grow her business raising chickens, taking advantage of a larger plot of land, since her house has little additional space.

Her dream is to be very successful in these businesses to support her children and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her businesses raising chickens and selling everyday products

loans.name: Ream

texts.en:
K. is 48 years old and a resident of Pursat Province. She has five children: four of them are single and live with her, and the other one is married and lives separately. To support the family's needs, one of her children works as a metal welder. She is married to Yim, 51, who works as a motor taxi driver.

K. has been a fruit seller in the Sereysophon market for more one year. She buys her products from the villagers in bulk and takes them from her house to the market, selling retail at a good price. She recently wants to have more rice for her stock, for supporting her family. So, K. is applying for a loan of US$ 500 to buy more rice for her and her family.

loans.use: To buy more rice for her and her family

loans.name: David's Group

texts.en:
K. David is the leader of the Gamba group in Lugazi. He is a fisherman on the Senyi landing site in Bbogo. He is happy that ever since he joined his lending group, life has changed. He is able to run his business, he has a farm where he grows food both for sale and for home consumption, and he is able to have his boats serviced when the need arises.

He has two boats now and would like to buy a new engine for his second boat for efficiency. He is now happy that his children go to school and he is able to clear their school fees on time. He has a plan of growing the number of boats into a fleet so that he can rent out the rest for increased profits.

loans.use: Buying a new engine for his second boat

loans.name: Battulga

texts.en:
Battulga M. lives with his wife in Arhanghay province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. He has a small business selling clothes at the local market. His wife helps with his business.

In 1999, Battulga began importing clothes for women and men from a border city in Russia. However, the clothes were expensive and demand for expensive clothes was weak in Arhanghay. For this reason, he decided to switch the import market from the West to the East. Now he travels to Ereen, China, a border town where many goods are purchased for importation to Mongolia. There, he buys cheap women’s and men’s clothes for his retail shop.

In the meantime, his wife works at the stall as a saleswoman. He requests a loan to purchase more women’s and men’s clothes from China.

loans.use: to purchase more women’s and men’s clothes from China for re-sale

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa M. is married and has two children. She has received an education through junior high school. Theresa is a trader who sells videos, cassettes, and CDs at Akotokyin in Abura, which she has done for five years. While Theresa works as a trader, her husband is employed as a carpenter. Theresa uses her income as housekeeping money for her family.

Theresa will use the loan to purchase additional cassettes for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Theresa plans to reinvest.

loans.use: To purchase additonal cassettes for sale

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos H. S. vive en Ahuachapán, junto a su esposa y cuatro hijos; tres de ellos aun menores de edad. A pesar que Santos no posee estudios ya que nunca fue a la escuela, pero esto no ha sido obstáculo para administrar su negocio; que lleva ya 10 años a flote, Santos se dedica a la comercialización de productos como cinchos, mochilas, candados entre otros, María esposa de Santos también le ayuda en el negocio; Santos solicita un crédito para comprar más productos para incrementar su inventario.
texts.en:
Santos H. S. lives in Ahuachapán with his wife and four children, three of whom are minors. The fact that he never went to school is not an obstacle for him to manage his business, which has been operating for 10 years. Santos sells products like belts, backpacks, and padlocks, among other things. Maria, Santos’ wife, also helps him with the business. Santos is requesting a loan in order to purchase more products and increase his inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products

loans.name: Peregrina

texts.es:
PEREGRINA P. T., pertenece al Banco Comunal “RUMBO AL ÉXITO-CAF” su domicilio está ubicado en la Urb.JJ MUÑOS , tiene 43 años, 5 hijos, 4 de ellos menores, y su esposo es coadministrador del negocio.

	Ella se inicio vendiendo frutas aproximadamente hace tres años, el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, que invirtió en compra de aguaje (fruta de la zona), para vender en el parque de su barrio, en la actualidad tiene una pequeña bodega en su casa, la cual le genera mejores ingresos que sus negocio anterior

Con este préstamo de S/.1,700.00 Nuevos Soles,  invertirá en compra de una congeladora para su local y el resto lo invertirá en comprar abarrotes para surtir su tienda.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos, por ser una institución que sirve a la comunidad y contribuye con las mujeres de esta región.
texts.en:
Peregrina P. T. belongs to the Rumbo Al Éxito-CAF Community Bank. Her home is located in the Urb. JJ Muños. She is 43 and has five children. Four of the children are minors. Her husband is co-administrator of the business. She started selling fruit about three years ago. The first loan she received from Manuela Ramos was for 300 PEN, which she used to buy “aguaje” (fruit from her zone) to sell in the neighborhood park. She currently has a small market in her house. The market generates better income than her previous business. With this loan for 1,700 PEN she will buy a freezer for her place. With the rest she will buy groceries to stock her store. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for being an institution that serves the community and contributes to the women of this region.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a freezer.  Buy groceries (various items).

loans.name: Virginie

texts.fr:
D.  Virginie est agée de quarante (40) ans et est née à  Cotonou, Capitale Economique  de la République du Bénin. Virginie est mariée à GNANSOUNOU Emmanuel, un commerçant. Virginie et Emmanuel ont quatre (04) enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Virginie vit avec sa famille à  Sènadé 2 un quartier peuplé de la ville de Cotonou. 

Virginie vend des divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, piles, bougies, etc.) depuis un peu plus de neuf (09) ans. Virginie a commencée cette activité grâce au soutien financier de son mari. Avec cette activité, Virginie à son tour arrive à soutenir son mari en ce qui concerne les dépenses de la famille. Pour renforcer son activité et mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Virginie s’est adressée à ALIDé pour avoir de prêt.
texts.en:
D. Virginie, 40, was born in Cotonou, economic capital of the Republic of Bénin. Virginie is married to Gnansounou Emmanuel, who is a merchant. Virginie and Emmanuel have four children who are all enrolled in school. Virginie lives with her family in Sènadé 2, a working-class neighborhood of the city of Cotonou

Virginie has been selling assorted goods (candy, cookies; tins of milk, sardines, tomatoes; sugar, pasta, detergent, dish and toilet soap, batteries, candles, etc.) for a little more than 9 years. She was able to bigan this business thanks to her husband's financial support.

With her business, Virginie herself now manages to help out her husband as far as supporting the family is concerned. In order to bolster her business and better respond to the needs of her clientele, Virginie has come to ALIDé to request a loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 2 cases of candy, 3 cases of cookies, and some toiletries

loans.name: Jennalyn

texts.en:
Jennalyn A. is from the village of Upper Dumalinao, Dumalinao, ZDS. She is 21 years old. Jennalyn is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Jennalyn operates a family member's business venture raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Jennalyn has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jennalyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jennalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Jennalyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jennalyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Seb

texts.en:
Seb P., 42, has been involved in a business of selling vegetables at a local market in Seim Reap Province with a typical income of US $5 per day. P. and her husband work very hard every day to ensure a comfortable standard of living for the family.

P. and her husband are blessed with four children. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver who usually earns an income of US $2 per day. He provides his transportation services to local people in his town and tourists as well. P. really wants to take a loan of US $1200 to purchase a convenient stand at the market for her business. She is really optimistic that she will be able to make a good living for her family with the new business plan.

loans.use: purchasing a stand at the market

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia P. is a woman of courage, determined to bring her family out of poverty. Hailing from the island village of Binangonan, Rizal province in the Philippines, she is the wife of Efren, a 47-year-old carpenter, and a mother to eight: five daughters and three sons.

With her dream of bringing her family out of poverty, Cecilia joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 2003. Eager to help her husband in earning money to sustain their family needs, her hopes of having access to capital to start a business materialized. She wisely used her previous loans for her food vending business and as rolling capital for the retail of dried fish and bamboo sets, both her primary businesses and both productive enough to enable her to sustain the needs of her family.

Now on her eighth loan, Cecilia is requesting 19,000 pesos as additional rolling capital for her businesses. Specifically, the loan will be used to pay for 40 pieces of bamboo beds, 2 bamboo sets, 40 kilos of assorted dried fish, all for resale, and a gallon of cooking oil, sugar, bananas, and pork for her food vending business.

She is hopeful that with the help of ASHI and KIVA, she can reach her dreams of sending her children to school, having a rolling store, and repairing her house to make it more spacious and durable.

loans.use: Additional capital for resale and food vending businesses.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is forty-two years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, a daughter and two sons. The eldest child is currently in senior high while the other two are in junior high and primary school respectively. She sells foodstuffs such as plantains, cassava, yams, etc. She buys her goods from nearby communities at affordable prices and sells at the market square in her community to canteen operators. She also supplies her goods to other retailers.

Esi also treks to other markets to sell. She has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. Esi aspires to expand her business and pay for her children in school through university.

loans.use: To buy stock in bulk

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie P. is 48 years old and a resident of Antipolo City, Rizal province in the Philippines. She is married to Nolito who is 46 and her business partner. She is a mother to Rolly who is 23 years old and a high school graduate. Rosemarie and her husband are partners in their resale business. They resell fish and vegetables. They have been doing the business for six years already and they are happy in their resale business since it brings them back good proceeds. They buy fish from the fishermen and sell it in the village and in the market. The same with vegetables. They buy vegetables direct from the farmers and sell it in their community.

In 2006, she decided to join ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines with the intention to have access to capital to improve her business. Her previous loans were carefully used as rolling capital for her resale business. Now on her sixth loan, she proposes a loan of 20,000 pesos as additional capital for her business. To breakdown, 15,000 pesos will be rolling capital for the resale of fish and 5,000 pesos will be the rolling capital in the resale of vegetable.

She is hopeful that with the help of ASHI and the trust of KIVA, she can improve her business. She dreams of having a house and a lot.

loans.use: As additional capital

loans.name: Susan Jemeli

texts.en:
Susan Jemeli is 24 years and is blessed with two children.Her clothing business is located in Chembulet Centre and her clients are residents of Chembulet.

She was introduced to KADET by a current KADET member.

With the loan Susan intends to use  to add more stock which includes trousers,skirts and dresses for women.In future she would like to continue with more clothing businesses and also expand by opening another branch in Chepkinaiyo.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To add more clothing stock for both adult and children.

loans.name: Galsandorj

texts.en:
Galsandorj U. is a 31-year-old married woman living in Hovd province, one of Mongolia's western provinces. She lives with her family and three children. Her two children go to a local secondary school and the youngest son goes to a local kindergarten. U. drives a cab in the town. She first purchased a small car in 2008 and has been using her car as a cab.

As the city authority has recently introduced city buses for locals, the taxi business has gotten more competitive. U. now works harder and more hours in order not to lose her daily income from her taxi business. After this winter, she hopes to sell her old car and purchase a better cost-efficient and fuel-efficient Japanese car for her business. She says that with the new Japanese car, she can reduce repair and maintenance costs as well as fuel costs.

For now, she requests a loan to purchase second-hand spare parts for her old car.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand spare parts for her old car

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. started her business in the year 1995 when she was 23 years old. She says though the post-election skirmishes and recent economic waivering in the country shook her business, she struggled and tried to maintain a lead on it. Her current plan is to expand her business to cater to an already big clientele. She calls it her next door breakthrough, and the only way to achieve it is to add more clothing stock.

Elizabeth is the mother of a boy and 3 girls. She is married and considers herself a family woman with a business. She would like a loan of Kshs. 40,000.

loans.use: Add a stock of clothes as an expansion strategy

loans.name: Tamemsu Group

texts.en:
This is Mabinty K., Aminata K. and Adamsay B.. They named their group Tamemsu, a Temne phrase meaning “Give us a Try”. They are small scale businesswomen in Makeni city who want a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean leones each to enable them expand their businesses. This will be their very first loan from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses so that they can attract more customers, make better sales, earn more profit and improve on their living standard. 

Mabinty K. (in the middle) is the leader of the group. Mabinty is now age forty-four and was born in a place call Sanda, near Makeni City (in northern Sierra Leone).  She is a widow, with five children. Four of her children are adults and one is in Junior Secondary School II. Mabinty sells firewood, cooked rice and market food (such as onions, tomatoes, fish, and spices). She has been in this business for well over thirty years now.

loans.use: To buy firewood, rice, and other staples for resale

loans.name: Delia Albertina

texts.en:
Delia Albertina B. V. is a single mother of three living in the Paraiso district of Guayaquil. Ms. B. sells chickens and guinea pigs; she currently has around 100 chickens and 18 guinea pigs. She buys the young chickens in bulk for 57 cents and spends 6-8 weeks feeding and caring for them. When they are fully grown, Ms. B. is able to sell them for $1.25/lb.

Ms. B. is requesting a loan in order to buy chicken feed (corn) and a water distributor. The holidays are approaching and chicken sales go up for Christmas and New Years. Therefore, Ms. B. wants to be ready with an ample supply. In the future, she wishes to expand her chicken coop and improve the coop's lighting system.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed (corn) and a water distributor.

loans.name: Atsutsé

texts.en:
Monsieur W. is a hairdresser who also sells a variety of hair products. He works in the Adidogomé region of Togo, but was born in the Agouhyogbo region. He has over ten years of experience and began his business in 1998.  He is single and has one child.

This will be his third loan with WAGES, which he will use to purchase weaves and hair relaxer. With the profits, both his personal and professional life will benefit.

loans.use: To buy weaves and hair relaxer

loans.name: Betsy Amparo

texts.en:
Ms. Betsy Amparo A. A. is 43 years old and lives in the Fortin district of Guayaquil in a cane home. Ms. A. noticed that her neighborhood lacked bread goods so she decided to open a bakery and mini market. Her best-selling items are bread loaves and sugar.

Although she is in a relationship, the couple has no children. Her partner helps her attend the bakery and market, but he has a bad knee making it difficult for him to stay on his feet all day. They have set up a hammock so that he may stay off his feet when not attending to customers.

Ms. A. is requesting a loan to buy rice and sugar for her store. In the future, the couple hopes to move their business to a more affluent neighborhood.

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Israel Baltazar

texts.es: Israel Baltazar A. 51 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Usulután, vive junto a su familia que esta conformada por su esposa e hijos. Él posee una venta de hamacas, con la cual cuenta desde hace más de 10 años atrás, Israel es una persona muy agradecida con la vida, ya que goza de la bendición de poseer un negocio propio que le ha permitido brindarle todo lo necesario a su familia, que son la principal razón por la que se esfuerza día con día. La venta de hamacas esta ubicada a un costado de La Alcaldía de Usulután. Cada día muy temprano Israel  carga sus hamacas desde su hogar hasta las calles de Usulután colocándolas en la pared de la Alcaldía,  con el deseo  de vender la mayor cantidad  de su producto, y con la ilusión de poder obtener muy buenas ganancias, que le permitan ofrecer una mejor vida a su familia. Es por esto que él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de hamacas, así mismo comprar otros productos típicos de El Salvador como sandalia y adorno hechos a mano. Israel cuenta con el deseo de mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
51-year old Israel Baltazar A. lives in Usulután Department with his wife and children. He has sold hammocks for more than ten years. Israel is grateful for his life since he is blessed with a business of his own which allows him to provide his family with all the necessities. This is his main motivation for working hard every day. His hammock business is located on one side of Usulután’s City Hall. Very early every day Israel loads up his hammocks and takes them from his house into the streets of Usulután where he hangs them from the walls of City Hall. He sells as many as possible hoping to earn a good profit so that he can provide a better life for his family. For this reason he is asking for a loan so that he can buy more hammocks and other items typical of El Salvador such as sandals and handcrafted ornaments. His wish is to improve his business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy hammocks, ornaments, and sandals

loans.name: Jose Rafael

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 30 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 3 y 1 años de edad en el sector Cerro Santa Rosa, en el distrito de Olmos, ubicado a dos horas y quince minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica al transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi, el nos comenta que tuvo que empezar a trabajar en esta actividad debido a que lo que ganaba cultivando y vendiendo maracuyás (fruta típica de la zona) no le abastecía para solventar los gastos familiares. 

Usualmente brinda su servicio de transporte en el distrito de Olmos y sus caseríos. Estos ingresos le han permitido sustentar a su familia por lo que dia a dia da lo mejor de si para salir adelante.

El continuo uso otorgado a su vehículo y las carreteras accidentadas que usualmente recorre han hecho que su mototaxi empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que necesitan de reparación urgente por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a cubrir los gastos de reparación y mantenimiento de su vehículo.

José es un padre de familia honesto, trabajador y muy entregado a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando como mototaxista y crecer un poco más como agricultor.
texts.en:
José, 30, lives with his wife and two children, 3 and 1 years old, in the Cerro Santa Rosa neighborhood of Olmos, which is two hours and fifteen minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. He transports passengers and cargo in a mototaxi. He tells us that he had to go into this line of work because what he earned farming and selling maracuyás (a typical fruit of the region) wasn't enough to meet household expenses. He ususally provides his transportation service in Olmos district and its surrounding settlements. This income has allowed him to support his family and every day he tries his best to continue forward. The continuous use of his vehicle along the very rough roads that are his usual routes has damaged his mototaxi; it needs urgent repairs. For this reason, he has called upon Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan that will help him cover repair and service costs to his vehicle. José is an honest, hard-working, father who is dedicated to his family. His greatest wish is to continue working as a mototaxi driver and to grow as a farmer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle service and repair.

loans.name: Fiapito

texts.en:
Fiapito T. is 36 and married with children (age range of 1-12yrs).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting.  Fiapito has many years of experience in this business.  Fiapito needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Fiapito joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Fiapito's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Fiapito T. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.87 out of 3
Level of Education:                         2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:            2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:                2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD:  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose A. N. is 42 years old. She is married to a businessman and they have one child, age 17 years old. Her business is located in a business centre at Githunguri, Embakasi. She has a salon which has been providing hair and beauty services to local women. She sells hair weaves, chemicals, treatments and others. She is planning to use her loan to add to her product lines, e.g., panties, sleepers, body creams, lotions and earrings. 

Rose says that her business is profitable. However, during the rainy season, ladies are keen to treat their hair. They prefer to plait it because of the nature of the African hair. She hopes to grow the salon business and also to open a big beauty shop. She is a very friendly, happy and cheerful person.

loans.use: To buy panties, sleepers, body creams, lotions, earrings

loans.name: Inocenta

texts.es:
Inocenta es socia del Banco Comunal San Benito.
Inocenta es viuda, tiene 46 años y 2 hijos, Inocenta tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende pollos para recria, además Inocenta tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.
Inocenta necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Inocenta sueña con tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Inocenta is a member of the community bank San Benito.

Inocenta is a widow, 46 years old, and has two children. Inocenta has a stall in the market called "Twelfth of April" where she sells chickens for breeding and she also has a grocery store in her home.

Inocenta needs a loan of $425 which she will use to buy rice and sugar.

Inocenta dreams of having her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Célestine

texts.fr: Née en 1950 à Ouidah, ville historique du Bénin, H. Célestine est une veuve et mère de six enfants, tous scolarisés. Célestine vit avec ses enfants au quartier Aïbatin à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C'est depuis huit ans que Célestine s'est installée dans ce quartier. Seule Célestine assure les différentes charges de la famille. Célestine n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Célestine vend du gazoil et du pétrole, depuis douze ans. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Célestine s'approvisionne. Célestine a déjà bénéficié d'un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui a été bien remboursé. Célestine sollicite un deuxième prêt afin de renforcer son activité et de se faire plus de revenus.
texts.en:
Born in 1950 in Ouidah, a historic city in Benin, Célestine H. is a widow and the mother of six children, all having attended (or still attending) school. She lives with her children in the Aïbatin borough of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She settled in this area eight years ago, and is the only provider for family expenses. Célestine has never attended school. To meet her needs, she has been selling diesel fuel and gasoline for the past 12 years. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, Benin’s international market. Celestine has already been granted one loan from ALIDé, which was repaid in full. She is now requesting a second loan to reinforce her activity and increase her income.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy jerrycans of diesel fuel and gasoline

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van K., 61, is married and resides with his wife and five children in Battambong Province, Cambodia, an area known for its good quality rice products. He is a security guard and is able to earn an income of about USD 2 per day, while his wife produces traditional lamps, earning an income of USD 3 per day to help cover the family expenses.  K. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase construction material to repair the house.  This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy construction material to repair house

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr:
Pour son besoin de crédit au sein d’U-IMCEC Thiès, Madame Aïssatou S.  nous a livré cet entretien
Quelle est votre activité Madame ?
-	Madame Aïssatou : je fais le commerce de tissus, téléphone portable, lait, produits de lessive, tout ce qui marche en général  depuis 10 ans. Et je les place très souvent aux grossistes de Thiès et je vend rarement en détail
Comment vous avez choisi ce métier ?
-	Madame Aïssatou : J’ai vu les gens s’activaient dans le métier et c’était beaucoup plus facile de le faire, ça demande pas d’être très diplômée pour le faire. Donc mes paires m’ont poussées à le faire
Quelles sont les aspects les plus importants dans ce travail ?
-	Madame Aïssatou : l’approvisionnement. C’est pourquoi je m’approvisionne très souvent  en Nouakchott capitale de la Mauritanie où les marchandises sont moins chères.
A quoi sert ce crédit que vous demandez ?
-	Madame Aïssatou : Ce crédit, si vous me le donnez, va me permettre de m’approvisionner, développer et élargir mon business.
Madame Aïssatou est à sa troisième demande de crédit au niveau de la caisse. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants
texts.en:
For her borrowing needs at the micro-finance institution U-IMCEC Thiès, Ms. Aïssatou S. provided us this interview:  What is your business, Madame ? -    Madame Aïssatou : For ten years, I have been doing commerce in cloth, mobile phones, milk, laundry products, anything that will sell in general.  And I very often place orders for these good with wholesalers in Thiès.  I rarely sell at the retail level.  How did you choose this line of work? -    Madame Aïssatou :  I saw that people were active in this trade, and it was much easier to do.  It doesn't require much schooling.  And so, my peers have pushed me into it. What are the most important aspects of this work? -    Madame Aïssatou :  Getting supplies.  This is why I supply myself quite often from Nouakchott, the capital of  Mauritania, where goods are less expensive.  What is the purpose of the loan you are requesting? -    Madame Aïssatou : This loan, if you give it to me, will allow me to stock up, to develop my business, and to expand it.  Madame Aïssatou is on her third loan request at this branch office.  She is married and the mother two children. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies of goods for her business

loans.name: Mpungwe Aliseeka Group Of Jinja

texts.en:
B. Hasifa’s face lights up with buoyancy when asked about her current prospects in her ten-year-old maize-selling business in Mpungwe, Jinja. With her lucrative business, this vastly experienced businesswoman has been able to substantially provide for all her six children’s needs, especially their education.

Different school head-teachers in Jinja have been flocking to her work station to buy her maize product which she stores in plenty after the harvest season. Since she began, she has been making steady profits in the range of 200,000 to 250,000 shillings per week.

With the hard work ethic she embodies, Hasifa’s future business prospects are looking favorable every passing year. This being her first loan, she is gleefully optimistic that it will be invaluable in helping her buy more bags of maize.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of maize to restock her graneries

loans.name: Enrrique Manuel

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenecen al banco comunal “LIDERES DEL TERCER MILENIO”; Nuestro socio vive en el distrito de Huanchac ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio es ÉL Sr. Enrrique;   él tiene 53 años de edad, él socio es soltera y él es natural de la ciudad de Trujillo; Nuestro socio tienen 1 hijo y él se dedica a la venta de libros, Nuestro socio distribuye libros a diferentes librerías, también a domicilios, El socio viaja cada 6 meses a Lima a traer diversos libros y los vende en la ciudad del Cusco, Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para viajar a la ciudad de Lima a surtirse de libros para traer a venderlos.

El socio agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower is one of the members of the Banco Comunal “Lideres del Tercer Milenio” (“Leaders of the Third Millenium” Communal Bank). He lives in Cusco, in the Huanchac neighborhood. His name is Enrrique. A native of Trujillo, he is 53 years old and single. He has a son and he sells books for a living. He sells books to different bookshops as well as door-to-door. He goes to Lima every 6 months to buy different books he then resells in Cusco. The loan he is requesting will be used for his trips to Lima to stock up on books to sell. He is thankful for and appreciates the help offered to him through this loan, and he commits to complying with repaying his debt within the specified time

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy books to sell.

loans.name: Lelis

texts.es:
Lelis tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y a su menor hijo en el distrito agrícola de Nueva Arica, una zona de terreno bastante accidentado, dada su cercanía a la sierra norte del país. Se encuentra ubicada a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar criando y vendiendo animales desde hace mas de diez años, ella cría animales menores en su vivienda y cuando estos ya han alcanzado su máximo nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta los días martes en una feria que se instala en la ciudad de Cayaltí. Ella no sólo vende los animales que cría sino que también recorre los caseríos cercanos comprando animales a los lugareños.

Lelis desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo mas animales y alimento balanceado para poder venderlos a un mejor precio, para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles.

Lelis es una mujer luchadora y que trabaja incansablemente por el bienestar de su familia. Los ingresos que percibe los utiliza para apoyar a su esposo con el sostenimiento del hogar.
texts.en:
Lelis is 43 years old, is married and lives alongside her husband and her young son in the farming district of Nueva Arica, a quite hilly area of land due to its proximity to the northern mountains in the country. She is located one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo. She has been dedicated to the work of raising and selling animals for more than ten years. She raises young animals in her house and when they have reached their maximum level of development, she sells them on Tuesdays in a market in the city of Cayalti. She not only sells the animals that she raises but also she goes through nearby villages buying animals from the villagers. Lelis wishes to expand her business acquiring more animals and balanced feed in order to be able to sell them at a better price. To achieve her objective, she has requested, for the first time, a loan of 1,200 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Lelis is a fighter and a woman who works tirelessly for the well-being of her family. The income that she receives are used to support her husband with the bills.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animals and balanced feed to grown her business raising and selling animals.

loans.name: Savun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savun M., is 39 years old and her husband, Mr. Run Roem (pictured together), is 50 They live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penn, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1989 and have five children - three sons and two daughters. One son is learning motorbike repairing skills, one daughter assists her mother in the business and other three children are in school.  

Savun is a flower farmer. She transports her flowers to sell in Phnom Penh market. Her husband is a motorbike taxi. She hopes to buy additional flowers to sell, but she does not have capital. Hence she is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to help increase her capital.

loans.use: To finance her capital to purchase flowers for resale.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario L. is from the village of Kabayan, Salvacion, Kadingilan, Bukidnon. She is 44 years old, married and has three school-aged children.  To make a living, Rosario owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community.  Rosario has been engaged in business for over four years and earns approximately 8500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rosario joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI to purchase additional inventory. Rosario is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP to expand her business. This loan will be her fourth from HSPFI.  Rosario plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business. 

----------------------------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary B. is currently in the business of selling fruits like pears, jack fruits, oranges, and many others. She is requesting a loan to stock more pears and jack fruits to sell. Mary is 31 years old and is married; her husband is a teacher. She has two children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

loans.use: To stock more pears and jack fruits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es: La señora Alba Luz  es propietaria de un negocio que es la venta de quesillos de manera ambulante en diferentes universidades. Alba sale todas las mañanas a vender su producto, su esposo trabaja en una bicicleta transportando gente de un lugar a otro por lo que juntos buscan la forma de cómo sobrevivir. Ella es muy famosa por ofrecer estos deliciosos quesillos, sus clientes se sienten muy satisfechos por el buen servicio y la buena calidad de sus productos. Está  solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de sus quesillos. Sueña con agrandar su negocio y además establecer otro puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Mrs. Alba Luz is the owner of a business selling cheese and she works as a street vendor by different universities. Alba goes out every morning to sell her products. Her husband works with a bicycle transporting people from one place to another. Together they look for ways to support themselves. She is very well-known for her delicious cheese and her customers are very happy with the good service and quality of her products. She is asking for new financing to buy what basic ingredients she needs to make her cheese. Alba dreams of enlarging her business and also of setting up a stand to sell the cheese.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Safarali

texts.en:
Safarali has run a livestock business for many years which he has used to support his large family. Since he began his business, he has worked hard to use his earnings to sustain his home and his livestock business which has helped him to achieve his goals. Currently, Safarali needs to purchase more livestock in order to grow his business. Intelligently, he is seeking a loan from IMON International in order to acquire additional animalsfor his farm.  
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase cattle in order to expand the business and to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah is 35 years old. She has 3 children between the ages of 7 and 13. All her children go to school. She is married to a sewage operator. Deborah owns a mini-supermarket. She has adopted two orphans. With the loan she will buy more juice, biscuits, loaf breads, and milk to sell. With the profit she will save money. Her business is well known by her customers and the things that she sells are in high demand. She dreams of owning a boutique.

loans.use: To buy more juice, biscuits, loaf breads and milk to sell

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
Rosalía es socia del Banco Comunal “Gran Poder”, ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 33 años de edad, de estado civil casada con tres hijos, tiene grado de instrucción de primaria completa.
Rosalía, viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cuatro  años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue de s/. 500.00 nuevos soles,  con el cual pudo invertir en la compra de insumos para preparar el delicioso jugo de Quinua que vende.
La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, dinero que le permitirá comprar insumos para preparar su juguito.
Su sueño es tener una tienda de abarrotes además de su negocio. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son los ahorros y sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosalía is a member of the “Gran Poder” ("Great Power") communal bank, located in the Ilave district in the province of El Collao, in Puno region. She is 33 years old and married with 3 children. She completed primary school. 

Rosalía has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement [the field partner] for four years. Her first loan was of 500 Soles, which she was able to invest buying ingredients for the delicious Quinua juice [a local soft drink], that she prepares and sells.

She is now seeking a loan of 800 Soles, money which will enable her to buy ingredients to prepare more juice. Her dream is to have a grocery store as well as her current business. What she likes about the communal bank is the ability to save up, and the earnings she can bring in.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making quinua juice

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita H., from the village of Brgy. Balete, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya, is 55 years old, married, and has three grown children. To make a living, Carmelita owns and operates a general store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Engaged in her business for over three years, she earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Carmelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan of 5000 PHP to purchase new items to expand product offering, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is 29 years old and married to Elizabeth. He operates a "Boda boda" transport business using his motorcycle. This is his primary business and he has been doing it for the last three year. 

He got to know about KADET LTD through a KADET staff member. This is his first loan with KADET and he has not borrowed from other financiers before. 

With this loan, Reuben plans to buy spare parts worth Kshs 40,000 and tools worth Kshs 10,000 for repairs. He operates his business in Nzambani which is in Kiwezi town. It has great economic potential and is strategically situated along the Mombasa Nairobi highway.

He desires to start farming using irrigation, and in future, he wants to set up a workshop for assembling motorcycle parts.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for Kshs 40,000, and Kshs 10,000 to buy tools for repair

loans.name: Revocate

texts.en:
K. Revocate is 46 years old and lives in the town of Masindi in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. Revocate has a retail shop business, which she has run for five years. She also does outside catering.
To help expand her business, Revocate has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase sugar and soap. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Revocate hopes to generate greater profits and pay her children's school fees. In the future, Revocate hopes to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase sugar and soap for resale

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en:
Eugene is 30 years old and is married with two children between 4 and 10 years old.  He owns a small bar and has been in this business for about five years. The hours of his business are from 7 am until 9 pm every day.

Eugene has requested a loan to purchase a large quantity of foodstuffs such as rice and sugar. Any profits he makes will be used for further reinvestment and to build a secure future for his family.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs like rice and sugar.

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta B. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 56 years old. Alberta is widowed and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, she plants and harvests rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $25 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Alberta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. 

Alberta is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her 4th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Naitai Lemomo

texts.en:
Naitai has practiced farming in Naivasha town for the last four years.  She is 32 years old, married to Raphael Nkurruna, and they have two children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her second loan.  She repaid her previous loan of Kshs 10,000 well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer and wheat seedlings for planting.

In future, Naitai hopes to buy more land and practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and wheat seedlings for planting

loans.name: Go- Bifo Group

texts.en:
This photo shows the members of “Go-bifo”, a group of small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is the second loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With Kiva/SMT loans, they are able to expand their businesses, earn more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Yeakain S., 30. She was born in Koinadugu district and currently resides in Makeni with her husband and four children, who are in primary school. Yeakain has been selling cooked rice for seven years. With her share of this loan, she will buy ingredients such as rice, palm oil, margarine and tomatoes, in large quantities.

loans.use: To buy cooking ingredients in large quantities.

loans.name: Rigoberto Armando

texts.en:
Rigoberto is single and lives in the highland region of Totonicapan, Guatemala. He has a university education and has no children. 

Rigoberto works as a loan officer at another institution and has been doing so for about six years (he started his career with ASDIR). He hopes to continue to develop his career as a loan officer and one day become the head of an agency. 

Rigoberto is requesting a loan to help pay for some recent personal expenses. This is Rigoberto's sixth loan through ASDIR, and the others have been paid back in full.

loans.use: To cover some recent personal expenses

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de San Jerónimo,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lucia; la socia tiene 34 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; la socia trabaja en un hostal por el centro de la ciudad ella trabaja de lunes a sábado su día libre puede variar en la semana, la socia está feliz ya que mediante este trabajo pudo ahorrar algo de capital para poder aperturar algún tipo de negocio como una tienda de abarrotes o crianza de animales menores cuyes y gallinas aun no está segura cual de los dos negocios pondrá, la socia es una persona perseverante y responsable y todo sus proyectos lo hace en función a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para iniciar un negocio propio y dejar de trabajar para otros y ser su propio jefe.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA" communal bank which is located in the district of San Jerónimo, in the province and department of Cusco.

Mrs. Lucia is 34 years old and has a live-in partner and son.  She works in a hostal in the city center from Monday through Saturday, with one day off a week which varies.  She is happy that because of her job she can save enough money to open her own business, which will be either a grocery store or raising her own animals, such as guinea pigs and chickens.  She still hasn't decided which of the two she will pursue but she is persevering and responsible, taking into account her family for all her projects.

Lucia is planning to use the loan to set up her own business and be her own boss.  She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To set up her own business and be her own boss

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of 12 members. Mrs. Pov was born in 1967 and is a village bank president. She was selected to be the village bank president by the other members. Each member of this village will use their portion of the loan to support their different purposes.

Mrs. Pov and her husband are farmers who own a plot of land they use to grow rice for their family's living expenses. With this farm, they do not have enough money to support it. Thus, Mrs. Pov would like to ask for a loan to buy a water machine, fertilizers and pesticide for growing rice. Aside from farming, they also earn for their family by fishing.

This couple has four children: Three are attending the local school and the youngest one is 3 years old.

loans.use: to buy a water machine, fertilizers and pesticide for growing rice

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua W. is 26 years old, comes from Kisumu county and is married to Ruth Achieng who is a nursery school teacher. They have one child who has not started school yet.

Joshua has a tree nursery business and he has been in it for the past nine years. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy seeds, polythene bags, manure and pesticides to enable him to run his business well. Joshua is hoping that his business will grow after he gets the loan and is able to achieve his purpose with it. 

The profits made will be used to cater for the family's needs. He hopes to open tree gardens in different places and also to buy a plot of land in the future.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for his tree nursery.

loans.name: Ramita

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Ramita M.. She is married and has one child, aged 9. In 1999, Ramita established her business making brass religious statues. Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family. In the future, Ramita plans to raise her family's economic condition. She thanks you for your support.

Nepal has a long and rich history of traditional handicrafts. Throughout the Kathmandu Valley, skilled artisans produce unique pieces of art that reflect Nepal's cultural diversity. Terra cotta pottery comes from the red clay of the surrounding Himalayan foothills. Bronze and silver statuettes are formed using wax molds and intricate hand tool finishing. In Patan, Newari culture and traditions are reflected in the images and symbols etched into metal or formed in stone. With the help of a Kiva loan, Nepal's artisans are able to purchase raw materials in greater volume. This increase in volume allows a single artisan to work on several pieces at the same time while increasing her profit margin.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: La Sra. Bertha  vive en bella vista y tiene su negocio en el mercado de la zona, tiene tres hijos ya independientes, desde hace tiempo ella es padre y madre de sus hijos por que el esposo les abandonó, sola saco adelante a su hijos de lo que se siente orgullosa, la Sra. Bertha es bastante trabajadora y responsable  también podemos destacar de que la Sra. Tiene bastante clientela en el mercado ya que tiene pensionados  y otros clientes  al día cocina al rededor de 80 a 100 almuerzos los cuales siempre termina  le va bien porque la Sra. es bastante amable  con todos y tiene buen sazón en el preparado de sus almuerzos, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos  por mayor como ser arroz, papa, fideo, la Sra. esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Bertha lives in Bella Vista and has her business in the local market.  She has three independent children.  For some time now she’s been both father and mother to her children because her husband abandoned them.  She raised her children by herself which makes her very proud.

Bertha is quite hard working and responsible.  We can also highlight that she has quite a large clientele in the market because she has a lot of retirees and other customers.  She cooks around 80-100 meals which always sell out.  She does well because she’s quite gracious to everyone and her meals are prepared quite tastily.

On this occasion she’s asking for a loan to buy rice, potatoes and noodles at wholesale.  She is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy ingredients at wholesale.

loans.name: Sergio Sebastian

texts.es: El señor Sergio de 33 años, es casado y cuenta con la venta de ropa y zapatos, pues tiene su negocio de manera ambulante y en su vivienda.  Empezó este negocio con capital propio a pesar de que no eran muchos productos, pudo agrandar un poco su inventario, es por este motivo que solicita este financiamiento que es para la compra de  pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes, camisetas, zapatillas, sandalias, deportivos y más. Se siente muy agradecido con Fundación por la confianza otorgada y comenta que con la mercadería nueva estaría cumpliendo mejor con su numerosa clientela.
texts.en: Sergio is 33 years old and married. He sells clothing and shoes from home and as a street vendor. He started his business with his own money even though he wasn't able to offer many products. This loan will allow Sergio to increase his inventory. He plans to buy trousers, shirts, skirts, suits, t-shirts, shoes, sandals, sportswear, etc. Sergio is very grateful to the Foundation for trusting him with this loan. He says that his new merchandise will help him to better serve all his customers.

loans.use: buy trousers, shirts, skirts, suits, t-shirts, shoes, sandals, sportswear, etc.

loans.name: Jahir Wladimir

texts.es:
Jahir Wladimir tiene 19 años, Es soltero vive con los padres, vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LA UNION se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Medellín, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

jahir se dedica a la agricultura la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol, las compras las realiza en Ventanas y las vende en las ferias de todos los días en especial  la de los domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos es la competencia y la variación del clima. Su sueño es es tener casa propia

Le gusta trabajar en el campo y difrutar las fiestas del recinto.
texts.en:
Jahir Wladimir is 19 years old. He is single and lives with his parents. He lives in the canton of Ventanas, in Los Ríos province.

The members of "LA UNION" communal bank get together in the Aguas Frías de Medellín district, which is part of the canton of Ventanas. The members of this communal bank work in agriculture, planting short-cycle crops such as corn, rice and pole beans. 

Jahir works in agriculture, planting corn, rice and beans. He buys supplies in Ventanas and sells his products at the daily markets, especially the Sunday market. 

He is requesting the loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and compost. With the help of the loan, he will improve his economic situation and be able to cover his needs. Some of the challenges he faces are the competition and the variations in the climate. His dream is to have his own house. 

He likes to work in the fields and he enjoys the festivals in his district.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and compost.

loans.name: Ameerzadi's Group

texts.en:
Ameerzadi has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. He is a jeweler and operates his shop in the market. He sells specifically artificial jewelry sets. He makes good sales every month which helps his family to survive financially. With the loan, he will buy jewelry in larger quantity that will allow him to make more sales and earn better profits. 

Ameerzadi is a housewife as well as a working woman. She sells quilts and operates her business from her home. She has good business contacts and earns reasonably good profits every month from her business. 
 
She is a regular loan user of Aasasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has paid her installments on time and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy jewelry for resale.

loans.name: Spartak

texts.en: Spartak keeps beehives. In addition, he works at the village hall as the community deputy leader. Spartak’s salary and current income are not enough to meet his family’s needs. Spartak would like to increase the number of beehives and develop his business. With the requested loan, he plans to purchase beehives and essentials. With the loan’s help, Spartak will get additional income and will be able to insure a better future for his wife and little child.

loans.use: to purchase beehives and essentials

loans.name: Fátima Susana

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Bellavista de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Bellavista.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Fátima, ella tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos mayores de edad los mismos que estudian en universidad y aún viven con ella. Su esposo es médico veterinario y trabaja en la Universidad Laica en Manta.

Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta aunque comenta que también sus clientes llegan hasta su casa a comprar los productos los mismos que deja a  crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince días. Sus productos lo que es ropa y zapatos los compra en Guayaquil y lo que es Yanbal lo recibe en su casa.  Lleva más de ocho años con esta actividad y siempre le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene mucha clientela.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, blusas, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y zapatos. Este es el quinto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos  son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es tener un carro.
texts.en:
The members of the Bellavista Communal Bank meet in the neighborhood of Bellavista in Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí. Portoviejo has been known for many years as the city of “Los Reales Tamarindos”.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Fátima. She is 55 years old, married, and has two grown children who still live with her and attend university. Her husband is a veterinarian and works at Laica University in Manta.

Fátima is a homemaker who earns her own income by selling clothes, shoes, and products made by Yanbal (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories). She works three day a week and generates sales by going door-to-door. Fátima says her customers also come to her house to buy the products, which she offers on credit and then collects payment weekly or every 15 days. She buys the clothing and shoes in Guayaquil and the Yanbal products are shipped to her house. Fátima has been in business for more than eight years and has always done well because she has many customers.

This loan will be used to buy trousers, blouses, perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and shoes. This is her fifth loan with the Communal Bank and she likes the fact that the loans are easy to obtain. Her dream is to own a car.

loans.use: to purchase trousers, blouses, perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and shoes.

loans.name: Yamina Del Socorro

texts.es: Yamina del Socorro tiene su negocio que es ofrecer el servicio de taxi. Tiene más de 11 años en su actividad. Lo inicio como medio de vida, sus hijos son personas mayores, pero uno de ellos se hace cargo de realizar los recorridos en el taxi por la ciudad. El financiamiento es para la compra de llantas, tapizados de asientos, reparación de ciertas cosas. Sabe que tiene una gran competencia pero siempre aconseja a su hijo a brindar el mejor servicio para que sus clientes siempre se encuentren satisfechos. Sueña con obtener otro vehículo para generar más ingresos a su hogar.
texts.en:
Yamina del Socorro has been managing a business that provides taxi services for more than 11 years. She started earning her livelihood in this manner since her children are grown. One of her children is responsible for driving the taxi around the city.

This loan will be used to buy tires, upholstery for the seats, as well as pay for a few repairs. Yamina knows that there is plenty of competition, so she advises her son to provide the best service to his customers so that they remain satisfied. Her dream is to obtain another vehicle for generating additional household income.

loans.use: to purchase tires, seat upholstery, and to pay for repairs.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en: Robinah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and all of her children go to school. She has one additional family member (sister). Robinah has a beauty salon. She has been in business for the last 12 years. She works seven days a week. Robinah provides her services on a retail basis in a shop. She has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more boxes of cosmetics for her customers and a hair dryer. Robinah’s goals and aspirations are to educate her children and own a fully stocked salon. Her major business challenges are defaulters and the ever-increasing prices of cosmetics in Uganda. Robinah lives in her own house and her family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses are rent and power.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cosmetics and a hair dryer

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a determined 51-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with six children. He has been meeting the needs of his family by engaging in farming. He wants in the next five years to be a major distributor of farm products in his county. His dream is to be serving and supplying major hotels in the country with farm produce. He is requesting a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings to buy cabbage and tomato seedlings. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he is now able to budget his income and finances well.

loans.use: to buy cabbage and tomato seedlings

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en: Gideon is a 58-year-old married man with six children and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has operated a textile shop specifically dealing in school uniforms for 30 years. He started the business in 1980 with capital of 25,000 shillings saved from coffee sales and now has a stock of 10,000,000 shillings. His hardship is high taxes and his vision is to operate in his own premises plus to educate his children. Gideon needs the loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 27 years old and lives in Paynesville. She is married and has four children ages 2 to 11, all of whom are presently in school and live at home. For the past ten years she has been selling charcoal in the local market. She makes a lot of profit and has many customers. She has insufficient goods, so she is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. She plans to expand her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Marie Jeanne

texts.fr:
Cliente de 47 ans, celibataire avec 2 enfants a sa charge dont l'age varie entre 20 et 33 ans.Elle s'est lancée dans la vente de la friperie, il ya bientôt 16 ans.
Elle a déjà bénéficie de 3 cycles de prêts auprès de Hope Congo, elle a eu beaucoup de succès dans son commerce, elle a rembourse ses successives prêts sans difficultés, et elle a une forte capacité d'épargne.
Pour ce quatrième prêt elle veut continuer dans la même perspective, acheter des ballots de body, chemises , des jupes, des pantalons et des maillots de sports.
Ses ventes sont de 20.000frs a 120.000 frs, elle continue a épargner et avec ses bénéfices elle s'occupe du bien être de sa famille et prend en charge la scolarité de ses enfants et petits fils.

Elle a pour ambition d'ouvrir a la longue une boutique pour vente de friperie.très entreprenante , elle promet d'aller loin avec les prêts de Hope.
texts.en:
This client is aged 47 and is responsible for two children, aged 20 and 33. She got into the sale of used clothing almost 16 years ago. 

She has already received three loans from  Hope Congo and has had a lot of success with her business. She has reimbursed her successive loans without difficulty and has put aside a lot in savings. 

For this fourth loan she wants to continue in the same vein, buying bales of shirts, skirts, pants, and sports jerseys. Her sales total between 20,000 and 120,000 francs, she continues to put aside savings, and with her profit she cares for her family and pays school fees for her children and her grandchild. 

Her long-term ambition is to open a shop selling used clothing. A very enterprising woman, she promises to go far using Hope loans.

loans.use: to buy some bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Yenny

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”IMASUMAC II”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Yenny; La socia tiene 30 años de edad, la socia es casada, la socia tiene 3 hijos de 13, 8, 8 meses de edad, la socia se dedica  a la atención de sus tienda de abarrotes, la socia tiene su negocio en su misma vivienda y ella puede alternar los trabajos del hogar con la administración de su tienda de abarrotes ella acomodo todo su comedor y cocina para dar paso a su negocio propio, la socia en esta ocasión requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, al por mayor, azúcar, harinas, sal, fideos, aceite, leche por cajas, y otros productos, para implementar la tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Yenny belongs to the Imasumac II communal bank.  The bank is in the Huanchac district of the Cusco province and department.  Yenny, age 30, is married and has three children.  The children are 13, 8, and 8 months.  

Yenny manages her grocery store.  She has her business in her house.  She is able to alternate her household chores with managing her grocery store.  She has arranged all of her dining room and kitchen to make space for her own business.

Yenny now needs a loan to buy basic needs items wholesale like rice, sugar, flour, salt, noodles, oil, cases of milk, and other products for her grocery store.  She is requesting the loan to buy basic needs items.  

She is grateful for the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy basic needs products.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ESTRELLA DE OROPESA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nelly; ella tiene 31 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta y elaboración de panes, la socia vende en la plaza de armas de Oropesa, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta y elaboración de panes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para hacer pan como harina, manteca y aceite.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Nelly is a member of the 'Virgen Estrella de Oropesa' community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Nelly is 31 years old, married, and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business making and selling bread.  She sells her products in Oropesa town square.  She works from 8.00am to 9.00pm and, through this business, she gets her children ahead in life.  Nelly would like to expand and improve her business making and selling bread.  She is requesting this loan to buy supplies for making bread such as flour, butter and oil.

Nelly is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making bread such as flour, butter and oil

loans.name: Oksana

texts.ru:
Оксана замужем, имеет двух дочерей. Она имеет свой бизнес и продает продукты. Ее ежемесячный доход составляет 4,000 гривен. Оксана ведет этот бизнес уже 6 лет. Ее маленький магазин находится в селении, расположенном недалеко от города Дрогобыч. Оксана обеспечивает людей, которые живут в селении, свежими качественными продуктами.

Оксана хочет получить кредит в сумме 10,000 гривен для пополнения  товарных запасов. Это поможет ей получить дополнительный доход и лучше заботиться о свой семье.
texts.en: Oksana is married and has two daughters.  She has her own business and sells products.  Her monthly income is 4,000 hryvnia.  Oksana has been running this business for six years.  Her small store is located in a village near the town of Drogobych.  Oksana supplies local residents with fresh and quality products.  Oksana wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 10,000 hryvnia to refill her product inventory.  This will help her earn an additional income and take better care of her family.

loans.use: to refill her product inventory

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La Sra. María tiene 46 años, está casada, tiene 2 hijos que ya son mayores y cada uno ya cuenta con una profesión y una vida ya hecha. 
María se dedica a la venta D. frutas y verduras en general, trabajo gracias al cual ella logra mantener a su familia y darles lo mínimo que necesitan para una vida digna y decorosa. 
Comenta que su marido la ayuda D. la Argentina, donD. el tuvo que irse a vivir por las duras condiciones que había en el país. Ella dice que tiene buena clientela, ya que siempre ha tenido buenos productos, es por ello que solicita el crédito, para la compra D. más frutas y verduras, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con sus clientes. 
Ella agradece por esta oportunidad que se le está brindando, pues le será D. mucha ayuda en su microempresa.
texts.en:
María is 46 years old, married, and has two adult children with their own careers and on their own.

María sells fruits and vegetables, a job which thankfully allows her to support her family and proviD. what they need to have a dignified and respectful life.

She says that her husband helps her from Argentina, where he had to go because of the difficult conditions in [the economy of] her country.  She says that she has good customers because she has always sold good quality products.  She is asking for this loan so that she can buy more fruits and vegetables to stock her business and meet her customer demand.

She is grateful for the opportunity given to her and it will be of great help to her small business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Caroline's Group

texts.en:
Caroline's Group is comprised of 2 hardworking women. Caroline is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala North region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, Caroline has been working hard to manage her poultry farm, which sells chicken. 

To help expand her business, Caroline has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more chicken for resale, and will help Caroline to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself. Caroline hopes that in the future she will be able to study catering. 

Caroline is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Caroline's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more chicken for resale

loans.name: Math

texts.en: Mrs Math, 50, a widow with one child, is in the business of selling fresh fish from Reussey Keo commune, Phnom Penh.  She works tirelessly and tries hard for her livelihood. Presently her daughter is already married but she is still living with Mrs Math in the same house.  Mrs Math wants to improve her living conditions and save some money for her life when she gets old and cannot make more money.  She intends to own a store to sell used clothes in a local market. Mrs Math cannot achieve her goal without funds from HKL.  Thus, she is looking for a loan to the sums of $600 to purchase a stock of used clothes for selling. This loan enables her to take another opportunity in the clothes selling business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ayush

texts.en:
