Ayush is 38 years old and lives with her husband and her two children in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  She is a tailor and has been in business for over six years.  She began her business by working out of her rental apartment but now has her own tailoring shop and several regular customers.  Over the years she had made many kinds of casual clothes to sell. 

Her sewing machine is very old and has recently become impossible to use.  It is the primary tool for her tailoring business and, without it; she will not be able to continue her business.  Ayush plans to replace her existing sewing machine with a high quality sewing machine, perhaps a western brand.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan in order to purchase the sewing machine and continue her business.

loans.use: To purchase the sewing machine to continue her business.

loans.name: Tho

texts.en: Tho is taking the loan out for her daughter, Luyen, who is attending Hung yen University for Technical training. Her course lasts 5 years and it will be completed by 2014. Luyen wants to be an English teacher or translator, so she is studying very hard and trying to overcome difficulties to obtain good results. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 14,580,000 Vietnam dong to pay for tuition fees and buy supplies for studying.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition fees and buy supplies for her studies.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
Doña Trinidad, continua laborando medio tiempo como conserje, el cual palmea tortillas por las tardes, lo que le ha dado mas ingresos para ir mejorando su casa, su esposo comercializa granos basicos, y sus hijos trabajan.
Este año que paso, fue muy triste para ella, ya que su hijo se accidento en una moto y su nieto recien nacido fallecio, lo que desvio su credito, para poder cubrir los gastos, es por tal razon, seguira con la construccion del muro, ya que solo tiene dos hiladas de piedra, el cual podra comenzar la obra, con este nuevo financiamiento y que espera lograr el objetivo, teniendo mayor seguridad en su propiedad.
texts.en:
Trinidad continues working half time as a custodian and making tortillas by hand in the afternoon, which has given her more income to continue improving her house.  Her husband sells basic grains and her children work.

This past year was very sad for her because her son had a motorcycle accident and her newborn grandson died, which diverted her loan because she had to cover the expenses.

She will continue with the construction of the wall, since she has only two rows of stone, which will be able to begin the job.  With this new loan she hopes to achieve her goal of having greater security for her property.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to finish a wall.

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en: Sabah is a 56 year old married woman from Bani Kenanah, Irbid, Jordan who has 3 family members. She is requesting a loan of 1000 JOD to buy children and women's clothes as well as accessories which she will be selling. This will expand her business by increasing the number of her products and increase her income. She hopes oneday to take a pilgrimage to Mecca in Saudi Arabia.

loans.use: to buy chidren and women's clothes for resale

loans.name: Mayi

texts.en:
Mayi L. runs a very small market out of her home. She sells a variety of items including fruits and hygienic products. She started doing business about three years ago thanks to her husband who contributed $200 in start up capital. He realized that the family badly needed another source of income but he was concerned about his wife working and not being able to care for their 4 small children. The store has been a great solution as Mayi has a stable flow of revenue without having to leave the children alone. Every month her husband tries to give her about $20 in order to invest in the store. Mayi is seeking this loan in order to buy in bulk from wholesalers and to start investing in the physical appearance of the market.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Increase and diversify the inventory in her market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The money will be used to buy a new photcopier CANNON 1120 which will allow the owner to make copies in color and to increase clientel as well as the earnings from their business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virgina is part of the first Communal Bank formed by Mifex in the rural town of Salitre. On her farm she cultivates rice and corn with the help of her husband and some of the children she had who are now adults. She hopes that with the loan she will be able to directly invest in rice seeds and pesticides that will help keep the crop healthy. She is also hoping she can purchase chickens for her farm as a secondary source of income. She is pictured at the Mifex offices after filling out her application.

He is the latest addition to the first Communal Bank in the new Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Resistencia Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Salitre named Resistencia. They will use the microloans to prepare the lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Resistencia Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but is imperative for the communities Mifex works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Loan Use and Repayment

The loans in this sector will be used to create water deposits that will prevent flooding in the case of heavy rains or store water in case of droughts. They will also be used to treat the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase fertilizer. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical microentrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

Below is more information about Salitre compiled by the staff at Mifex when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Salitre

Salitre is a rural sector in the Province of Guayas known as the capital of Montuvios (montuvio is a cowboy) with approximately 30,000 inhabitants. The main economic activities are herding and agriculture which make up about 80% of the economy. The infrastructure and basic services are poor, especially the roads and water services.

Salitre is highly dedicated to farming rice and cattle ranching. Rice is a crop that yields about every four months. In order to farm rice, the environment must be very humid and there must be a high volume of water. The lack of a structured water system makes it difficult for the small farmers to be highly productive. The best months for cultivating rice are early in the year when it is the rainy season in the coast of Ecuador.

Salitre is a national tourist attraction as many Ecuadorians visit the fresh water Salitre River. There are cottages, small restaurants and water attractions that people come to enjoy.

Access to Credit

There is not a single financial institution that provides services to the productive sector of the local economy. The only access to credit comes from loan sharks who charge extremely high interest rates averaging around 20% a month. The locals are also exploited by the intermediaries that buy their products in order to commercialize them in the city and to export abroad. These intermediaries buy crops in advance at very low prices, finance soil at extremely high prices and often provide emergency loans for even higher interest rates than the loan sharks.

Risks

Salitre is a dangerous sector considering it is in the rural area. There is a high incidence of robbery of cattle that results in many of the ranch owners owning weapons to protect their property. Because the police are not present in these areas, farmers and ranchers must apply their own laws and provide their own security. In some instances they have formed their own cooperatives and associations to have a community crime prevention effort.

Salitre is in the lowlands of Ecuador and is vulnerable to flooding in the rainy season. In the event of a heavy rainy season, often at its worse when El Niño occurs, the farmers of rice lose many of their crops. All this is due to a lack of infrastructure in the area.

loans.use: Purchase items for rice farming and also invest in chickens

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en: Rakhima (her husband is pictured) is a 27-year-old mother of 2 children. She and her family live in Baku city, Sabunchu region. Rakhima started this business  5 years ago. Now she needs a loan of $1200 to expand the area of her business and to buy foodstuffs in order to increase her income to cover all family expenses.

loans.use: To expand the area of her business and to buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Rocío

texts.es:
Rocío lives in the locality of Monclova, Coahuila. She is married and has three small children aged 3,5, and 7. In his search for better opportunities for his family, Rocío's husband decided to go and work in the United States, but he has not sent money back home so Rocío and her children lacked many necessities. At the point where they did not have enough to even eat, Rocío decided to begin her own business selling footwear by catalog. This business would allow her to continue caring for her children since she had nobody to help her, so she began selling among her neighbors and acquaintances. Fortunatally, she soon succeeded in increasing both her clients and her sales.

In order to continue expanding her business Rocío needs a loan of $200, which she will use to purchase merchandise to meet the demand of her clients. She promises to return this money in just 3 month. Today you can give help to somebody in great need, so please decide to help this family. They thank you very much.

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

En la localidad de Monclova, Coahuila vive Rocío, ella está casada y tiene tres pequeños hijos de 3, 5 y 7 años de edad. En busca de obtener mejores oportunidades para su familia su esposo decidió irse a trabajar a Estados Unidos, pero no le enviaba dinero por lo que Rocío y sus hijos pasaron por muchas necesidades, no tenían ni para comer hasta que ella decidió emprender su negocio vendiendo calzado por catálogo, ya que este negocio le permitiría continuar al cuidado de sus pequeños porque no tiene quien le ayude, fue así como inició vendiendo entre sus vecinos y conocidos, afortunadamente pronto logró incrementar sus clientes y ventas.

Para poder continuar creciendo con su negocio Rocío necesita de un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para surtir los pedidos que tiene de sus clientes, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en solo 3 meses. Hoy puedes ayudar a quien más lo necesita, decídete a apoyar a esta familia, ellos te lo agradecen mucho.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Mrs. Florence O. sells food items, provisions and drinks. She is soliciting the above amount to improve her business, which she started in 2000. She is married with four children and lives in Benin City. She is 45 years old and is a faithful member of LAPO.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and provisions for sale

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mrs. Mariamu M. runs a shop in Temeke Mji Mpya, a suburb of Dar es Salaam, 500km from her home town Mmakonde, which is on the border of Tanzania and Mozambique. She sells a mixed bag of cosmetics, cleaning products and soft drinks and requires a loan of TSH 600,000 to purchase additional stock, such as soap, shampoo, bleach and unnamable brands of soft drink (we don’t want to provide free advertising to the multinationals!).

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipments from the said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional cosmetics to sell at her shop.

loans.name: Hadya

texts.en:
Hadya, age 42, is married with 2 children (ages 16 and 10). She owns a clothing business where she sells various types of clothing. She began this business in 2004 and now makes a profit of about $265 a month.

Hadya now hopes for a loan to buy more stock for her business. She is a member of group Faidika, which totals 40 members who keep each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy clothing stock

loans.name: Mirembe I(A) Group

texts.en:
Lydia is 29 years old and married with three children. Two of the children go to school. Her husband sells used clothes. Lydia has a medical drug shop and usually earns SHS 50.000 in profit each week. She wants to use the extra profit to buy a plot of land and build a house. Jane sells new clothes for a living and intends to expand business with the loan. Lukiya and Norah sell used clothes while Betty sells charcoal.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more drugs for sale

loans.name: Kabonkétor Group

texts.fr:
We are a group of women wishing to produce clothing from traditional dyed cloth. We have a great deal of experience in this, having been trained in the field. Our work consists of creating and designing traditional dyed 'pagnes' (a length of cloth worn around the waist as a skirt), and making sheets and table cloths to sell to hotels in the region. Our products are much in demand locally as well as in Senegal's cities. At the moment we have a major order to fulfill and it is to address this situation that we come to you with our request for an SEM loan through Kiva.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Nous sommes un groupe de femmes qui désire travailler dans la production d'habits en pagne teité. Nous avons une grande expèrience en la matière car ayant bénéficiée d'une formation dans le domaine. Notre travaille consiste à la création et au design de pagnes teintés , la fabrication de draps et autres nappes de table que nous fournissons aux hotels du département et que nos produits sont très demandés dans la marché local et dans les grandes villes du Sénégal. Ces temps-ci, nous devons livrer une commande très importante et c'est pour povoir faire face à cette situation que nous sommes venues vous solliciter pour avoir accés à un prêt de SEM chez Kiva.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for dyeing cloth and batiks

loans.name: Dajana

texts.en: Dajana is a 21-year-old woman from Laktaši. She is not married, has no children, and lives with her parents. This is the first loan she has sought through Kiva and she is seeking this 1,200 BAM loan to buy automotive parts for her auto-mechanic shop. With the loan proceeds, she is confident that she will be able to help her family's business grow and to generate additional monthly income.

loans.use: To purchase automobile parts for an auto-repair shop.

loans.name: Luz Angelica

texts.es:
Mrs. Luz Angelica L. S. is 61 years old; she studied until the 6th grade. She is a single woman and does not have any children. She lives in the district of the Future in the province of Trujilo in the city of La Libertad, Peru. The business she has dedicated herself to is the sale of stuff for different sizes of shoes, furthermore she sells food and cooks for different events but now she doesn’t do this anymore because of her poor health. Nowadays she continues with the sale of things and decorates corrospun materials, together with her cousin she makes these works to the different schools for their celebrations that they have during the year. She is the member of the God’s Blessing Communal Bank where she received her first loan of 3000 soles with this money she purchased a variety of meats, ham, hot dogs, chorizo, and cheeses. With the loan of 1100 soles which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase corrospun material, starch, decorations, paints, etc. Mrs. Luz dreams of putting a costume workshop now that she has a better understanding of these types of work. Previously, she decorated clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Luz Angélica León Solórzano tiene 61 años de edad, estudio hasta el sexto grado de primaria. Es una mujer soltera y no tiene hijos . Vive en el distrito de El Porvenir en la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad- Perú. El negocio al que se ha dedicado siempre es la venta de embutidos por los diferentes talleres de calzado, además vendía menú y cocinaba en diferentes eventos pero ya no lo hace debido a que se puso mal de salud. Actualmente sigue en la venta de embutidos y también elabora adornos de material corrospun, junto con su prima hacen estos trabajos para los diferentes jardines y colegios de acuerdo a las celebridades que se presenten durante el año. Ella es socia del Banco Comunal “Bendición de Dios” lugar donde recibió su primer préstamo de S/. 3000.00 con este dinero compro una variedad de embutidos entre jamonada, hod dog, chorizo, mortadela y quesos. Con el préstamo de S/. 1100.00 el cual será cancelado en cuatro meses,comprará varias planchas de material corrospun, escarcha, ojitos, pinturas, etc. La señora Luz sueña con poner un taller de costura ya que tiene conocimiento sobre como hacer este tipo de trabajos. Anteriormente elaboraba algunas prendas.

loans.use: With the loan she will purchase products for her business

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
The elegance of each of her beautiful traditional skirts are glittering in Sra. Hilda’s store who for 10 years has dedicated herself to selling and renting traditional skirts. She also tailors beautiful and innovative clothing that are shown at her store. Her store is frequently visited and many “cholitas” order their colorful traditional skirts for special occasions or simply to look more beautiful from Hilda. Hilda feels very happy because she never imagined that this business that she began with little expectations would convert itself into her main source of income. Now that she has experience in this activity she hopes to expand it and is thus requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

La elegancia de cada uno de sus hermosas polleras y centros de vestir son muy relucientes en la tienda de doña Hilda, quien desde hace 10 años viene dedicándose a la venta y alquiler de polleras y adicionalmente a este negocio confecciona hermosos y novedosos centros que son exhibidos en su local.Su tiendita es muy visitada y solicitada por aquellas hermosas cholitas que adquieren sus coloridas polleras para fechas especiales o simplemente para lucir más bellas, Hilda se siente muy contenta por que jamás imagino que ese negocio que inicio con poca expectativa se convertiría en su principal fuente de ingreso económico.Ahora que ya tiene experiencia en ésta actividad desea ampliarla y es por ello que solicita un préstamo.

loans.use: Increase her capital in order to expand her work space.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
My name is Juana C. G. and I have been a merchant for more than 30 years. I started as a street vendor selling baby clothes in the “El Guarda” market in the city of Guatemala.

After many years, I wanted to expand my business and with my husband’s help, I succeeded in getting my own shop and now we sell bulk clothing,

With the requested loan, I would like to buy more merchandise as my clients have offered me to buy several batches of clothing. However, for that I need an important amount of capital as I have many clients. I thank God because my clients come see me often as I am well located in the market and I like to offer them a good variety of clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Soy Juana C. G., desde hace más de treinta años que me dedico al comercio, inicie con la venta de ropa para bebés, en el mercado el guarda en la zona 11 de la ciudad capital y de forma ambulante.

Después de muchos años, he querido agrandar mi negocio y conseguí un local y con el apoyo de mi esposo pudimos poner la venta de ropa clasificada o de paca como se conoce, con el crédito quiero invertir para comprar mercadería para surtir ya que me ofrecen la oportunidad de comprar varios lotes de ropa, pero para ello necesito una buena cantidad de capital, ya que gracias a Dios, mis clientes me buscan mucho ya que tengo buena ubicación en el mercado y quiero poder ofrecer buena variedad a mis clientes.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise as my clients have offered me to buy several batches of clothing

loans.name: Ladriya (Loyauté) Group

texts.fr:
The seven women who make up the Ladriya group are all married, 32 years old on average, with an average of 4 children. The majority live in monogamous families in Dagala Wèrè, one of the villages of Ségou (the fourth economic region of the Republic of Mali).

They mostly are involved in food service, the sale of cereals, the sale of firewood, and of toilet soap. The members of the Ladriya group have ties of friendship and work-related bonds. Because of their mutual confidence, they decided to become members of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom they are on their first loan. This loan will serve to purchase: 12 sacks of cereals, of which 2 sacks of millet will be reserved for transformation into dried couscous, and 4 wagon loads of firewood.

These women do their purchasing essentially in Dagala wèrè itself (in the case of cereals and firewood, for which they pay 800 FCFA, about US$ 2, per wagonload to the department responsible for nature conservation) and in Ségou in the case of ingredients for food service.

They generally make their sales retail, in their homes, on the market days of surrounding villages (for cash and on credit) and in Soro wèrè (an encampment of peulhs—an ethnicity in Mali). Their clientele is made up of shepherds and market-day merchants. They expect to make a monthly average profit of 10,000 FCFA (about US$ 25) which will be used to make repayments on the loan, the remainder being invested in the businesses.

N.B. Kadiatou D. is absent from the photo because she was away attending a funeral.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Les sept (7) femmes du groupe Ladriya sont toutes mariées, ont une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, 4 enfants et vivent en majorité dans des familles monogames à Dagala Wèrè un des villages de Ségou (la quatrième région économique de la république du Mali).

Elles exercent en majorité la restauration, la vente des céréales, la vente du bois de chauffe et de savon de toilette. Les membres du groupe Ladriya ont des liens d’amitié et professionnels. En raison de la confiance mutuelle, elles décidèrent d’intégrer le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur premier prêt. Ce prêt servira à acheter : 12 sacs de grains de céréales dont 2 sacs de mil réservés à la transformation en couscous séché, 4 chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe.

L’approvisionnement de ces femmes se fait essentiellement sur place à Dagala wèrè (en céréales et en bois de chauffe où elles payent 800 FCFA par chargement de charrette aux services de la conservation de la nature) et à Ségou pour les matières premières de la restauration.

Elles effectuent généralement leurs ventes en détail à domicile, dans les foires des villages environnants (au comptant et à crédit) et à Soro wèrè (un campement de peulhs). La clientèle est constituée de bergers et de forains. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 10.000FCFA, qui servira à payer les intérêts du prêt et investir le reste dans les activités.

NB : La nommée Kadiatou D. est absente de la photo pour raison sociale (décès).

loans.use:
Purchase of cereals and firewood

Achat de céréales et de bois de chauffe

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
This committee was formed thanks to the ladies Sinecia R. and Fany Lezcano, who were informed about the Foundation and the Enterprising Women Committee Program thanks to another lady friend that already was participating actively in another committee that had been formed in the neighborhood.

The ladies are members of a neighborhood commission of the Neighborhood María Auxiliadora where the Port of San Antonio is located. We can speak of some of the members; in this case Marta Amarilla, who is a single mother of two small children. They live in a humble house set along the Paraguay River in the Port of San Antonio. She rises early in the morning to get the first fresh fish, because in those hours she can select the best. She then cleans and cuts up the fish to subsequently make foods such as scalloped fish or fish soup or for the sale of the raw fish.

The other ladies are dedicated to the sale of fruits, vegetables, foods, cosmetics, or coal and to running pantries or salons.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Este Comité se formo gracias a las Señoras: Sinecia R., y Fany Lezcano, quienes se enteraron acerca de la Fundación y del Programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras gracias a otra señora amiga que ya estaba participando activamente de otro comité que se había formado en el barrio.

Las señoras son miembros de una comisión vecinal del Barrio María Auxiliadora donde se encuentra el Puerto de San Antonio. Podemos hablar de alguna de las integrantes en este caso de: Marta Amarilla, quien madre soltera de dos hijos pequeños, Ellas vive en un humilde casa frente al Río Paraguay, en el Puerto de San Antonio, se levanta por la madrugada para recibir los primeros pescados frescos, pues a esas horas puede elegir los más lindos. Luego limpia y desmenuza para posteriormente, elaborar comidas como milanesas y sopas de pescado o la venta de los mismos sin crudos sin elaboración.

Las demás señoras se dedican a la venta de frutas, verduras, comidas, despensas, venta de cosméticos, carbón y otras se dedican a la peluquería.

;

loans.use: To buy fruits, vegetables, fish, cleaning products, comestibles, carbonated drinks, milk products, baked goods, canned goods, etc. for resale or for making products for sale.

loans.name: Leyla

texts.en: Leyla (her son is pictured) is the mother of four children. She was born in 1950, and she lives in Baku, Azerbaijan. Her son has transported loads for 10 years. Now they need  a loan of $1200 to buy the spare parts for this truck.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: George

texts.en: George K. is a single parent with two children. He has received schooling through the Senior High level. George sells phones and accessories at the Siwdo compound near Cape Coast, which he has done since 2007. George uses his income to pay for his children's school fees and other family expenses. George will use the loan to purchase the latest mobile phones and their accessories. With the new profits from his expanded business, George plans to reinvest in his business so he can increase his income.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones and accessories

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị  Nguyễn Thị Đông năm nay 38 tuổi, gia đình chị hiện có 2 con trong đó có 1 con đã trưởng thành. Năm 2004 chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào cửa hàng tạp hoá của gia đình. Hiện tại chị kinh doanh cửa hàng tạp hoá còn chồng chị làm thầu thợ xây. Hàng tháng thu nhập bình quân  của gia đình chị đạt 140.000đ/ ngày
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm các mặt hàng phục vụ ngaỳ càng tốt hơn nhu cầu của bà con địa phương.
texts.en:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Đông is 38 years old. She has 2 children, one of which is grown up. In 2004 she joined TYM fund to get capital to open a grocery store. She runs the store while her husband works as a construction worker. Her family's income is 140.000 VND a day. This round of loan she is requesting 9.000.000 VND to buy more products for her store so she would be able to satisfy her customer's needs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy more products for her grocery store

loans.name: Kirana

texts.en:
Kirana I., a 29-year-old mother of three children from San Jose Gusu, Zamboanga City, is selling variety of goods for a living. Her husband, a government employee, has been very supportive of her in her business.

Because they didn’t own the house, she has engaged herself in a retail business. She sells various items in her store to earn additional income for the family. She wants to have their dream house built.

She is requesting a loan to purchase additional goods to sell in her store. In this way, she could earn more and save enough to support her children.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
Ernestina se dedica a la costura de sombreros y trabaja con su esposo; vende sus productos en un puesto que tiene en la calle Isaac Tamayo de la Ciudad de La paz 
Vive en la zona de Las Lomas  de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de materia prima (tela, yute, hilo)
Es la décima primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con buen cumplimiento en el pago de su crédito.
Las ganas de trabajar le dan la oportunidad de acceder a este crédito ya que es una persona responsable.
texts.en:
Ernestina makes sombreros and she works with her husband. They sell their products from a stand they have on the street named Isaac Tamayo in the city of La Paz.

She lives in the region of la Lomas in the city of La Paz, and she has two children that are school aged.

The loan will be used to purchase materials (fabric, string, threat).

This is the eleventh time she is requesting a loan from Impro (Kiva Field Partner). Her credit history qualifies her as Client 1, meaning she has payed her credit on time in the past.

Her great will to work have given her the opportunity to access this loan, as she is a responsible woman.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabric, string, thread, lining, to make sombreros for the business.

loans.name: Sirenitas Group

texts.es: El grupo " SIRENITAS" esta representado por la señora Ana Luisa y conformado por doce miembros los cuales se dedican exclusivamente a la venta y comercialización D. pescado en el mercado. Dentro del ámbito del la venta del pescado existe mucha competencia pero el consumo D. este producto tienen mucha demanda por lo que logran terminar la venta del todo el producto en el día procurando siempre tener un producto fresco al día siguiente. El financiamiento esta destinado a incrementar su producto debido a la gran demanda en el mercado  y así poder incrementar sus ingresos para poder darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad D. vida. Los socios (as) tienen experiencia trabajando con grupos solidarios ya que contaban con otros créditos en instituciones similares a la Fundación Agrocapital en la cual van cursando juntos su primer ciclo, los socios (as) cuentan con experiencia para administrar sus fondos y con la responsabilidad para cumplir con sus obligaciones
texts.en:
The Sirenitas group is represented by Ana Luisa and formed of twelve members who are dedicated exclusively to selling fish in the market. In this environment of selling fish exists a lot of competition, but the consumption of this product has a lot of demand so they are able to sell all of the product the day they get it and always have fresh products the next day. The financing is destined to increase their product owing to the large demand in the market and so they can increase their incomes to be able to give their children a better quality of life. The members have experience working with solidarity groups and already have loans with other institutions similar to the Agrocapital Foundation, with which they go together for the first time, the members count on their experience to administer their funds with responsibility to complete their obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia E. grows rice. She started her business using 1 hectare of land, which she inherited from her parents. Now, she has abundant harvests that help her contribute to the family's income. She is 55 years old and has 3 children. Aside from farming, she also established her own "sari-sari" store. "Sari-sari" is a Filipino term for variety. It's a shop that has various different items for sale.

She is asking a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy more fertilizers for her farm and merchandise for her "sari-sari" store. The loan will truly help her expand her business. Subsequently, she will be able to  support her children by paying the tuition fees for their schooling and buying the books that they need.

CEVI supports Cecilia in her business. Now, she enjoys having CEVI credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer

loans.name: Monica's Group

texts.en:
M. Monica is the leader of her group in Jinja. She is a poultry farmer and her main business is keeping chicken layers and broilers. She sells the eggs and the broilers for meat.

Monica has been able to benefit from her work because she feeds her birds on time, ensures that they have the best quality feeds, and above all, knows how to plan for the money she gets from her sales. As a result, Monica has been able to buy a sewing machine, which she uses to mend and make her customers’ clothes. She has also bought more household items. Monica also manages her small garden, where she grows food that is mostly for home consumption.

Monica needs a new loan to help with buying more day-old chicks to rear, plus feeds.

loans.use: To buy day-old chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Kudrat

texts.en:
J. Kudrat is 51 years old. He is married with 4 children. For more than 9 years, Kudrat has been working at house-repair. Kudrat is an example of the type of person who cannot sit by and do nothing. He started his house repair business to provide for his family. 

Firstly Kudrat started working as an apprentice. But gradually he has become an expert in this type of activity and now he has his own apprentices. Currently, he wishes to grow his business and improve his family's quality of life. Today Kudrat is requesting a loan of 800 USD, which he will use to purchase the necessary material for repairing houses in order to provide his high quality service and to be able to fulfill pending jobs and orders on time. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months. He and his family are very grateful for your support. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia A. is a trader who sells hair-do's, creams and drinks. She is also a hairdresser who owns her beauty salon at Akotoyir in Abura. Felicia has received an education through junior high school. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a driver.

Felicia has been working as a trader for six years. She is responsible for paying for the feeding and clothing needs of her family. Her loan will be used to purchase additional, and more variety of, hairdressing creams and materials. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to start saving at a bank.

loans.use: To purchase additional, and more variety of, hair dressing creams and materials

loans.name: Rubelyn

texts.en:
Rubelyn L. is a fish vendor. She is 29 years old, married, and has 2 children. She purchases fish from fishermen in her village, and sells the fish at the market with a 40% mark-up value per kilo. Her husband, Ruel L., is a fisherman. Together they work hard and do their best to provide for all of their needs. 

She is requesting a loan of Php 18,000 through CEVI. She will use the loan to buy more fish to sell. "The loan will help me earn a bigger income for my family," she said.

CEVI aims to help people expand their businesses. In addition to providing loans, CEVI provides training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell

loans.name: Roselle

texts.en:
“Strong determination is the most important attribute for a businesswoman to have when managing a business,” said Roselle. She is a young and faithful wife to her husband Roberto. The couple is blessed with two children: Robert is 7 years old and in grade school and Michael Laron is 6 years old and is an upcoming pupil of the primary school.

Roselle is 27 years old and, even at her young age, she is able to manage their tricycle transport business and at the same time help her husband in their rice farming business, which is their largest source of income.

For two years, Roselle has been managing their tricycle transport business. She wants to increase her daily income in the business so she is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to repair their motorcycle.

loans.use: To repair their motorcycle transport

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
Cette dame exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de tubercules et de céréales, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2004. pour réaliser une plus grande marge bénéficiaire sur ses ventes elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays. Actuellement le stock de marchandise dont elle dispose ne lui permet pas de couvrit les charges du foyer, elle s’adresse alors  WAGES et sollicite son premier crédit pour acheter 30 tas de tubercules, 15 sacs de maïs et 5 sacs d’haricots.
Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants.
texts.en:
This is a woman who earns a living in the commerce of tubers and grains. She has been in this business since 2004. To realize a bigger profit margin on her sales, she supplies herself from inland locations. Currently, her stock of merchandise doesn’t allow her to cover household expenses. She therefore inquired with WAGES and is requesting her first loan to buy 30 piles of tubers, 15 sacks of corn, and 5 sacks of beans. She is married and the mother of three.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grains and tubers

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Thị (335991083) is a 54-year-old female living in the town of Vĩnh Phúc. She is married and has three adult children.

T. owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily raising water buffalo for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month.

In 1999, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

T. is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. The loan will be her 9th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita S. is from the village of Barandiaz, Pangantucan Bukidnon. She is 42 years old. Anita is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Anita owns and operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from retailing rice in the local community. Anita has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Anita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Anita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional rice to sell

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia (or Amy as she is called in their village) is a resident of Barangay Maddiangat Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. Due to lack of financial resources, she was not able to finish her college education and instead started to work and help her parents earn a living.

She is married to Fernando and they have three children. Two of them are high school graduates and and presently working as a welder and a saleslady in Solano while the youngest is still studying in high school. They want their youngest child to pursue his college education and hope he will have a stable job.

At present, Amelia and her husband are helping one another in supporting the needs of their family through their farming and sewing businesses. She also accepts clothes for repair for additional income. She is now in need of additional business capital amounting to PHP 5,000. She intends to use the loan to buy the necessary materials for her sewing business. She hopes that Kiva lenders will grant her request so she can dream of achieving her goals in life.

loans.use: business improvement

loans.name: Benice

texts.en:
Bernice is thirty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to five children who are currently in school.

Bernice is a petty trader and trades in plantain, charcoal, palm oil, cassava, etc. She buys her goods from nearby communities at affordable prices and retails to her customers who are mainly food vendors. She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy stock in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and sponsor her children in school.

loans.use: To buy stock in bulk

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is a very hard working individual. In the morning, she sells vegetables in her village from 8:00-11:00 and in the afternoon she sells snacks such as bananacue or turon (fried banana coated with sugar) and fresh lumpia (like a spring roll, with fried vegetables with sauce). She has been in this business for three years and this is her routine everyday to help her family earn a living. Her husband drives a tricycle owned by their neighbor and they also need to pay a daily fee for using the tricycle. Jenny's business plays a large role in providing the daily needs of their family especially the children.

However, their income is not enough to meet the growing needs of their family, therefore, Jenny is doing her best to succeed in her business. To make this possible, she would like a loan of PHP 4,000 from Kiva lenders. With additional capital, she can improve her business and make it more profitable. This will allow her to continue to support the education of her children as she really wants them to finish their studies.

Jenny has four children and three of them are already studying. The eldest is Baby Jane who is now 12 years-old. Jayson is 9 years-old, R-Jay, 7 years-old and their youngest is Jerald, 5 years-old.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Marito

texts.en: Marito T. is from the village of Sabangan, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. He is 56 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Marito owns and operates a fishing business using his own aid and pump boat (an outrigger canoe). He has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Marito joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. Marito is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This loan will be his 9th from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his business

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Mrs. Pov M., a farmer living in Mea Neak village in Takeo Province, owns 5 hectares of land upon which she cultivates rice.  Because she does not have enough money to buy more rice seeds to cultivate, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Vy Chhaem, is a fisherman who can make a small income to support the family. The couple has two children, one attending the local school while the other, three years of age, is yet too young to study.

loans.use: To buy more rice seeds to cultivate

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy J., 43 years old, is a rice farmer. She works very hard to be able to support the needs of her family. She likes growing crops, which is the reason why she enjoys working all day under the heat of the sun. She guards her rice field every day. She wants to plant other crops to supplement their daily income.

She is asking for a loan of Php 7,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to buy all the farming necessities to be able to increase the usual size of her harvest.

She said that she likes the program of CEVI. It’s not difficult for the borrowers since the loan has only 2% interest rate a month.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Mutabarhon

texts.ru: Абдуллоева Мутабархон проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 44 года. замужем, имеет 3 детей. Муж находится в России на заработках. Сама Мутабархон более 12 лет занимется торговлей на рынке, она в основном торгует продуктами питания. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
A. Mutabarhon lives in Rumi. She is 33 years old and married, with three children. Her husband is in Russia earning money. Mutabarhon herself has been trading on the market for over 12 years, chiefly in groceries. She asks for a loan in order to increase the turnover of the goods she sells.

Translated from Russian by Anastasia Uglova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the turnover of the goods she sells

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.en:
Karla began selling plastic bags 10 years ago when she worked in the market. Her mother also sold bags and although Karla started on her own, her mother has been supportive. Nearly everything that is sold comes in plastic bags. In the markets these bags are used as the only packaging material and are often reused in a business and around the house. Karla dreams of having a more established location for her business; for the moment she sells her bags on foot, walking from vendor to vendor.

Karla has a long relationship with Fundación León 2000 and has been able to manage six loans for both her business and personal use. Karla will use this loan for the purchase of more plastic bags of various sizes.

Karla is 28 years old, is married, and has three children, ages 11, 7, 3. The youngest isn’t in school yet, but the older children are in 5th and 2nd grade, respectively.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Copacabana Group

texts.es: “Copacabana” es un grupo de 10 señoras que asisten a sus reuniones en el Centro Focal “Santiago II”,  se agruparon por  la necesidad de acceder al préstamo ya que todas necesitan incrementar su capital de trabajo dedicándose a la venta de productos de belleza, cereales, tostado de arveja, venta de carne, jugos y artesanía en joyas. Ellas están concientes de que tienen varias competidores y tienen que ser mejores que ellos, atendiendo a las clientas de la mejor manera y ofreciendo productos de calidad. Todas comparten un rico plato ya que les gusta confraternizar y sentirse en familia.
texts.en:
Copacabana is a group of ten women who attend their meetings at the Santiago II community center. They got together out of the necessity to access a loan. All of them need to increase their working capital. They sell beauty products, cereals, roasted peas, meat, juice, and jeweled handicrafts. They know that they have various competitors, and that they have to be better than their competition by giving their customers the best service and offering quality products. They all share a delicious dish because they like to socialize and feel like they are a family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital to buy merchandise

loans.name: Alicia Mabel

texts.es:
La señorita Alicia Mabel M. O. tiene 24 años y actualmente vive en Cochabamba en la zona sur, en una Zona conocida como Pucarita Chica. Ella es soltera y vive actualmente con su hermana y mama. 

Alicia es productora de leche cruda, la cual después vende a una empresa que elabora diferentes productos lácteos. Alicia se dedica a la producción de leche cruda hace mas de 6 años, en realidad ella se hace cargo también porque su mama ya es mayor de edad y no puede con el manejo del ganado lechero, su hermana ayuda a Alicia con el cuidado del ganado todas las tardes después del colegio. Alicia solicita el crédito para poder comprar un terreno en la zona donde vive para poder sembrar alimento para el ganado (chala). Esto le ayudara puesto que la chala es muy cara y sembrando ella le saldrá mucho más barato. 

El mayor sueño de Alicia es poder incrementar su producción de leche y sus ingresos de forma que pueda ayudar a su hermana  a entrar a la universidad y mejora la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
Alicia Mabel M. O. is 24 years old and lives in the southern part of Cochabamba in an area known as Pucarita Chica. She is single and currently lives with her sister and mother.

Alicia produces raw milk which she sells to a company that makes a variety of dairy products. She has been doing this for more than 6 years, taking over the business from her mother who is old and can no longer manage the cows. Alicia's sister helps her care for the cows every afternoon when she gets home from high school.

Alicia is requesting a loan to be able to purchase a plot of land where she will plant food for her cattle. This will help her as the feed is very expensive and by growing it herself she will save money.

Alicia's big dream is to be able to increase milk production and thereby her income so that she can both help her sister go to college and make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a plot of land

loans.name: Silvio Antonio

texts.es: Silvio tiene varios financiamientos con Fundación León 2000, pues se siente muy bien al realizar una nueva experiencia pues cada uno son diferentes experiencias. Su actividad económica es ofrecer el servicio de joyería, el un hombre muy responsable y disfruta de su negocio. Hace más de 17 años que se dedica a este negocio, el tiene que proporcionarle a sus 2 hijos y a su esposa él es un hombre dedicado a su familia. Además solicita este financiamiento con el fin de obtener lo suficiente en materia prima ya que ha tenido muchos pedidos recientemente por lo que tiene varios clientes. El deseo de Silvio es mejorar las condiciones de su local ya que es muy pequeño y le gustaría ampliarlo.
texts.en:
Silvio has received a number of loans from Fundación León 2000, and he is very happy to have had this series of new and different experiences because each loan was unique. His business is the creation and sale of jewelry. He is a very responsible man who truly enjoys his work. He has had this business for more than 17 years. He is the primary provider for his wife and two children, and he is very dedicated to his family. He is seeking this loan to purchase enough raw materials to satisfy the many recent orders he has received from his large client base. Silvio's dream is to improve the conditions of his store – it is very small and he would like to expand it.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital - raw materials for jewelry

loans.name: Aydee Antonia

texts.es:
Aydee tiene 45 años, es casada y tiene tres hijos. Aydee es profesora y trabaja en el colegio “Narciso Arastegui” de la ciudad de Huaro del departamento del Cusco. La ciudad de Huaro se encuentra a treinta minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. Aydee nos cuenta que de lunes a viernes viaja a la ciudad de Huaro a las  6:30am y permanece en su trabajo desde las 7:00 a.m. hasta las 2 p.m. Aydee por las tardes atiende su pequeño negocio de venta de utensilios de cocina en el mercado. Aydee requiere el préstamo de S/. 1,000 para comprar jarras. Aydee se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

Aydee pertenece al banco comunal “Inti” de la Asociación Arariwa. 
(Inti es una palabra del idioma quechua que traducido al castellano significa Sol)
texts.en:
Aydee, 45, is married and has three children. She is a teacher who works at "Narciso Arastegui" school in Huaro, which is in Cusco department. Huaro is 30 minutes away from Cusco. Aydee tells us that she travels to Huaro at 6:30am every day, Monday through Friday, and stays at her job from 7am until 2pm. In the afternoons, Aydee tends to her small kitchen utensil sales stall in the market. Aydee needs a 1000 sol loan to buy jugs. She is grateful for the opportunity provided her by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion. Aydee is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Inti" communal bank. (Inti is a quechua word that means Sun)

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jugs.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en: Twenty-year-old Janice wants to develop her business skills. She manages a rice farm in her hometown in Agusan Del Sur. To finance her farm, she used to borrow money from lenders who charged high interest rates. She said that because of it, earning was really hard for her. Now that she is a member of CEVI, a Kiva partner, she is hoping to earn more because of the lower interest rate offered. She requested a loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used for purchasing farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers. She hopes to have an abundant harvest to help her family with their finances.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Five Sisters Group

texts.en:
Cecelia M. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called Five Sisters. She is 38 years old, single and has two children who are 9 and 15 years old. She was only able to attend school through high school.

For 13 years, Cecelia has been selling dry meat at the Red Light market, which is the largest market in Liberia. She sells good quality dry meat in a friendly manner which keeps customers returning. 
 
Cecelia plans to use her portion of 12,000 Liberian dollars of this 36,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more dry meat. Her goal is to expand her business and to improve her family's living standards.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Cecelia is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more dry meat

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es: Florencia, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora de 53 años, quien comparte su vida a lado de su esposo Hilario de 52 años en su casa propia, ambos tienen 5 hijos, siendo todos mayores de edad e independientes con sus propias familias. Desde hace 45 años se dedica a la agricultura y del que tiene mayor influencia para la toma de decisiones, y por el que tiene gran apoyo de su esposo. Es así que controla el trabajo que desempañan los operarios, que se encargan del cuidado de sus siembras de maíz, papa y todo tipo de verduras que cultiva en sus terrenos propios. Pese a una enfermedad que le impide realizar trabajos forzosos, pero ello no impide que deje de trabajar en la producción de sus siembras. Mientras que su esposo tiene un taller de cerrajería en un local alquilado, en donde fabrica además puertas y ventanas, pero en sus momentos libres trabaja junto a Florencia en las chacras. Lo que más le gusta es regar sus cultivos, según refiere, se distrae mucho el ver correr el agua por los surcos, sin embargo la parte más difícil de su trabajo, es lavar betarraga y coliflor para luego ser trasladados al mercado de su ciudad. De las ganancias que obtuvo en estos tiempos, ayudó a instalar el taller a su esposo, es por eso que ambos desean mas adelante ampliar este taller y contar con más equipos que faciliten el trabajo de cerrajero, siendo su mayor anhelo instalar una ferretería o distribuidora de fierros. Este es décimo crédito con MFP, por lo que espera concretar su objetivo, además se muestra muy orgullosa de continuar trabajando con su grupo comunal, ya que le ha permitido progresar junto a su familia, aprendiendo a invertir bien el crédito que obtiene. Entretanto solicita tres mil nuevos soles para comprar 12 sacos de fertilizantes, a la vez que terminará de techar su casa, por lo que comprará 120 planchas de calamina y clavos.
texts.en:
Florencia is 53 years old and a cheerful hardworking woman who shares her life with her husband Hilario, age 52. They live in their own home. She has five grown children who are all independent and have their own families.

For 45 years Florencia has been farming and holding a major influence on the decision making, since she has great support from her husband. She supervises the work of her laborers who are charged with looking after the crops of corn, potatoes, and other vegetables that are grown on her land. Even though an illness prevents her from performing strenuous activity, this does not keep her away from the production of her crops. Her husband operates a locksmith shop in a rented location, where he also manufactures door and windows. In his spare time, he helps Florencia with the work in the fields.

What she enjoys most is irrigating her crops because, according to her, the sight of running water flowing through the furrows helps to distract her. However, the most difficult part of her job is washing the beets and cauliflower before they are taken to the city market. From the profits she has earned, Florencia was able to establish her husband’s shop. They both want to expand this business so that he will have more equipment to facilitate his work as a locksmith. Their greatest wish is to open a hardware store or an iron distribution center.

Florencia is taking her tenth loan with MFP and hopes to achieve her goal. She is also very proud to be continuing her work with her Communal Bank, which led to making progress alongside her family and learning how to invest her loan proceeds. With this loan of 3000 PEN, she will purchase twelve sacks of fertilizer. In order to finish the roof of her house, she will also buy nails and 120 sheets of corrugated metal.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers for her fields & corrugated metal and nails to finish the roof of her house

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 56 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Hugo (56) y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila.El negocio al que Rosa se dedica, es la venta D. cuyes, gallinas y patos, a los cuales tiene bien alimentados y cuidados. Su puesto esta ubicado en el mercado mayorista D. la ciudad, donD. tiene muchos clientes y las ganancias diarias son muy buenas. Ella trabaja junto a su esposo y los dos se han encargado D. sacar adelante el negocio. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo, es alimentar a sus animales, ya que los cría con mucho cariño; lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil, es tener que permanecer en su puesto todo el día en espera D. clientes. Para el futuro, planea incursionar en el negocio D. la ganadería.Este es el sétimo préstamo D. Rosa, y  sabe que tiene que pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y responsable.Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará alimento para sus animales menores, ya que sabe que tiene que tenerlos bien alimentados, si quiere recibir un buen precio por ellos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 56 years old, a very hardworking and happy woman who lives in her own home with her husband Hugo (56). Her biggest wish is to grow old peacefully. Rosa makes a living selling guinea pigs, chickens and ducks, which she has well taken care of and fed. Their stand is located in a wholesale market of the city, where she has many customers and her daily income is very good. She works with her husband and the two of them have kept the business going. What she likes the most about her work is the feeding of the animals, as she raises them with much affection. She has been in this business for 4 years and she finds most difficult the having to spend all day at her stand waiting for customers. In the future she would like to get into the cattle business. This is the seventh loan for Rosa and she knows that she has to pay her installments on time and is prepared to do so. She is a very happy and responsible member of her community bank. She will use the requested thousand new Soles to purchase feed for her young animals, she know that she needs to keep them well fed if she wants to get a good price for them.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of feed for animals.

loans.name: Sovan

texts.en:
Sovan S., 42, is married and resides with his wife and four children in Battambong Province, Cambodia, an area known for good quality rice products. He is a motor-taxi driver and is able to earn an income of about USD 5 per day. His wife provides laundry services in her village, earning an income of USD 2 per day to help cover the family expenses.  

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a new motorbike because his motorbike is old and consumes a lot of gasoline.  This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Nanteza Annet is twenty-four years old, and she is a hard-working businesswoman, married and blessed with two children. She owns a clothing business in Kalisizo town council. Her business deals with clothes for all stages and both sexes. She is using the loan to purchase a stock of clothes for sale. Her future hope is to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of clothes for sale

loans.name: Chhorn

texts.en: Mrs. S., 26, has a job cultivating rice and vegetable crops for a profit, while her husband works with her on the farm. This couple got married some years ago, but they have no children yet. S. currently plants mushrooms which she will harvest and sell when they mature. S. will be using her first loan from Kiva to buy a small place where she will grow crops for extra income.

loans.use: To buy a small place where she will grow crops for extra income

loans.name: Victor Edgar

texts.es: El solicitante se dedica al comercio de ropa por mas de 8 años en un local alquilado. Vive en una casa familiar de una tia, tiene 2 hijos uno de ellos estudia en la universidad y el otro vive con su madre en la ciudad de Nazca. El destino del credito es para incremento de capital
texts.en:
Victor has been selling clothing for more than eight years from a rented location. He lives at his aunt’s house. Victor has two children, one is studying at the university and the other lives with his mother in the city of Nazca. This loan will be used to increase his capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase his operating capital

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida B. is from the village of Valencia Bukidnon. She is 46 years old. Leonida is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Leonida owns & operates a business making & selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Leonida has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Leonida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Leonida is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Leonida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en:
Encarnacion B. is from the village of Dadda, Tuguegarao City. She is 57 years old, married, and has six school-aged children. To make a living, she raises pigs for breeding. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately $90 when she sells her raised pig.

In 2005, Encarnacion joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. Encarnacion is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase feed for the pigs. This will be her 11th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to continue to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed

loans.name: Chanthou's Group

texts.en: Six people selected Mrs. Chanthou C. as this group's leader. She was born in 1965. The group is located in Chonloat Dai village, Takeo province. All the members are requesting a group loan and they will use their portions of the loan in varied ways to support their businesses in the current year. Mrs. Chanthou C. is a tailor at her home and this allows her to earn some money to support her family. She is also a dessert seller and her husband, Mr. La Luy, is a construction worker. They try to work hard but they can only earn a little money. So to improve this condition, Mrs. Chanthou C. is applying for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business. She is a mother of two children who all both studying in school.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding to start a new business

loans.name: Maguette

texts.fr:
Madame Maguette DIOP est âgée de 39 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de 04 autres enfants qui lui sont confiés par des proches. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de WALIDANE depuis le 19 novembre 2004 et a 11 fois de suite reçu de crédit.

Elle développe un petit commerce de friperie, de chaussures et de parfums. Comme activité secondaire elle fait de l'embouche ovine.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'acheter de la friperie, des chaussures, des parfums et deux moutons.

Elle a comme objectif de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille par exemple acheter de la nourriture et payer des frais médicaux.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maguette DIOP is 39 years old. She is married and a mother to five children. She also has four other children entrusted in her care by relatives. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of WALIDANE since November 19, 2004 and has been granted 11 consecutive loans. She has a small business selling used clothing, shoes and perfumes. She also fattens sheep as a sideline. Her new loan will enable her to buy used clothes, shoes, perfumes, and two sheep. Her goal is to help improve her family’s living conditions by providing food and covering medical expenses.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy used clothes, shoes and perfumes, and two sheep

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa P. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 42 years old. Leonisa is married and has 6 children. To make a living, Leonisa owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making "puto" (rice cakes) and other delicacies for sale. Leonisa has been engaged in her business for over 5 years.

Leonisa joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonisa has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Leonisa is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the second loan taken out by Leonisa from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Edwin Javier

texts.es:
El sr. Edwin Vásquez se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de achinería de manera ambulante en la Terminal de transportes de la ciudad de Danli, actividad a la que se dedica desde hace tres años. 
El vende una gran variedad de productos los que adquiere en la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, ya que viaja una vez por semana para la compra de mercadería.
Edwin es una persona que se ha sabido ganar a sus clientes por la amabilidad con que los atiende, también se dedica a la venta de artículos para la cocina como ser juegos de ollas, los cuales vende en diferentes partes de esta ciudad y estos productos los vende al crédito por lo que deja un día a la semana para recuperar dichos pagos.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar auticulos varios y ollas.
Don Edwin Vásquez es casado,  su esposa es ama de casa, producto del matrimonio ellos tienen tres hijos los que dependen económicamente de ellos.
actualmente sus hijos están cursando sus estudios primarios.
texts.en:
For the past three years, Edwin Vásquez has been a traveling salesman dedicated to selling small goods in the transportation terminal in the city of Danli. He sells a wide variety of products that he gets from the city of Tegucigalpa and travels once a week to buy the merchandise. Edwin is a man who has known how to gain clients through the friendliness with which he attends to them. He also sells products for the kitchen, such as cookware, which he sells in different parts of the city. He sells these products on credit, so he leaves one day a week to claim these payments. He will use this credit to buy various goods and cookware to sell. Edwin is married, and his wife is a housewife. They have three children in elementary school that depend on them economically.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy flashlights, batteries, carts, pots, combs, toothpaste, brushes, and toys

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok P., 49, and her husband, Ret Kim, 50, live in a small village on National Road Number 2, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They were married in 1979 and have two sons and three daughters, all of whom are married. While one lives in the family home, the other four live outside.

Sok is a farmer; she grows rice and vegetables on her farmland in the village where she lives. Her husband is employed full-time in a company delivering pure drinking water. Sok is asking her first loan of $500 to purchase a trailer to carry vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer to carry vegetable to sell.

loans.name: Sharapiya

texts.en:
Sharapiya M. is the single mother of three daughters. She was the victim of domestic violence, however her life became stable after divorcing her husband. In 2005, in order to find means of subsistence for her children, Sharapiya started a cattle breeding business, and bought bull calves for fattening and reselling. She worked hard and managed to maintain and develop the farm and renovate her house. Also, Sharapiya is fond of cultivating flowers and made her hobby a small source of income. Now Sharapiya wants to use this loan of 60,000 KGS to buy more bull calves and forage for her cattle. With the revenue from this loan, she plans to pay for the education of her daughters. Sharapiya is full of energy and ready for the many achievements coming her way.

Bai-Tushum and Partners use Kiva funding to target especially vulnerable population in Kyrgystan. It is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Stone Quarry Development Group 1-Mukono

texts.en:
30-year-old T. Amos has been a member of the Stone Quarry-Mukono group for the past 5 years. Amos comes across as a gentleman with profound business acumen. His sense of diligence has been an indispensable attribute in these few years building a stone quarrying business. Amos credits his mother with encouraging him to start his business. His wife has been solid support in the business as well. 

Amos’ business has a broad base of clientele. He makes 200,000 UGX per month in profits. Amos is requesting a loan to buy more stones to supply to his increasing clientele.

loans.use: The purchase of more stones to resell to clients

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 32 years old and married with three children.  She has been in business for three years selling used clothing in a good and busy environment in Machakos.  Mary is a member of Loyal group that has guaranteed her loan of KES 25,000.  

With this loan, Mary wants to add to her stock of used clothing.  She also practices farming and sells vegetables from her farm to earn extra income. She hopes to grow her business into a boutique and also get to a level of selling clothes wholesale.  She describes herself as organized.

loans.use: To add stock of used clothing.

loans.name: Keysis Elizabeth

texts.es:
Keysis, es una joven de 22 años de edad, reside en Delicias de Concepción, es soltera y vive con su madre y su hermana, desde hace 6 años se dedica al negocio de las tortillas, su hermana y su madre le ayudan a la preparación de las tortillas y para venderlas ella viaja a Osicala un pueblo cercano, por que este tiene mayor afluencia de gente y es mayor la oportunidad para vender todo, también cuando los vecinos cercanos le buscan les vende.
Ella necesita un préstamo para la compra de maíz y leña, para poder hacer más venta ya que en ocasiones es mucha la demanda.
Su visión es conseguir a través del trabajo de las tortillas la construcción de  su propia casa.
texts.en:
