Keysis is a young 22 year-old woman who lives in Delicias de Concepción.  She is single and lives with her mother and sister.  She has been in the tortilla business for 6 years.  Her sister and her mother help her to prepare her tortillas.  She travels to Osicala, a nearby town, to sell them because there are more people in that town and she has a better chance of selling everything.  Her close neighbors often come to buy from her too.

Keysis needs a loan to buy corn and firewood so that she can make more tortillas because there is often a high demand.

Her wish is to build her own home with the profits she makes from her tortilla business.

loans.use: To buy corn and firewood

loans.name: Ngandu Kisombya Development Group-Mukono

texts.en:
40-year-old N. Annet has for the last 11 years been engaged in a modest pig husbandry business in Ngandu-Mukono. Apprentice training at a friend's farm in many respects is where she got the skills and knowledge about this business. 

Annet, who is happily married with four children, says her side business raising poultry has been of paramount importance, especially as regards the addition to her profits. What has brought success to pass in her operations however, has been her hard work and devotion. Weekly her profits are to the tune of shillings 70,000 and with this loan, she says she is going to buy more piglets to raise and at length resell when they grow.

loans.use: The purchase of piglets

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is 27 years old and is married with two children between 1 and 3 years old.  Jean Baptiste has been a motorbike taxi driver for three years. He gets up at 5 am and works until 10 pm every day to transport people around the city.  

Jean Baptiste has requested a loan worth 500,000 Rwf to buy his own motorbike taxi. His goal is to buy a house for the family.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Ol

texts.en:
Ol T. has spent her life cultivating crops. This is a skill she learned from her grandparent when she single. She is now married and has four kids; three are single and one is married. Two of their children are employed in various occupations, and getting a proper salary every month. Her husband frequently works alongside her in the fields. 

Growing crops is an annual activity with which she has had great success. She is able to plant at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. Recently, an existing motorcycle of Ol T.’s child has broken down during use. Ol T. will use her loan to add to her savings for her child to buy a new motor in order to replace the broken one.

loans.use: To replace a motorcycle engine

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and school fees.

Khaled has been selling clothes and shoes from home to her neighbours for the past two years. In addition, she sells soft drinks which provides another source of income. Khaled faces a major challenge due to seasonal variability and the high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to start another business and increase her income. With this loan of 15,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to start a fish selling business and purchase a bundle of fish to sell. She decided to join Yehu because of the efficiency of the service.

loans.use: To start a fish selling business and purchase a bundle of fish for resale

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.en:
Mr. Miguel Angel R. C. is a happily married man with his own house that has all the necessities you'll find in a home. He is a micro-entrepreneur who owns a general store called "Nueva Esperanza" (New Hope).

He has been in business for four years, which allows him to have very good clientele and income.

He requested a loan for 4,386,356 PYG to purchase goods, oil, flour, sugar and yerba brought from across the border in Posadas Misiones, Argentina, which allows for the cost go down and profit to go up.

loans.use: To purchase goods, oil, flour, sugar, yerba, etc.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita A. is from the village of Kabuhi, Pandan, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 60 years old. Lolita is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Lolita runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and beverages. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Lolita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, such as canned goods and beverages. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Lolita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, such as canned goods and beverages

loans.name: Cornelio

texts.es:
El señor Cornelio I. tiene ya más de 29 años dedicándose a la preparación y venta de platillos de mariscos. 
A su negocio le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de alimentos y algo de inmobiliario pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión. Es por eso que esta solicitando su cooperación en este crédito. 
Planea pagar el préstamo con las ganancias que obtiene del negocio, ya que el vive solo y este negocio es la fuente que tiene de ingresos para el.
texts.en: Mr. Cornelio I. has been preparing and selling seafood dishes for over 29 years.  The business needs more variety of food and some furniture and equipment but he lacks the necessary funds for the investment which is why he’s asking for your cooperation in this loan.  He plans to repay the loan with profits from the business since he lives alone and the business is his source of income.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Edamire

texts.en:
Edamire P. is from the village of Santa Cruz, Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 40 years old. Edamire is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Edamire owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, shampoos, soaps and beverages in the local community. She also sells coconuts and bananas. Edamire has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 16000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Edamire joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and to fund working capital for her business. 

Edamire is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional bananas, coconuts and canned goods to sell. This loan will be her 10th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to stock bananas, coconuts and some  goods to sell

loans.name: Nancy Achieng

texts.en:
Nancy O. is 32 years old and is married as a third wife to Richard Owino who is a policeman. They have two children, one in class eight and the other one in class five.

Nancy has a business of selling cereals and has been in this business for the past 13 years. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy wheat, cassava, rice, beans and groundnuts to add to the stock. 

The profits made from her business will be used to cater for the family's upkeep and pay her children's school fees. She hopes to own a big cereals shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy wheat, cassava, rice, beans and groundnuts

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet N. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has one child.  None of her children is currently in school.  Annet has a small retail shop, which she has had for four years.         

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities like sugar for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Annet hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes buy food.  In the future, Annet hopes to study a course on hairdressing. Annet is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities like sugar for resale.

loans.name: New Hope Group

texts.es: La Sra. Elvira   es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar  y tiene 33 años D. edad, actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Nueva esperanza” grupo  conformado por 11  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades D. comercio. Elvira  trabaja desD. hace  4  años en la venta D. comida  en un puesto en el mercado, este trabajo surge a raíz D. que el sueldo D. su esposo no alcanzaba para cubrir los gastos básicos D. su hogar , servicio, educación , alimentación, es asi que Elvira pone su negocio con el deseo D. salir adelante y darle lo mejor a sus hijos, gracias a su esfuerzo  y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos, ha construido su casa, y sus hijos reciben educación privada y sobre todo tienen una mejor calidad D. vida . El préstamo que se le otorgo fue para comprar mercadería.  Sabemos que Elvira  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos D. Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en: Elvira is married common-law and she has 2 school-aged children. She is 33 years old and she is a member of the communal bank named "New Hope". The group is maD. up of 11 members who are involved in a variety of business activities. Elvira has been selling prepared foods at a stand in the market for the past 4 years. This business came about because her husband's income was not enough to cover the basic household expenses, including utilities, education, and food. Elvira started her business from a wish to move forward and to proviD. the best for her children. Thanks to her effort and dedication she has earned a better income. She has built her house and her children are in private school, but above all they enjoy a better quality of life. The loan that was granted to her was to purchase merchandise. We know that Elvira will achieve her goals through hard work and effort and the loans from Edaprospo (Kiva Field Partner) will help her do that.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to prepare foods.

loans.name: Diappo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Diappo a été créé le 15 Novembre  2006. Il est composé de  huit femmes. Elles ont toutes comme activité principale le petit commerce. Elles  habitent le même quartier.

Madame Mariètou  (debout en deuxième position à droit) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 60 ans, est  mariée et mère de six enfants. Elle a en charge une belle sœur.

Elle vend des tissus teintés au marché central. Elle a une expérience de quatre années.

Son nouveau lui permettra de s’approvisionner en tissus, en vue de les revendre.

Avec les bénéfices réalisés, elle compte soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Diappo group was established on November 15, 2006. It comprises eight women, whose main business is retail. They live in the same neighborhood.

Mrs. Mariètou (standing, second position from the right) is the group leader. She's 60 years old, married, and the mother of six children. She also has a sister-in-law to support.

She's been selling dyed fabrics at the central market for four years. Her new loan will enable her to purchase fabrics to resell.

With her profits, she intends to help her husband provide for the children's school expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics to resell

loans.name: Luis Armando

texts.es:
Luis Armando tiene 25 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y los hijos, vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SEÑOR DE LA SALUD, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Soloma, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandia, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz

Luis se dedica a la agricultura la siembra de maíz y arroz, las compras las realiza en Ventanas y las vende en las ferias de todos los días en especial  la de los domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos  y la variación del clima. Su sueño es comprar tres cuadras de terreno.

Le gusta hacer deporte todos los dias.
texts.en:
Luis Armando is 25 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children. He resides in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The members of the Communal Bank “Señor de La Salud” (Lord of Health) meet in the neighborhood of Recinto Soloma, which is part of the canton of Echeandia. The members of this Communal Bank are short-cycle farmers who grow corn and rice.

Luis is a farmer who grows corn and rice. His purchases are made in Ventanas and he sells at the fairs every day, especially on Sundays.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and compost. The support from this loan will help him financially acquire the supplies he needs. Among the challenges he faces are pests, crop diseases, and changes in weather. His dream is to buy three plots of land.

Luis enjoys playing sports every day.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and compost.

loans.name: Mesaidi

texts.en:
Mesaidi is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in her own house, which has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are her children’s school fees.

For the past two years, Mesaidi has operated a retail business, selling from her home to her neighbors and passersby.  She also sells clothes, which contributes to her income. She dreams of expanding her business and becoming self-reliant in the future.   With her KES 25,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, kikoys and shoes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, kikoys and shoes for sale.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen and his wife, Melinda, started their League City, Texas-based business, Publish-ME.com, LLC, after they realized their hobby of publishing free software online had the potential to earn them a profit. Two and a half years ago, Stephen decided to turn his long-time website, which offered free and safe software downloads, into a business by opening up advertising space on it. This was the official start of their business because, as Stephen says, “From day one, it was instantly profitable.” 

Stephen and Melinda’s website, www.safefreesoftware.com, offers their clients eight categories of virus-free software downloads: security, games, video, audio, apps, internet, business and website development. In total, they offer 6,727 programs, which means that a visitor to their site is bound to find something that fits their needs. The high traffic resulting from this diversity of reliable content has contributed to the success of the advertising space offered on the website.

Despite their impressive initial success, Stephen and Melinda are very excited to continue growing their business. Along with continuing to offer reliable software downloads, they are now adding another component to the site that will keep customers informed about the world of software development. Under Melinda’s guidance, the site now has an “editorial” page, which will teach the reader about a certain kind of software each day. With this in mind, the website now boasts that returning customers can “learn something new every day!”

This loan made the new editorial section of the website possible. The remainder of the funds are going to the development of advertising space on other sites to draw in more customers. Stephen says that, though the new developments on the site allow it more traffic from search engines, the daily budget still runs primarily on ads that he and Melinda put on other sites. 

The biggest business successes that publish-ME.com, LLC has seen, according to Stephen and Melinda, are its instant and continued profitability and that is has allowed Melinda to devote herself 100% to her own business. While Stephen still manages another full-time career, Melinda develops the business and writes its content full time. Without this loan, Stephen says that the business would have taken much longer to get to the point that it’s at now; with it, Stephen and Melinda are able to continue expanding their business and providing reliable services to their loyal clientele.

loans.use: to expand his website to include an editorial section and to pay for advertising space

loans.name: Vicenta Aida

texts.es:
En provincia de Manabí encontramos el cantón 24 De Mayo, aquí se reúne el Banco Comunal San José este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Vicenta, tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos, cinco de ellos ya son mayores de edad e independientes, solo la ultima que es menor de edad es quien vive en su casa y estudia en colegio. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Ella tiene una pequeña granja donde cría pollos y chanchos, compra los pollos pequeños en Portoviejo en una incubadora y los mantiene por espacio de dos a tres meses hasta que estén listos y con buen peso, luego los entrega a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa a comprar tanto a los pollos como a los chanchos o si no los lleva a entregar en las tiendas del lugar. Trabaja todos los días en el cuidado de sus animalitos unas tres horas por día pero cuando tiene que vender los pollos a veces trabaja todo el dia, nos cuenta que lleva más de 15 años con su negocio y le va bien a pesar de que a veces ha tenido pérdidas pero ha sabido seguir adelante.

Este crédito lo va a ocupar en comprar pollos, alimento  y medicinas para que tengan un buen desarrollo. Este es su segundo ciclo y está muy a gusto con la institución ya que dice le han ayudado mucho.
 
Su sueño es que su familia goce de buena salud.
texts.en:
In the province of Manabí we find the 24th of May village, which is where the San José cooperative bank meets.  This area is known for its beautiful scenery and for its hard-working residents that primarily dedicate themselves to farming and raising animals.

It is here that we meet Vicenta who is 56 years old, married, and has six children from this relationship.  Five of them are now adults and independent; only the last child is a minor living in their home and studying at school.  Her husband dedicates himself to farming. 

She has a small farm where she raises chickens and pigs.  She buys the chicks in Portoviejo in an incubator, and cares for them for about two to three months until they are ready and at a good weight.  Later, she gives them to merchants who go to her house to buy both the chickens and pigs and, other times, she takes them to the stores in the area.  She works every day caring for her little animals for about three hours per day however, when she has to sell the chickens, she sometimes works all day.  She tells us she has been in business for more than 15 years and things have gone well despite a few losses, but she has known how to continue forward.

She will use this loan to buy chickens, feed, and medicine so they will develop well.  This is her second cycle, and she is very happy with the institution as she states it has helped her a great deal.

Her dream is for her family to enjoy good health.

loans.use: buy chickens, feed and medicines for animals.

loans.name: Prosperidad Y Esperanza Group

texts.en:
Rosa is the coordinator of her group Prosperidad y Esperanza 1 & 3, (prosperity and hope). She lives in a simple structure with her three children. Rosa is a single mother, dedicated to working hard and providing for her family. She said her most difficult challenge is to help her children to go forward with a good education and a safe living.

Rosa is excited about her 4th loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for approximately seven years, starting with her own resources. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by increasing her inventory of beauty products, cosmetics, a blow dryer and other equipment. With this loan, she will be able to expand her business. She will use the profits to save, because she wants to make her dream come true:  To have a store and a bigger beauty salon and spa.

Rosa's group is located in Santiago, an area known for tobacco and beef production. Santiago is the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic.  The group members are dedicated to selling cloth, food, shoes and jewelry. Rosa thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy beauty products, a blow dryer and other equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy fertilizers to improve his agricultural fields and their produce.

loans.name: C2386 Abajyamugambi Group

texts.en:
Annonciata is 45 years old and is married with three children between the ages of 18 and 25 years old. Her business is well-organized and is well-known in this business of selling goods such as rice, sugar, biscuits, etc. She is the team leader of this group which is called "ABAJYAMUGAMBI" in local language.

In the picture, Annonciata is the first person on the left side and she has a document in her hand. Her business hours are from 6am until 5pm every day and she currently employs one person to help her. She has five years of experience in this business.

Annonciata and her team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase their businesses by buying more products (sugar, rice, biscuits, salt and so on) for sale. With any profit, they will reinvest the profits in their businesses and save for their future. Annonciata will also be able to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase more goods such as rice, sugar, biscuits, etc., for sale.

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es:
Martha tiene 25 años es casada y tiene tres hijos los cuales tienen 8, 7 y 3 años de edad; vive con su familia en Atuntaqui que está a 15min de Ibarra. Martha se describe como una persona tranquila y con deseos de salir adelante con su negocio.


Trabaja sola en la confección de sacos. Es la primera vez que trabaja con FODEMI y el crédito que solicita es para la compra de materia prima (hilo) para la confección de sus sacos lo cual aumentará su producción y mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Su sueño es ser una microempresaria exitosa y poder emplear a personas que más necesiten.
texts.en:
Martha is 25 years old, married and has three children who are 8, 7 ​​and 3 years old.  She lives with her family in Atuntaqui, which is 15 minutes from Ibarra.  Martha is described as a peaceful person with desires to move forward with her business.

Martha works alone in making bags. This is her first time working with FODEMI and the requested loan is for the purchase of raw material (yarn) for making her bags.  The loan will increase her production and improve the quality of life for her and her family.

Martha's dream is to become a successful microentrepreneur and be able to employ people who most need it.

loans.use: to purchase raw material (yarn) for making bags.

loans.name: Abdujabor

texts.ru: Абдучабор умный и целеустремленный человек. Он женат и  любящий отец 4 детей. Он занимается транспортными услугами более 8 лет. От данного бизнеса он получает хороший прибыль.  Раньше он взял автомобиля марки «Газель» в аренду и продолжал свой бизнес. Постепенно зарабатывая денег, он купил себе автомобиль для своего бизнеса. Абдучабор хотел бы получить займ для покупка запчастей для своего автомобиля.
texts.en: Abdujabor is a smart and goal-oriented man. He is married and a loving father of four children. He has been running a profitable taxi business for the last 8 years. At first he was renting a "Gazelle" car as his taxi vehicle, but after saving money for a while he was able to purchase his own car. Abdujabor would like to take out a loan to purchase spare parts fro his vehicle.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
Rodolfo, esta tramitando un nuevo prestamo, porque quiere invertir en mercaderia, para ir surtiendo de productos plasticos y ropa.
El préstamo sera para incrementar el negocio una parte en ropa (blusas, camisas formales, ropa interior) y productos plásticos para tener más variedad y darles una mejor atención a los clientes.
Estos prestamos le han servido muchisimo, para poderse desarrollar en el mercado como comerciante, le han dado una mejor estabilidad.
texts.en:
Rodolfo is requesting a new loan because he would like to invest in merchandise.  He would like to stock his business with plastic products and clothes.  This loan will be used to increase his business- some will be spent on clothes (blouses, formal shirts, underwear) and some on plastic products - so that he has a better variety of merchandise and can provide his customers with a better service.

These loans have been very helpful indeed to Rodolfo.  They have helped him to develop as a salesman and have given him better stability.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, trousers, undergarments, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 
Concepcion has a pigpen where she raises and sells pigs. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 13,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs.
Concepcion has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Concepcion hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Selene

texts.es:
Selene sigue participando en el banco comunal “San Isidro de Compone” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Selene sigue con el negocio de la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas, ella también sigue con la venta de leche. Selene con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho con el negocio. 

En esta oportunidad Selene requiere el préstamo para comprar cuyes y gallinas. 
 
Selene se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Selene continues participating in the San Isidro de Compone communal bank, a member organization of Kiva field partner, Arariwa Microfinance, in the city of Cusco. She continues with her business raising small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens. She also continues to sell milk.  Selene’s previous loan went very well and she was able to make a good profit. Consequently, she would like another loan since it would greatly help her business.

On this occasion, Selene requires a loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

Selene is grateful for the opportunity provided to her through this process and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Dan

texts.es: Dan, de 38 años, es un hombre honesto, trabajador y sobre todo muy responsable. Vive en compañía de su pareja y de su hijo de trece años, en casa de su suegra. Lo único que desea es brindar una buena educación y una mejor calidad de vida. EL trabajo de Dan consiste en el transporte de pasajeros y a veces de algunas cargas dentro y fuera de la ciudad. Es así que desde muy temprano sale en busca de sus eventuales pasajeros. Tiene trece años realizando esta actividad y gracias ello pudo tener una profesión que hoy es docente en una escuela primaria de la ciudad. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede realizar dos actividades al mismo tiempo, le esta yendo bien ya que genera doble ingresos en su hogar. Su anhelo es comprar uun moto taxi más. Este será el primer crédito con la institución MFP, espera que le pueda ir bien y que los demás integrantes de su grupo lo apoyen en el proceso de inserción a su grupo solidario, espera trabajar juntos por más tiempo y poder progresar juntos. Con el monto solicitado, comprará piezas para la arreglar su vehiculo, además compraró toldo, llantas y pagará al mecánico que le hará todo el trabajo de restauración a su mototaxi.
texts.en:
Dan, 38 is an honest, hardworking and, above all, responsible man. He lives with his wife and their 3-year-old son in his in-laws' house. All that he wants is to give his soon a good education and a better quality of life. Dan works in passenger transport and occasionally carries cargo in and out of the city. He leaves very early in search of passengers. He has been doing this for 13 years and thanks to this now has a profession, as a teacher at a primary school in the city. What he likes about his work is that he can have 2 jobs at the same time. It's going well, because he can generate double the income for his home. His dream is to buy another motorcycle taxi.

This will be his first loan with MFP, and he hopes that it will go well and that the other members of his group will support him in the process of joining this united group. He hopes to work together for awhile and to move forward together. With the amount requested he will buy parts to fix his vehicle, as well as a sunshade and tires, and will pay the mechanic for his work fixing the motorcycle taxi.

loans.use: to buy repair parts, a sunshade and tires, and to pay a mechanic.

loans.name: Liela

texts.en: Liela is a married woman with five sons and two daughters. She is a Web Page designer and wants to purchase a new laptop for business purposes to increase and improve her income. The amount of money she has isn't enough to pay for the laptop, so she needs to take a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. When Liela gets the loan, she will be able to purchase the new laptop and improve her work and increase her income. This will help her provide better living conditions for the family. Liela is a conservative woman, so her son who is 18 years old is photographed instead.

loans.use: To purchase new a laptop for business purposes.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce sells fried eggs and sweet potatoes at Watreso. She is married with 5 dependants. She has done this for 5 years now. Joyce uses her income to assists her husband to provide for their family. 

Joyce will use her loan to buy eggs and sweet potatoes in bulk for resale. With the new profits, Joyce plans to expand her business.

loans.use: buy eggs and sweet potatoes in bulk for resale

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene is a married woman from the town of Luna, in the province of Isabela, Philippines. She and her husband are both farmers who primarily grow crops of rice to sell. Marlene has requested a loan amounting to PHP 50,000 to purchase quality seeds, fertilizer, and other farming supplies.

Marlene does her best to improve their business and take care of their children. She hopes to have a bigger farm in the future, and to help improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase quality seeds, fertilizer, and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Chhouk

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhouk is 39 years old and a mother of two single children. She operates a business in front of a pagoda in Pouk district. She sells porridge and beef soups with noodles to the people in her community, from which she is able to earn an average of $3.00 per day. There are many customers who come to eat breakfast at her store because Mrs. Chhouk is a good cook, and makes tasty foods to serve them. 

At the present Mrs. Chhouk would like to borrow a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy a motorcycle to support her in her business, and to avoid taking any taxi service. Mrs. Chhouk will strive to work harder to provide her two children with further education, so that they may find better employment.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to support her in her business.

loans.name: Alassane

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune célibataire qui exerce dans la distribution de chaines de télévision par branchement sur câble.Son activité est très rentable du fait de la forte demande des ménages en branchement sur les chaines de télévision.Il emploie ainsi cinq jeunes qui l'assistent dans ses interventions à travers les 30 quartiers de sa ville.Il vit avec ses deux parents et ses frères et sœurs qu'il prend tous en charge tant sur le plan alimentaire, sanitaire que scolaire.Pour renforcer son équipement , il sollicite un prêt de 500 000f afin d'acheter 24 décodeurs, 1 amplificateur et 4 caisses de câble d'une longueur de 1 km 200.Son ambition est d'acheter une voiture pour faciliter ses nombreux déplacements et surtout d'ouvrir sa propre chaîne de télévision.
texts.en: The borrower is a young single man who installs cable for TV. Due to a high demand for cable, this activity is very profitable. He employs 5 young men who help him with these installations in the 30 neighborhood of the city. He lives with his parents, his brothers, and his sisters. He takes care of all of them by paying for their food, medical expenses, and school fees. To increase his stock, he is applying for a 500 000f loan so he can buy 24 decoders, 1 amplifier, and 4 rolls of cable, each 1.2 km long. His ambition is to buy a car to make his many trips easier, but above all, to launch his own television channel.

loans.use: buy 24 decoders, 1 amplifier, and 4 rolls of cable, each 1.2 km long

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria, de 25 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su pareja Silvestre de 33 años y sus  queridos hijos Cresly de 07 años y Eli de 04 años de edad a quienes desea brindar un mejor bienestar. Gloria  y su pareja son el pilar de sus hijos, ya que Gloria desde muy niña sus padres le inculcaron a remover la tierra, es por ello que aprendió a labrarla. Hoy cuenta con 05 hectareas de terreno cultivados con plantas de cacao. En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los peones quienes se encargan de cosechar y trasladar los frutos hasta los tendales. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es caminar por las áreas verdes y respirar aire puro que le brinda la naturaleza. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde su comunidad hasta los centros de acopio ubicados en la ciudad, lugar donde percibe mejores precios por sus productos. Su dificultad radica en no poder contar con suficiente ingreso económico para solventar los pagos por adelantado a los jornaleros quienes le brindan el apoyo con las cosechas y desmonte de malezas; es por ello que acude a los préstamos que facilita la institución MFP. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es sembrar más plantas de café ya que cuenta con terrenos sin cultivar. Este será su crédito numero 01 con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro préstamo con mayor tranquilidad. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles; contratará jornaleros para que lo apoyen en las cosechas de café y deshierbo de malezas.
texts.en:
Gloria, 25, is a very hardworking woman.  She lives in a rented house with her partner Silvestre, 33, and her two beloved children, Cresly, 7, and Eli, 4, whom she wants to give greater well-being.  Gloria and her partner are the pillars of their children because Gloria's parents instilled in her from a young age how to dig in the dirt.  That is how she learned to work the land.

Today she has five hectares of land planted with cacao plants.  During the harvest season she has the help of day laborers who are responsible for harvesting and moving the product to the drying areas.  What she likes most about her job is walking around the green areas and breathing the fresh air that nature gives her.  She considers the most difficult part to be transporting her products from her community to the distribution centers located in the city, where she gets better prices for her products.

Her difficulty is not being able to have enough income to make the payments in advance to the day laborers who help her with the harvests and weeding.  This is how she came to the loans that the MFP institution facilitates.  Her greatest priority now is to plant more coffee plants because she has land for planting.  This will be her first loan with MFP.  She knows that if she pays it on time she will be able to get another loan without worrying.

With the 1,500 PEN she will hire day laborers to help her with the coffee harvest and weeding.

loans.use: to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Mrs. Neang is a 29-year-old married woman who has been living in Prey Chor district. She grows rice and potatoes for her livelihood and she has been in the business for ages. She has been blessed with three children who are single and live together with her in their home. They always assist her to do the farming work when they have free time from school. 

Mrs. Neang would like to acquire some funds from HKL and Kiva to pay for rented farmland. Through using this loan from our lenders, Mrs. Neang will be able to continue running her present business. In the future, she wishes to own a few plots of land herself.

loans.use: to pay for rented farmland.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 40 years old and is married with one child. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Zenaida has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Zenaida is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa is a Babban Gona farmer from Dauro Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realize better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Musa no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to move into a bigger home. Through Babban Gona’s loan he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria. This will help him increase his income considerably. This season Musa has ambitious plans to harvest 100 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Musa  now has the opportunity to ensure that all his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase her farming yields

loans.name: Madam Adjovi Séraphi

texts.en:
Madam Adjovi Séraphine S. was born in 1976 at Kouvé. Married and mother of five (05) children, she is a hair dresser by trade and has opened her own hair dressing workshop “COIFFURE REVELATION” in Lomé. Her good work made her reputation in the area. Moreover, Madam S. has well understood that, in Lomé, the best equipped hair salons are more attended by the customers. So, to attract more customers, she plans to enlarge and equip her hair dressing salon with modern and higher performance materials. Very enterprising, she also wants to sell quality beauty products at her salon. This will provide her additional income to contribute to the needs of her household. The credit of $650 will serve to buy two (02) hair driers and to increase her stock of beauty products and cloths. This ambitious project deserves to be supported.

Mme Adjovi Séraphine S. est née en 1976 à Kouvé. Mariée et mère de 5 enfants, elle est coiffeuse de formation et a ouvert son atelier de coiffure « COIFFURE REVELATION »à Lomé. Son travail bien fait, fait sa réputation dans le quartier. Toutefois, Mme S. l’a si bien compris qu’à Lomé, les salons de coiffure les mieux équipées sont plus fréquentés par les clients. Aussi, œuvre-t-elle en ce sens. Ainsi, pour séduire et attirer davantage sa clientèle, elle prévoit agrandir et mieux équiper son salon de coiffure par de matériels modernes et plus performants. Très entreprenante, elle joint aujourd’hui à son métier de coiffure, le commerce de produits de beauté. Ce qui lui procurera des revenus complémentaires pour contribuer aux besoins de son foyer. Le crédit de $ 650sollicité servira à acheter deux séchoirs et à faire un stock de produits de beauté et de tissus. Cet ambitieux projet mérite d’être soutenu.

loans.use: To buy two hair driers  and storage beauty products and clothes

loans.name: Yuryi

texts.en:
Yuryi is married with one daughter and is the only breadwinner in his family. He runs a small business selling auto parts in one of the local markets in Berdyansk. A convenient location for his kiosk and a good variety of available inventory has contributed to the success of his business. Yuryi is a very committed entrepreneur. His reputation for selling quality parts and knowledge of his customer’s preferences has helped him keep loyal clientele and promoted stable growth for his business. His gross monthly revenue currently amounts to around $3,000. Yuryi is requesting a loan of $500 to help open a second vending kiosk selling auto parts. He is planning to purchase a variety of engine, electrical, suspension, brake, transmission and steering parts to stock in the new kiosk and help meet customer demand for these products. All of the parts, designed and made using high end technology, will be good quality and will help attract many potential customers and auto lovers to Yuryi’s store.

Юрій – одружений, в нього одна дочка. Він один працює з родини. В Юрія бізнес з продажу автозапчастин на місцевих ринках міста Бердянськ. Зручне розташування його кіоску та широкий вибір товарів сприяли успішному зростанню його бізнесу. Юрій – дуже відданий підприємець. Його чудова репутація та розуміння побажань покупців допомогли йому зберегти вірних клієнтів та сприяли стабільному зростанню його бізнесу. Загальний сума доходів Юрія щомісяця складає приблизно 3000 доларів. Юрій просить про позику в 500 доларів для того, щоб відкрити другу торгівельну точку з продажу автозапчастин. Він планує закупити різноманітні запчастини для моторів, підвісок, гальм, коробки передач тощо для того, щоб задовольнити попит клієнтів на ці товари. Усі ці високоякісні запчастини, розроблені згідно з новітніми технологіями, допоможуть привабити потенційних покупців та автолюбителів до крамниці Юрія.

loans.use: To open a new vending kiosk selling auto parts
